Reviews.Title: “A SUPERB SHORT BREAK”
Reviews.Author: Scavenger1426
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this beautiful hotel on the Grand Canal for three nights in April 2012. The decor and style of the hotel was first class. The rooms are named after famous Venetians instead of numbers. There is a suite that looks out on the Canal if you want to treat yourself but our smaller side rooms were more than adequate. There is a little balcony that overlooks the Canal and it is so nice to sit of an evening having a brandy or indeed taking breakfast. The staff are extremely helpful and very friendly. It has more of a "guesthouse" feel to it than a corporate hotel and I got the feeling that they genuinely cared about their visitors. The food was first class and there is plenty. All drinks are reasonably priced compared to the rest of Venice. If you want a top quality hotel fifteen minutes walk from the bus station and five from the railway station then this is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly EXCEPTIONAL Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KareenHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: I was for a number of years a Conceirge/Chef Concierge (Clef d"Or) in 5 star hotels so my expectations for properties can be somewhat unrealistic. From the moment we crossed the threshold of the Hotel Canal Grande and for the rest of our stay it was an absolute delight. From Gianni, the perfect ambassador at the front desk. Giovanna and Anca for their ideas and friendly reception in the evenings. Natasha, Roxana and Majid who made breakfast such a pleasure. There is not a bas room in this hotel and the attendants did an exceptional job. And last but not least, LORENZO The Great! he kept us regaled with stories and information in the evenings as we watched the world go by on the Grand canal. But most important of all he escorted us to the station on his own time, carrying all our luggage, stored our luggage and settled the " old folks" on the train. These truly are a very special group of people. If in future I return to Europe or even pass through I WILL RETURN TO THIS HOTEL just to enjoy this enviroment!

Reviews.Title: “JF”
Reviews.Author: GJF_12
Reviews.Content: When we were instaled in our room, my wife remarked to me that the room didn't have a view of the canal. The bellboy overheard, and 5 minutes later the manager called and asked us if we wanted another room, overlooking the canal, at no additional cost. We accepted, and were given the only room in the hotel with a terrace. It was fabulous. we had drinks every evening on the terrace, and the tourist boats passed by, all the tourists taking our picture as we sat on the lawnchairs, with our feet up, having our drinks. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful. They even arranged to have our heavy suitcases sent to the train station on our way out. Special thanks to Lorenzo. We highly, highly recommend this hotel to all visitors to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Made our Venice Trip memorable”
Reviews.Author: Ananthredy
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to the Junior Suite, Antonio Vivaldi . It was fabulously decorated and very Luxurious. All the staff ( from the front desk to the Kitchen) were very helpful and friendly. They went out of their way to make us feel at home. They let us into their secrets of best places to eat and ways to reach different places faster. The Breakfast spread was one of the best we had in Italy. And not to mention their coffee. Would definitely recomend sitting out on the Patio beside the Canal Grand and eat your breakfast there. Though we had booked our own private taxi ( and not from the Hotel) we had people waiting for us to receive us warmly. The Location is very good if you want to " get lost in Venice ", it definitely is bit away from the Hub of the City San Marco. So you need to make a choice and decide which suits you better. Overall I would definitely recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous all round Hospitality at Hotel Canal Grande”
Reviews.Author: Juju2011_11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a marvelous trip to Venice for Easter and to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary. Well we certainly struck gold, were given the most wonderful room in the hotel exactly as we requested, with a terrasse overlooking the canal and with chilled Prossecco awaiting us on our arrival - flawless attention to detail. We were met by the utterly charming Giovanna who manages and perhaps owns the hotel....her commitment to excellence and her sheer enthusiasm for the job leads me to that conclusion. What a way to arrive in Venice! We felt so at home in this small boutique hotel with its great location. Breakfasts were a feast - gorgeous very fresh pastries with Colomba cake which is served at Easter time (just like Pannetone served at Christmas time). Also a range of cold meats, cheeses, cereals, yoghurts and endless cups of espressos which just seemed to flow from the kitchen with no hint or suggestion that one might have had one's quota - a very generous attitude. Giovanna recommended various excursions, booked us a fabulous Vivaldi Concert in one of the churches near St Mark's Square, which she personally recommended, booked us a great table at the Canal Grande Monaco Hotel restaurant which I highly recommend as a treat. Being from South Africa and living in Edinburgh, we just love any opportunity to sit outside - so we at breakfast outside on the verandah and when it became quite chilly we requested blankets, quite a common practice in SA....nothing was too much effort for the staff at the Hotel Canal Grande (see pic below). We just cant wait to go back again as it was such a memorable stay and honestly, without fault - we travel a lot and I am an experienced event manager with very high standards, so coming from me, it means a lot!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: wormitfriend
Reviews.Content: We had a week in Canal Grande to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and it was the best hotel experience we have ever had in 25 years of extensive travel. The staff are incredibly helpful and welcoming but know just when to offer assistance and when to leave you to make your own decisions. The hotel is immaculate, the location superb and the atmosphere was completely relaxing. Small, but oh so perfectly formed !

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: The most helpful and friendly hotel staff we have ever experienced. Brilliant hotel, very well run and spotlessly clean. Great location for visiting the major sites of interest in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, staff, accommodation, a must stay at!”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: From the welcome to the last goodbye could not faulty it. The staff could not do enough for you, Friendly, informative, helpful, engaging, and happy to recommend restaurants etc.Our first time in Venice, a special birthday for my partner, given an upgrade with a choice of rooms. Room was beautifully furnished and comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and a wide variety of options for all tastes. Sat on their small terrace at the front of the hotel with a glass of presseco watching the boat traffic on the Grand Canal ipassing by, magic. Would highly recommend it and can' wait to return. David Cobby, West Sussex, England

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TabWest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a significant birthday treat! The staff were brilliant nothing was too much trouble. We were offered the room with the terrace for 2 out of our 3 night stay, on our first afternoon in Venice the sun shone and so the terrace was a lovely way to start our stay. All of the resturant suggestions were spot on, with lots of other helpful advice provided if sought. Thank you so much for a lovely stay. Location is great. From the airport you can take the Orange waterbus which drops off at Guglie not to far to walk to the hotel and cheaper than a private water taxi buy a return ticket for 25 euros. Venice is great just to wander around but the number 1 vaperetto is a trip not to be missed. Get off at the second of the St Marks square stops and you can see the Bridge of Sighs from the water. Will return to this hotel, we love Italy and this was the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: b_chuckle
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Venice to initially stay in the Hotel Antiche Figure. When we arrived we were offered a free four-star upgrade to the hotel Canal Grande. We accepted and we were not disappointed. The staff are lovely, as were the rooms. They couldn't do enough for us. Highly recommended but an expensive treat for my birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tanny81
Reviews.Content: My husband chose its sibling 3-star hotel Antiche Figure which from the outside you don't get impressed, but when you get in the service is amazingly professional especially for Venice that is not known for excellent service. The hotel staff happily upgraded us to this 4-star hotel on the following day ipafter we had breakfast. The manager Alessandro was very nice and we were very impressed and delighted by such an amazing service (they escorted us to this hotel and took our luggage), patience and professionalism. All staff had a smile on their faces and were willing to go the extra mile to make you feel at home. Our room was tastefully decorated in a grand Venetian style, Egyptian bath towels, very clean, loved the tv screen in the mirror, the delicious breakfast (you guys helped me have my veggies and fruits portions for each day! Don't miss the blood orange and its capuccino), its location to the vaporetto. Grazie mille Giovana, Giani, Natasha, Alessandros, and the whole team (sorry forgot some names!) for making our trip to Venice indimenticabile!

Reviews.Title: “amazing 1st time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: team_beezoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights there in an amazing room with terrace on the roof. Staff was warm welcoming at arrival, friendey and helpfull. Breakfest is great as well, good start before a day of walking. Location is practical because next to the station and vaporetto stop (ferrovia). We would definitely go there again. A bit expensive but everything is in venice :-)

Reviews.Title: “Just what you are looking for in a hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ubgqv83
Reviews.Content: We attended this hotel for a weekend away recently after becoming engaged. On arrival we were offered a complementary bottle of prosecco to mark the occassion. The hotel is in a perfect location right on the grand canal (as you would expect from the name) and the hotel staff are great. One day after walking around Venice we grabbed a bottle of wine and some nibbles to have near the hotel sitting by the canal. After realising we didn't have a cork screw I asked the hotel staff who bent over backwards to find an opener and to also offer us glasses to take outside and bring back later (a small but very nice touch). Breakfast in the morning is what you expect from a good quality European hotel and was a great way to start the day (meats, cheeses, bread, pastries, fruit, yoghurt, coffee, tea, juices and so forth). The room was also great, air conditioning worked well (a welcome change from our other holidays around Europe!), bathroom was big and the bedroom was quiet at night. Free wi fi was also working well.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 5 star!!”
Reviews.Author: GrimReefer
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 11am straight from the train station with our bags with the hope of leaving the at reception and to go and explore Venice however instead we were upgraded to a canal view room for the first night and told it would be ready for us in 10 mins. I cannot fault the service at this hotel, and it is not difficult to see why it was an award winner! Location is very good, not around the corner from any if the monuments but Venuce is easily navigated on foot and my Wife and I walked from the hotel to San Marco and Rialto Bridge and back again withno worries at all. I would recommend the Hotel Canal Grande without reservation, it is a Gem of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiantang
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. A proper 4* hotel which for Venice is a rarity (as many are in fact less stars than advertised).Â  The location was very good, it's overlooking the grand canal and right by a vaporetto stand. Only 10 min boat ride to Rialto and 20 to San Marco. Vaporettos run all night. Alternatively, one could walk to Rialto in 20 mins or San Marco in 40. The rooms were beautifully decorated though they did not have a bath. If you have money to spare, get the canal view or a room with a balcony. In any event, make sure you request your room in advance as not all are the same. Some have good views, others are located in a different building from the main block. The staff service was great, though they could do with one extra person at reception. The only other downside was breakfast which was 3*.

Reviews.Title: “What a gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Juliejersey66
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Gorgeously decorated rooms. Very conveniently located. Staff were fantastico - HUGELY helpful and friendly. The choice of food for breaky was never ending and delicious. Their frizzante wine is the best I have ever tasted. No complaints at all. Perfect. The reviewer who said the place is just for starry eyed young couples is wrong - we are 45 and 50 and well past the starry eyed stage!!!! Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: AntonellaP67
Reviews.Content: This is simply a beautiful hotel. Walkinh distance from the parking station, about 10 minutes. Try not to talk everything the car park is safe. The hotel is very welcoming. It was a lovely piazza in the front. Our room was true Venitian style, fabric on the walls to match the canopy on the bed. The kids had 2 single beds. The bathroom was fantastic had a rain shower head and double sink. The breakfast was delicious full cereals, bread, cakes, cold meats and eggs. Nt to mention coffee and tea. Reception can organize boats trips etc and recommend places for dinner. They did 5 minute walk to Resturant called La Ferrette, home style cooking that was not a rip off for the area. The Zappa di Pesce is a must. Loved this hotel, free wifi also. they also give you a 10% discount for the parking at San Marco. AAA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: Lallous85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Italy. We stayed at the Grand Canal for one night and had a fantastic experience. We were greeted very warmly by Dominic and quickly escorted to our room. The room was exceptionally gorgeous. We didn't have a view but the hotel itself made up for it. Breakfast was good although warm dishes were not included. Also, the hotel is quite far from touristic attractions in Venice i.e Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square. It is located right across the train station and a short jaunt from the bus station. We highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again during our next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Well-deserved 5 out of 5 reviews!”
Reviews.Author: mbvnj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first and very ambitious visit to Italy - 5 cities in 11 days! This hotel completely lived up to our expectations (which were high after reading the Trip Advisor Reviews). The rooms were lovely, the location terrific and the staff couldn't have been more pleasant & helpful and by "staff" I mean everyone we encountered from check-in to restaurant servers to the bellman/bartender. Enjoying a nightcap from hotel's the little terrace on the Grand Canal at night was nothing short of spectacular and a memory we will savor forever.

Reviews.Title: “Liked but not loved”
Reviews.Author: top_mango
Reviews.Content: We booked the Canal Grande three months in advance, for a birthday celebration weekend and requested a nice room because of that. On arrival we were offered the choice from one of two rooms in the annex and took the largest of the two. The annex (where our room was) is separate from the main hotel, three doors down - something we didn't know at the time of booking. What we were expecting was a room with canal view (partial would do also) but what we got was a ground floor room with two small windows overlooking a back street. On the positive side: great location, easy access and a good base to explore Venice. The room was comfortable, beautifully decorated (see candid photos), quiet and the service was also very good. The downside was that we made a specific request, well in advance and that was not met. We did ask to change, but that wasn't possible. Also on checkout, we shared our feedback and the lady at reception responded that there are few rooms with a view and most visitors celebrate some kind of occasion. True, but with that did not make me feel special, plus our request was made well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Venice, finally.”
Reviews.Author: jaycos
Reviews.Content: Never thought I would get there but my husband and I finally made it to Venice and I am so pleased we did. The Hotel Canal Grande was the icing on the cake. Easy to get to, easy to travel around Venice from, but not situated in the madness of the Rialto! The staff are very professional and very welcoming, the Hotel is charming and the rooms are gorgeous... small but everything you could want. The bed was very firm but that is the only negative I can think of. Sitting on the deck of an evening watching the passing parade and sipping a bellini.... I would love to stay there again. Try to get a room looking over the Canal, it is endlessly entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely service, with reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: ATKok
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for it's so easy to reach the train station and vaporatte station. Very quiet environment. Good service with smiling staffs. Reasonable priced. Room is clean and I love the shower! But the room is quite small. Wifi is included. Breakfast is included and it's nice! I think I'll stay here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves Every Accolade”
Reviews.Author: Manatee609
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel are so outstanding that it hardly seems important to add to them, but nevertheless, I heartily endorse all the others who have been so satisfied. Ours was a family vacation, strictly for pleasure, and the Canal Grande was a pleasure indeed. We had two of the most charming rooms one could imagine; our kids and their nine year old and five month old were in a large room overlooking the canal and we were in a double overlooking a side street. The rooms are lavish, in romantic Italian style, and are perfectly maintained and spotless. Our room was very small, but the furnishings and gorgeous bathroom made up for it. The public rooms are also delightful, the breakfast was more than adequate, and the service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Unique rooms and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jaclynt
Reviews.Content: Out of 5 hotels my husband and I stayed at during our honeymoon in Italy, this one is tied for first place! The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. They also provide a free taxi to Murano with a tour of one of the glass factories where you get a demonstration of the glass blowing process. We had a very early flight out of Venice and they had no problems calling taxi to pick us up from the port at the hotel at 4 in the morning. The rooms are also fun and uniquely decorated, and the bathroom was nice and large. Breakfast was great as well. My only wish is that we could have gotten a room overlooking the Grand Canal. But they were booked up! Didn't matter really though, we still get the view when you step out of the hotel and we weren't in the room *that* much of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: Swissmurka
Reviews.Content: Just a short walk from Piazzale Roma (car park and bus station), on the opposite side of the Canal Grande from the railway station, this hotel is in a perfect location in Venice as it looks on the Canal but is accessed through a quiet pedestrian street which is not the main tourist route. The hotel is very nicely decorated with antique and antique-style furniture, very cosy and spacious. The room has all necessary amenities and is beautifully furnished. The bed has a very matress, the child's bed was comfortable as well. As we arrived far before the check-in time returning from the cruise, the hotel staff was bery kind and made us very comfortable by offering us free coffee and hot chocolate. As soon as they heard that we would like to visit Murano glass factories they offered us a water taxi ride to the island and back and a free excursion to one of the oldest Murano factories for free. We were very pleasantly surpised and happy as a water taxi is quite expensive in Venice. The taxi turned up in 10 minutes and came straight to the door to the Canal. The breakfast was very sufficient and good quality, they also gave us some recommendations about some good local food restaurants off the tourist track which turned to be perfect. I find this hotel perfetc in evry aspect, would highly recommend and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient location for travelers with huge bags”
Reviews.Author: mel0diz
Reviews.Content: Rooms were beautiful and service was excellent. However, the separation of the rooms in a junior suite makes one feel out of place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JOSEANTONIO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Canal Grande for 2 nights and really enjoyed my stay. Hotel was very clean, updated, the room big for Italy standards and the hotel front desk and staff were very helpful. Location is ideal; right on the grand canal (with a close stop for the vaporetto) and a short walk from the Santa Lucia train station where I arrived

Reviews.Title: “A great start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ChizD
Reviews.Content: We had booked with the sister hotel, Hotel Antiche Figure, but we were offered an upgrade to Canal Grande on arrival. We were taken to view two rooms at Canal Grande, both had beautiful Venetian decor. The first room was in the centre on the first floor with canal views (smallish windows, but was a generous size for Venice hotels), we ended up choosing the Antonio Canova room, which was smaller but had a lovely private terrace overlooking a little square, with views of the canal. We enjoyed watching the sunset from the terrace during our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. They greeted us whenever we passed reception, gave good restaurant reservations, and asked questions about our adventures each day. (The staff at Anitche Figure were equally helpful in organising our transfer and moving our luggage) The location is easily accesible from the main station and Ferrovia vaparetto stops (these water buses make it easier not to get lost!) Breakfast was a great selection of fruit salad, yogurt, cold meats and cheese and lots of cakes! There is filter coffee, but the staff will offer to make you a coffee or tea at no extra charge. Everything was delicious and fresh each morning. We also took advantage of the Murano tour - reception will organise a water taxi to take you across and have a tour of a glass blowing factory, and then return you to the north side of the main island at no extra cost. The journey takes about 25 mins each way and is certainly worth it to see the amazing creations. I struggle to think of anything negative to say, but so that the review seems balanced, I would mention that the showers are very narrow (not an issue for us), and the champagne in the minibar was a bit pricey (but the bar downstairs had other options, and the other minibar options were very reasonable!) The Canal side rooms can be a bit noisy due to the boats going by, this was not an issue for us (worth a little noise for the views!), but may be for others. Thank you Canal Grande for an excellent start to our honeymoon, we will heartily recommend you :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kgrom2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canal Grande for 2 nights and really enjoyed our stay. Hotel was very clean, updated, the room (and bathroom) big for Italy standards and the hotel front desk and staff were very helpful. Location is ideal; right on the grand canal and a short ride to/from airport and getting to/from the square. Getting to the hotel: We took the alilaguna orange line from the airport and at the Giglio stop got off and walked about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “1st Class - Home from home”
Reviews.Author: ToffeeLondon
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in we were greeted with a friendly smile and very knowledgeable staff, they immediately made us feel at home. We booked a canal view room which was beautiful and extremely comfortable with typical exquisite Venetian decor. Breakfasts were very good, wide selection and fresh. The staff were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble for them. The location is great, close to Piazzale Roma where you come in from the airport and Ferrovia for the train station but not so that it is a nuisance. Venice is all about roaming and walking around and Rialto is only a 15 minute walk away, San Marco a little further but that's the beauty of Venice, walking and finding different bridges and cafes to have that wonderful espresso! Everything about the hotel was wonderful and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice canal hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: GguyinCA
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel at the last minute and it was lovely. Great location a short walk from train station ans car rentals and right in the canal. Room reasonable by Venice standards. Lovely breakfast overlooking canal and friendly helpful staff always eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Carnival Trip!”
Reviews.Author: houston1949
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent Carnivale in Venice, Italy. We booked a 6 night stay at the Hotel Canal Grande based upon the reviews in Tripadvisor. Everything was exactly as stated in the reviews. All of their employees from the front desk to the maid were excellent. The hotel is a short ride on the the vaporetta to St. Mark's Square. There are plenty of excellent locate restaurants nearby. Our room was small by American standards, but not by Venetian or European. And, it was exactly as you would picture a bedroom in Venice. The hotel itself is perfect. It was renovated several years ago and has been perfectly maintained. The breakfast is a wonders Italian (not American) breakfast. Those manning the frontdesk will do anything necessary to make your stay enjoyable and perfect. My wife and I have been to Europe numerous times and rate the Hotel Canal Gande as one of the best, if not THE best hotel at which we've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Overall perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rodolphe P
Reviews.Content: Giovanna gave us a warm welcome upon our arrival, we felt straight away at home. The bedroom was magnificent, nice and quiet even though we were close to the canal. As for breakfast, nothing to say except that we appreciated it with a nice view on the Grand Canal. Giovanna as well as the other members of the hotel are attentive, discreet and professional. We were particularly moved by Giovanna whom on the behalf of the hotel offered a beautiful rose for my spouse birthday which she discovered upon our return from a night at the opera. What a pleasant suprise! Needless to say that we will definitively come back to Venice and more so to this beautiful yet discreet hotel. Rodolphe and Christelle from Bayeux, France

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: LondonTown2010
Reviews.Content: we went for our anniversary, the view over the canal is beautiful. The location if the hotel is convenient for getting to/from airport/train station I was slightly disappointed by my room, probably more because I had my expectation set for a room with big windows and blue decor, rather than anything wrong with the room itself. I was persuaded to take the canal view room as it was 'more romantic' however I think if I get to choose again I would have gone with the suite without the view as it was cold and the windows were not that big so there wasn't much looking out to the view from the room so I didnt think the room was more romantic just because it had the canal view. I was a little surprised that the hotel did not offer us any complimentary drinks or chocolate or fruit given that we're there for special occassion (most other hotels we've stayed at always did offer something). The recommendation of restaurants by the hotel staff always hit the spot (you have to tell them what you're after clearly). The local pizza fantastic, the local restaurant great value, etc. Breakfast - per the reviews by others is nothing to write home about. There ought to be a wider selection of pastry and fresh fruit instead of all the cakey/biscuity options... It's not close to San Marco etc however we could get the vaporette there or walk there (enjoyed the walk too). Overall I liked the hotel. It is not cheap but I think it's pretty standard for such a touristy city (Rome was more expensive). I suggest that the hotel could do with improving the breakfast and the little touch of celebrating the occassion of the visitors to improve the overall experience and making it feel more value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Sparrowpmc
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canal Grande lived up to its positive reviews! We just returned from spending 3 nights (February, 2012) at this beautifully appointed hotel. The location is ideal - literally within minutes walking distance from the train and bus stations - and directly on the Grand Canal in a quiet area. Hotel/rooms are decorated in classic Venetian style, very clean, and well maintained. Breakfast is well provisioned with many fresh choices and served with friendliness and efficiency. The entire staff is outstanding! Whether answering questions, recommending restaurants, or securing concert tickets, Johnny and the staff are helpful, professional, knowledgeable, and courteous! Hotel Canal Grande is completely deserving of its Travelers' Choice 2012 Winner award.

Reviews.Title: “cosy & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sveenz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canal Grande is a charming property with comfortable rooms. It is located right at the Canal Grande only 5min by foot from the bus station and also the railway station. The landlady is very friendly and will do everything to make your stay comfortable. The rooms are small but very cosy. The beds are comfortable and allow a very good sleep; the area is very quiet at night. Breakfast is good, there is a variety of bred, cereals, cheese, fruits and cold cuts. Egg dishes are available at an extra charge. Value for money could be better during high season rates. Overall a hotel to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJH63
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the basis of previous reviews and was not disappointed. Location-wise it is perfect as it is a short walk from the train or bus stations, which avoids a costly water taxi with luggage. It is also not in the busiest tourist areas - which I think is a plus, It is right on the Canal Grande on a quiet side passage. It is no more than a (very pleasant) 20 minute walk to reach the main tourist areas. The staff are super friendly and helpful and on both nights I stayed there they made dinner reservations for me in excellent restaurants (ask them about the best Pizzeria in Venice, which is just round the corner!). The room was lovely and it was amazing to wake up to the sounds of the busy canal at work. My only complaint is that there was a lot of noise coming from the adjoining room, where young children were staying.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Klidimos
Reviews.Content: Everything from location (close to Piazza Roma and the train station), rooms and service was absolutely top notch! Very match worth its position as Venice's #5 in Trip Advisor. If I was forced to give some constructive critisism, I would say that the only element which could potentially be improved is the coffee served with breakfast. Do not hesitate to book!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic trip and hotel”
Reviews.Author: EcclesRoad
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here at the end of January, and were so happy with our choice. We got the public water taxi (Alilaguna) from the airport to the Guglie stop, and it was an easy 5 minute stroll to the hotel from there. The staff were very friendly on arrival, tailoring their advice to suit the length of our stay and recommending a charming local restaurant which we enjoyed on our first night. Our room was incredible - I had asked for the blue room featured on the website, and they happily obliged - and it is just as lovely as it looks in the pictures. It had views on to the canal and the courtyard, and we both agreed it probably was the nicest hotel room we'd ever stayed in! There was a vaporetto strike on the Friday, so we had to do a bit more walking than we anticipated - I would say it's about 35 mins on foot to St Mark's Square, which was fine, although gets a little tiring if you do it twice in a day. The vaporetto stop is so close that it's easy when the boats are working - the express boat to St. Mark's takes hardly any time at all. Breakfast was just as everyone's described - fine, but nothing special. Overall, we were delighted with this hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: Family of four with two kids ages 8 &10. Stayed in the quadruple room and it offered comfort, amenities, luxury and Venetian style that blew us away. The ownership paid attention to every detail when designing and keeping the rooms. From the mosaic in the bathroom (two bathrooms in our room!) to the wall covers and canopy bed, they brought Venice and the Duke Palace atmosphere in to this room. My kids and wife didnâ€™t want to leave and continue the Italy trip. Try to have breakfast on the little dock facing the canalâ€¦great experience. Highly recommendedâ€¦we are talking about a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located hotel and very friendly personal”
Reviews.Author: Mohiniyattam
Reviews.Content: We have had a great stay. 4 nights. Very goog service. Nice reception at arrival. Good tips given. Nice rooms very quite and very well equipped. A very good address to stay in Venice 5 min. To the station and vaporettos to all direction. Easy to go by boat to the airport, the hotel is close to the water line. Charming house, very well renovated. Great stay, great place to be.. John and Marie-Francoise

Reviews.Title: “nice place for the price”
Reviews.Author: andrea l
Reviews.Content: it was a very easy walk from the bus station along the canal. the staff was friendly and we had a great view. it was the perfect place for a night in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jean D
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Newly decorated and comfortable, it is situated on the Grand Canal. The staff is extremely accommodating and friendly. Unlike the 5-star hotel we booked in Florence, the Hotel Canal Grande offers free Internet. The only thing that is slightly inconvenient is its location: It is a long walk to St. Mark's Square and is across the canal from the train station; a water taxi is available for those who wish to use it. (We had to take the taxi to the train station because we couldn't cart all our luggage over the bridge.) We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: sarah-janewalker
Reviews.Content: Extremely comfortable hotel with beautifully decorated rooms. Everything was provided that you could possibly need. Breakfast buffet was extensive with lots of choice and fresh produce. The staff were extremly helpful with suggesting restaurants and things to do and see, noting was too much trouble. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: caldaxiong
Reviews.Content: We had the Grand Canal prestige room which had wonderful views of the Grand Canal. It was magical looking at the water taxis and other boats chug by from our windows. The room was beautifully decorated in rich fabrics and spotlessly clean. The hotel staff were all very helpful. The hotel itself is a 5 minute walk from the train station. It is a bit of a walk to St. Mark's Square, but if you like the idea of meandering your way through the different neighborhoods, then this hotel will be perfect for you. The only real negative feedback I have is that although the hotel provides a buffet breakfast, hot food items like omelettes require a surcharge which, considering the room prices, should probably be done away with.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: vodared
Reviews.Content: We arrived by Water Taxi direct from the airport and from the moment we stepped off the taxi direct into the hotel through the front door we were wowed. The Hotel was so clean, everything appeared completely refurbished. Our bedroom was unbelievable with views directly onto the canal. Whilst the hotel is on the Grand Canal its really at the other end to St Marks Square and the main canal entrance - that doesn't matter you're very near to the train station and two water bus stations (I would suggest getting a day ticket for 16 euros as your can take a trip right round the island of venice, use many different side routes and even get the water taxi to the glass blowing on murano-grab the taxi at the hospital it will save 45 mins!). Also Venice is such a small city you really can easily walk (amble) from one end to the other in an hour. The breakfast area was small but continental breakfast is fine we stocked up for the day and found we could last till our evening meal (take care prices vary massively within Venice). The staff were superb - ask away they have answers to everything - nothing is too difficult. I would strongly take their tips on restaurants they seem to recommend their favourites, full of italians & few tourists and excellent food at reasonable prices. Venice is beautiful try to see it in the sun its unbelievable. If you can go in early January its very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Alright - but pricey and some issues”
Reviews.Author: veedubmelb
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel despite the high cost, partly driven by the reviews here. It was alright, but not up to the expectations given. The room was fine (a little overdone, but I get that Venice mainly appeals to starry eyed young couples on their honeymoon) and the location excellent, but there were a few disappointments. The advertised glass blowing excursion that was meant to be included was only available if enough people wanted to do it that day - I didn't care enough to make a fuss but thought this was poor form. The breakfast was okay, but the space a little too small for the number of people meaning it was often hard to get a table. All up - just okay - and in that regard I have to go against the crowd on this one. Starry eyed young couples might like it more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel from the first moment”
Reviews.Author: Jenisonholiday
Reviews.Content: We had a little trouble finding the hotel but even with four bags!!!! It was still only a five minute walk from the main bus station, getting lost a couple of times, it was enough to make us unhappy campers by the time we arrived at reception tho!!! The receptionist was lovely, spoke very fluent English which was great. She showed us straight to our room, and it was beautiful. All the walls were lined with silk and a big four poster bed which was sooooo comfortable. Marble bathroom, spotlessly clean, and a view over the grand canal to watch all the comings and goings. Breakfast is buffet and continental, everything was fresh and lovely with a good choice. We left feeling very spoilt and lucky to stay at such a lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Old Venetian Charm”
Reviews.Author: Anthony Y
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our Christmas holiday last year at Hotel Canal Grande. This is a magnificent hotel. The location is close to the Venezia Santa Lucia train station and water bus stops. The view from the private dock in the canal is panoramic. The room is relatively large and furnished with period pieces. The washroom has all the modern European amenities. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. But what set this hotel from others is the old Venetian charm and hospitality. We totally enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little spot, close to rail station and all the must see venues”
Reviews.Author: Temeaux
Reviews.Content: The staff did their best to impress and we were given a room upgrade upon arrival. The room was fantastic, very romantic with lot's of space. The room also has a balcony, but we didn't use it as it was cold. We did have a bit of a shock when the lights timed out a couple of times because the key wasn't properly seated in the slot. Also, the breakfast was just ok, nothing to get you out of bed. All that said, the staff was absolutely fantastic, going out of their way to help make our stay memorable and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MeredithP_12
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I visited Venice in August during the peak summer travel season and were thrilled with the value that this hotel offered us. We both travel regularly and were impressed with the hotel's fantastic location, charming traditional decor, delicious breakfast and incredible staff. We were only there for 3 days but were made to feel like family. They were all wonderful but Giovanna was a real strand out. I truly can't say enough about this hotel...I'd stay there again in a moment. The pricing is very competitive for a hotel of this quality and the location is great. From the airport, you can take a quick bus ride to the central station and walk to the hotel within ten mins. From there you can walk to all the major spots, or of course enjoy all the water transportation. Being accessible to the bus and train station will save you a lot of money getting to and from the airport leaving more for you to enjoy during your stay....and trust me there is a lot to tempt you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: SLMcMill
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Canal Grande by internet, using TripAdvisor as my guide. I worked directly with the hotel my email and they provided me with an excellent rate for our 3 night stay. There were 4 of us, two couples, and I made the reservations for all of us online. We stayed December 13-16, 2011. When we checked in, the hotel concierge was immediately helpful and gracious, and had upgraded my husband and I to a junior suite at no additional cost. The busboy, Lorenzo, was just delightful. He carried our bags upstairs and showed us and our friends through our rooms. It was late in the afternoon when we arrived and while cold, it was sunny and we immediately went out to a small deck on the canal to watch the boats and enjoy a bottle of chianti. Lorenzo brought us a wonderful bottle then slipped away, returning soon with a plate of warm bread and cheese which he proudly announced that he'd made for us himself, seeing that we were hungry from traveling all day. What a treat! I just can't say enough about our experience. The rooms were immaculate, clean and well stocked. Our bed was comfortable and our suite had 2 full bathrooms and a small living area. Our friends room was right next door and equally well appointed. The staff was friendly, inviting and accomodating. I will stay there if I return to Venice and I highly encourage anyone else to stay as well. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Magical!”
Reviews.Author: msb0nd
Reviews.Content: What a magical experience! We requested a standard double room and were overwhelmed with a fabulous, beyond words 'standard' room, with an attached terrace... which so happened to overlook the Grande Canal. It was out of this world! What a wonderful way to spend the holidays. The hotel location was great - easily located to everything, but out of the way from tourist hoards. St Marks' was 25 minutes away, but lots to see and do along the way. It was great for us because we like to walk. Staff was excellent, suggested shopping areas (food market!) and helped confirm our taxi and flights. Worth the money: boat taxi from airport direct to hotel - approx $115 each way, but you feel like James Bond and it couldn't be more convenient. Try insideveneto.com for reservations. They were on time and reliable. Venice in general: Lots of bridges with stairs, so can be challenging for older folks or kids in strollers. Also, watch out for 'service fee' AND "cover charge", which is in addition to your food bill. The closer you get to attractions, the more expensive the food is. Not worth it. Walk 10 more minutes and eat like a real Italian. Would return to Hotel Canal Grande in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Hotel Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Oz_WandererGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We had booked by internet with the Hotel Antiche Figure and planned a 2 night stay after a 14 day Seabourn Odyssey cruise from Istanbul. The water taxi dropped us outside the hotel and, in the book-in process we were asked if we would like to "upgrade" to their sister hotel nearby - the Hotel Canal Grande. They showed us an excellent room at the Antiche Figure and then walked us around to the Hotel Canal Grande where they had available a beautifully decorated ground floor room with its own courtyard. We chose to stay here for 3 nights rather than two so did not get to rate the Hotel Antiche Figure but, under the same management, it certainly also appeared excellent. Our room at the Hotel Canal Grande was wonderful, bathroom was equally wonderful, and the decor was "Venetian splendour". There was a comfortable sitting area - couch and coffee table, excellent TV cabinet, minibar fridge, safe. The breakfast room with windows to the Canal was bright and airy and food and service was great. The staff were really helpful with tourist advice and maps and we enjoyed 2 nearby restaurants the night receptionist recommended. They have their own jetty for water taxis and gondolas. We thought the location was wonderful for exploring (and getting lost) in the canals and alleyways of Venice. It is only a few minutes walk to the Vaporetto which takes you all the way to St Mark's Square. That was our first advemture. The walk back via Rialto Bridge was our second adventure. By the 3rd morning we almost knew our way around. This is a wonderful hotel with pleasant, friendly, staff and management and we would recommend it highly for a base from which to explore the fantastic attractions of Venice. And the price is right! Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough superlatives to describe the experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sue-JohnnyLondon
Reviews.Content: Wow! what an amazing holiday, my partner and I stayed 3 nights at this beautiful boutique hotel in December, it was a surprise for my partners birthday. This was our first trip to Venice and all I can say is we can't wait to return here both to the place and the hotel The hotel was everything that Trip Advisor reviewers had said it was, friendly, accommodating, cheerful staff, spotlessly clean, just far enough away from the centre of Venice but this was excellent as we enjoyed getting lost through the streets and marvelling at the sights. It also meant we had a decent ride on the vaporetto on the way to St Marks Square. Because we went in December it also meant that Venice was relatively quiet in contrast to the busy summer months so we didn't have to queue to see any of the sights, walked straight in to the Basilica and the Doge's palace, both spectacular and queued for about 5 minutes to get to the top of the Bell tower, what a fabulous view on a crisp clear day, which we had. Back to the hotel, we stayed in the Santa Lucia suite which was on 3 levels, a downstairs lounge area with Flat screen TV (hidden in the mirror, my partner was enthralled by this) and small cooking area, behind mirrored doors. Then upstairs to our beautiful bedroom and bathroom then up another small flight to our outside terrace area. We were in the annex at the side of the hotel, which I thought we might be as I couldn't quite afford the more expensive rooms, however this turned out to be a bonus as we had the quietest comfiest nights sleep ever in this suite as there wasn't anyone above, below or at the side of us. I can highly recommend the Santa Lucia Suite. Oh and one other thing my partner proposed to me in St Marks Square, which was the most amazing surprise. So Hotel Canal Grande, thanks again..... we will be back for the honeymoon!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: supergirl_sf
Reviews.Content: How rare is it that every review of a place is a positive one? Particularly when there are over 380 of them? I was surprised â€“ and, oddly enough, skeptical -- when I noticed that there is nary a negative review for this hotel here on Trip Advisor. So, despite the fact that this â€œdark horseâ€� showed up late in my debate about what hotel to choose in Venice, I booked it. What a fortunate choice, since it turns out all these glowing reviews are right: Hotel Canal Grande is a perfect place to stay in Venice. Each staff member I encountered was helpful and solicitous, the rooms are lovely, the hotel spotless, and although the location is a bit removed from the center of the touristic melee in this town, I consider that a good thing (plus, itâ€™s only a couple minutes walk to the nearest vaporetto stop, which will convey you into the fray). The night of my arrival, I stayed in one of the rooms in a newer building adjacent to the main hotel, appointed in the cream silks you can see in the photos. At ground level with windows facing an alley, the room was rather dark, and smelled too strongly of air freshener. After opening the windows (chilly, in November), I could have lived with the scent, but the darkness was a little depressing. In the morning, I asked at the desk if I could have one of the blue rooms, just because they looked nicer on the website. And here is one mark of a good hotel: they accommodated my request graciously and without demur, even though there was no compelling reason for it. As in, there was nothing wrong with the first room, I just like the color blue better than cream. Itâ€™s also possible that my second room, the Casanova, which is in the attic, might have been a higher price since its windows faced onto the Grand Canal. If so, the hotel staff didnâ€™t mention it; rather, they just fulfilled my request (and remembered to remove the air freshener, if there had been one in this room, without me having to ask). The Casanova room was a little smaller than my original one, but this didnâ€™t matter to me. It was decorated in the gorgeous sky blue silk you can see on the website, bright and sunny during the day, and snug at night. Being at the top of the building, it was also quieter without any upstairs neighbors treading above my head. Continental breakfast is included in a cheery breakfast room, and here again the staff is perfect â€“ cheerful and accommodating. Itâ€™s possible there are room service items that you can order to your room throughout the day and evening â€“ I didnâ€™t look into it. Thereâ€™s a small bar from which you could pick up a drink in the evening, if your room does not have an honor bar (some do, mine didnâ€™t). I think the rooms have free WiFi â€“ I left my computer at home â€“ but thereâ€™s also a computer in the lobby in case you have a burning need to check in on Facebook. There may be a couple of free entries with your stay; I believe one of the desk workers mentioned that I could go to the casino or a glass blower on Murano, although I did not end up doing either; too much else to see. My final observation is that when I checked out, after 5 nights, the desk person asked very specifically if everything had been all right with my stay. Yes, I said. Rather than leave it there, he said â€œIs there anything we could do better or differently?â€� No, actually, there wasnâ€™t: Hotel Canal Grande delivered a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Calm in a busy City”
Reviews.Author: John-Boy-Saint
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel in a very quiet square overlooking the Grand Canal. In fact considering one of the main walking through routes from the station to St Marks Sq runs through the back of the square it is amazing how tranquil it is. The staff here through booking to departure were superb, my main contact was with Giani and Alessandro both of whom could not do enough, in fact every member of staff we met was superb. We were in the new annex, which whilst a bit disappointing not to be in the main hotel, soon became very novel, as being situated in the residential area of Venice anyone looking on would have thought we were a local. The rooms were very very nice and comfortable with everything you would need on hand or a phone call away. There is a mini bar fridge in the room, without the little doors to trigger a charge, so plenty of room for you own bottles of something. Some folks have commented about the distance from the hotel to St Marks, well considering the only choice of transport is by foot or water (Vaporetto stop 3 mins walk away) What a pleasant city to walk through, or better still get lost in. Overall the Hotel Canal Grande set the tone for a really nice weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice and value for a stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: omegamoon2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night. Though not cheap, some of their rooms offer great value. From Piazzale Roma, the walking distance is not terribly long (about 10-15 minutes), but it is strongly advisable to study the walking directions to the hotel. As for service, it did not start well. While I managed to find the hotel with two heavy bags and a backpack in tow, surprisingly the man at reception did not offer to assist until I made it to the desk. It was then that he had the porter place my bags in storage. I was informed the room would not be available for some time and proceeded to a small deck situated right along the canal where there are some tables and chairs from which one can admire the views. Fortunately things did improve once my room became available. The staff walked me over to a "new" building that is part of the hotel. These rooms are located within the square about five or six buildings away. Once inside, one can see this location is well maintained as quality, security, and comfort are immediately evident. Public access is prohibited and limited to guests and staff. My room is on the second floor located along a quiet calle (small street). After a quick tour, my bags were delivered up to the room. Inside there is enough room for a double bed, small desk and armoire. Two windows provide sufficient natural light. The bathroom is well kept and clean, though much smaller than expected. Functionally, everything worked as expected. I had no problems with maintaining a comfortable temperature in the room and slept very well on the supportive bed. The shower earns high marks with its modern fixtures and ample water pressure. Lastly, sound insulation seems excellent as I did not detect any noise from outside or from other rooms. Later in the day, I did receive commendable assistance at the reception desk for any questions and concerns I had about getting around and finding a place to eat. They were even able to help me share a water taxi with other guests heading over to the cruise terminal. The next morning, I found their excellent breakfast to offer the usual choices of breads and pastries, yogurt, fruit salad, cold meats and cheeses, and fruit juices. Coffee and cappuccino are terrific. The breakfast area is adequate for all guests. Even when busy, service is attentive, and the overall ambiance is highly enjoyable. On the day of departure, while leaving my room, one of the hotel staff (I wish I could recall her name) saw that I needed assistance with my bags. She helped me navigate both of them down the narrow staircase and even insisted helping me on the way back to the main building. When the water taxi arrived, luggage was again handled professionally by the staff. Pros: Services is personal and attentive, almost excellent. Quiet room and comfortable bed. Quality breakfast. Located in a quiet square away from the crowds. Proximity to Piazzale Roma, Santa Lucia railway station, and Marittima Cruise Terminal. Cons: Small double room. No elevator in adjacent building (which was not an issue since the staff was very helpful with my luggage).

Reviews.Title: “Missing the canal, but...”
Reviews.Author: reigndeerz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canal Grande prides itself on sitting right by the grand canal in Venice. However, perhaps as a result of its popularity, the hotel now houses several rooms at adjoining buildings, which no longer offers you the feel of staying by the Canal. Naturally, you could still choose to get one of those expensive rooms with a view. That little gripe aside, the hotel was immaculately kept, and the furnishings provided were nothing short of splendid. The heating and ventilation system was without a doubt the best we have had in our entire trip, which was a huge bonus in the Venetian cold. The location was a 5 minute walk from the train station and the nearest water buses, which made for convenient travelling. Getting to St Mark's took around half an hour on foot. The breakfast area was charming, and offered direct views of the canal. The breakfast spread and service were also excellent, and were successful in tempting us towards spending a full hour on breakfast. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay in what I'd deem a luxury hotel. Wasn't exactly the cheapest hotel, but then again, it's Venice that we're at. Thanks for the great stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay - Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestfieldJackieP
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Grande Canal is a beautiful hotel with a great location. We stayed there prior to a cruise. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We arrived at Marco Polo Aeroport...took a bus ( right out in front of the terminal 3Euros) to Piazzale Roma (about 10 min) Then took the Vaporetto to our hotel (second stop). We bought a 48 hr vaporetto pass for 28 euros which allowed us to get around quite easily. When it was time to go to the cruise ship...we were able to take the Vaporetto right to the mooring. The location of the hotel was very quiet and being so close to the Vaporetto we were able to move around Venice quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: webbo147
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms. Great value for money. Very nice and helpful staff. Sensational location.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart and very friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: panatlantic
Reviews.Content: It was a delight to arrive at and leave the hotel by water taxi. Arrange this in advance by emailing the hotel. The rooms are lovely, the breakfasts comprehensive and the staff could not have been friendlier. The hotel is away from the very busy Rialto/ San Marco area in a quite neighbourhood but there are 2 water bus stops within 5/8 minute walk and anyway you can walk to Rialto in about 15/20 minutes. Just excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: RBC_24
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at hotel canal grande. The location is fantastic- so close to the train station that we didn't have to walk through Venice with luggage! The hotel staff were lovely and helpful. The rooms are Devine

Reviews.Title: “Deserves it's #1 Trip Advisor Status”
Reviews.Author: pweath
Reviews.Content: Took a water taxi to the hotel from a ship. It cost 60E. The hotel is lovely. Marble floors, victorian wallpaper and matching drapes. The rooms are a decent size. Everything is immaculate. The service is fabulous. The breakfast has lots of choices that are included in your daily rate and you can order other cooked breakfast items for minimal money. They will bring you tea, coffee or a chardonay at any time. You can sit in the lobby and watch the boats float by the hotel. We stayed two nights. We took the first available room which was on the main floor. The room was beautiful. The TV is in the mirror? Good storage. We were about 5 blocks from Plaza Roma which is the bus and taxi terminal. We were across the water and about 6 blocks from the Venice Casino. We were 200 feet from the vaporetta which is the public water bus. We actually took the vaporetta to the Plaza Roma and caught a real taxi to the airport for 40E. There are small eateries everywhere. Go across the first bridge and you will find great shopping and restaurants. The hotel has an arrangement with Murano. They will pick you up and water taxi you there for free. You are taken to the glass factory to watch items made. You are given a sales person. You are then taken to different rooms to look at things to buy. It seems to become a time share presentation from there. I actually had to tell the young man that was assigned to us to back off. The items you are viewing are thousands of dollars. We actually did but a piece done by a well known Venice artist, but it was not what I expected. I would pay to go back to Murano and walk the island. You are taken to one factory and there are 300 on the island. I wanted to go to a gift ship to buy items for friends but the gift shop pieces where not what I would have brought home. This particular factory specialized in upscale, one of a kind pieces, so their small cheap items were not well done. They say that the shops in Venice carry all Chinese glass and pass it off as Murano. You are looking for a store who represents the glass they have with artist brochures and the like. There is a wonderful shop over the bridge and down a couple of blocks who carries smaller one of a kind pieces from the factory where we bought ours that are hundreds of dollars not thousands. Sorry I did not see them earlier. When people buy from the factories set up by the hotel, everyone gets a cut including the hotel. Just be forewarned. I would definately stay at this hotel again. The location is great. Venice is such a great walking town. Please do not leave without taking a gondola ride. You will never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: Great find. The location is great (it is a hike to St. Mark's Square) but close to the train station. We had booked a Prestige Double Room but when we arrived they offered us a discounted upgrade to a room overlooking the canal. We looked at both rooms. The Prestige Double had a separate entrance and overlooked a courtyard, but it was a great room nonetheless. Then we looked at the upgraded room and it was right on the Grand Canal so we couldn't pass it up. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The staff was unfailingly polite, helpful and informative. Breakfast was standard but good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_and_Flor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days before we took a cruise to the Mediterrean. This hotel boutique is very clean and beautiful. We arrived from NY at 10am and went to the hotel, the location is fantastic right on the canal and you can arrive in the taxi or the public boat from the airport if you are not too tire we suggest you to take the public boat the tickets can be purchase outside of the airport and you will save from 110 to 30 euros. We arrived at the hotel around 11 am and our room was ready, very nice and good space. Even when the hotel is in the canal is really quiet at nights and close to important place as "la fenice" Opera House of Venice, the Academia and the Guggenheim Museum. The breakfast was really good and healthy (if you wish) however the coffee was amazing one the best that we had tasted and we are from Mexico which has very good coffee in Chiapas and Veracruz. The staff of the hotel was always working making the place spotless. In our opinion they were not very good giving directions however I think this is something cultural, we are used to travel longer distances. Definitely a place to consider if you are going to Venice. Flor and Pablo

Reviews.Title: “a great 3 night break”
Reviews.Author: stevex52004
Reviews.Content: we stayed for three nights at the hotel and hjad a fantastic time our room was a suite on the second floor overlooking the canal the decor and comfort was fine and we couldnt ask for more being typically English, perhaps teamaking facility would have been a bonus great service and very welcoming we'd stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Gonzo49
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a long weekend for my partners 50th birthday based on the reviews already on Tripadvisor and I have to say it lived up to its expectations. Fantastic location right on the canal, beautiful interior, very helpful and friendly staff and great breakfasts. We ordered breakfast in our room and were brought a fab selection at no extra cost. Our room was a deluxe double with a view of the canal and it was truly a lovely experience. The decor was luxurious, the view great and the bathroom of a very high standard. The TV was even part of the mirror and so very unobtrusive. Would definitely return......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, handy for the station”
Reviews.Author: Headboy
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to the station as our 3 days in Venice were part of a train trip from the UK including the overnight sleeper from Paris. We therefore arrived at the hotel before 10am. They prepared our room very quickly and really looked after us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet hotel by the canal.”
Reviews.Author: hoysamgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canal Grande in January and got a very good package deal. What we liked: + Room was small but cozy and very comfortable, bed was nice and soft. Room had a luxurious feel. + The location was conveniently near the bus station and the main street. It made sightseeing by foot very easy. + Staff was friendly. + Breakfast was nice, too. What we did not like: - Bathroom had a sewage smell. We had to keep the door closed and the vent on all day. The wall in the shower had a few very small patches of mold because there is no air circulation in the bathroom. - We stayed at the ground floor near the elevator. It was sometimes loud.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't change a thing”
Reviews.Author: 13Lin13
Reviews.Content: We had a room in the annexe overlooking the square, and, if you craned your head out of the window to the right, a canal view. We had intended to stay here in April 2010 but our trip was cancelled courtesy of the icelandic ash cloud. An attempt to rebook in September 2010 was thwarted when e-bookers misunderstood our plans and failed to book the hotel! eventually we arrived on 11 November 2011 to find that the hotel Canal Grande was well worth the wait. About a thirty minute walk from the tourist attractions of St Mark's square, Canal Grande is near the vaporetto stop (for travelling around Venice) and the train station (if you are travelling further afield). On arrival at Marco Polo airport you can ask the hotel to book you a water taxi and shuttle direct to their private mooring (110E) or you can take a taxi (45E) or the public bus (5E). We took the latter - just be careful, on the return transfer, that you buy the right ticket for the right bus at Piazzalle Roma, the big bus station and car park ten minutes away from the hotel. Canal Grande is well situated for walks around Canarreggio - Tintoretto's parish church is there and is well worth a visit. There are plenty of local churches around Santa Croce too. On a practical note, the breakfasts are tasty and filling; the rooms sumptiously decorated and, for Venice, reasonably sized. A great hotel, with helpful, efficient and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: scotchpiners
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful, gorgeous - what more can I say. The bathroom (which I am also very particular about) was very modern, spanking clean, well provided and also had a spectacular view of the canal just like out room - which was right on the canal. The view was GREAT! The lady at the reception was very friendly and helpful; unfortunately can't say the same for the gentleman :-( The breakfast which was included was alright.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nrscar
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canal Grande is a wonderful hotel. My husband and I recently spent 7 days here for our anniversary, and we are already talking about going back! The location is perfect for arrivals and departures from the train station or bus station which also makes it convenient for day trips to Verona, Padua, etc. We initially thought we were too far away from San Marco and some of the sites we had come to see, but it soon became apparent that we were in a perfect location in every way - away from the crowds and still within easy traveling distance by vaporetto or foot to just about anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is situated on a quiet little square and the Grand Canal. We did not have a room with a canal view, but loved our room just the same which was beautiful, spacious and comfortable. The staff was exceptional - friendly and helpful in every way. Everything was simply first class. We loved our trip to Venice and our stay in this wonderful hotel. Take our advice and book it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff - great break”
Reviews.Author: Kirsteen B
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here on our honeymoon as we are doing the full sunshine part next year! I cannot fault this hotel - a small boutique and the photos trully represent the quality of the decor and rooms. Rooms are a little small but all traditional buildings are narrower but not as compact as Amsterdam!!! Based a little out of the centre it was not as noisy and the local restaurants were excellent. The staff went out of their way to arrange anything we wanted -- from recommending and booking restaurants (the hotel is B and B only) to arranging water taxis and trips. Could not have been more accomodating so we will be back!!! Thank you sooooo much Hotel Canal Grande!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: brandybish
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canal Grande is an easy walk from the train station. When we arrived, we were greeted by their wonderful staff. When they opened the door to our room, our jaws dropped! It was so ornately decorated and looked like something out of a fairytale. We were pleasantly surprised at the beautiful bathroom and large shower. As much as we didn't want to leave our beautiful room, we had to go out & explore the city. We were happy to find plenty of restaurants that we were only a short walk away & we definitely indulged in them. At night we grabbed a bottle of wine & sat on the sidewalk over looking the grand canal. There is definitely a magical feeling there and I will never stay anywhere else in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Recommend Highly Enough”
Reviews.Author: takemetohrb
Reviews.Content: I travel all the time and have very high standards. The staff - every one of them - were fantastic. Could not have been more helpful and welcoming and eager to help. Rooms spotless and very comfortable. Location excellent and superb value for money. A++!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Innkeepers in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night prior to boarding our cruise, it was in a great location for us. Short walk from the train station (we arrived from Milan), yet was quiet and relaxed and away from the tourist crowds. The staff was superb, breakfast was great. I would recommend our room, my wife enjoyed taking a relaxing bath with a view of the grand canal. When our cruise returned to Venice a week later, we were scheduled to leave by train that afternoon. Our plan was to leave our (giant, heavy) luggage at the train station, but, alas, there was a train strike that day, so no place to put these bags. We took a chance and walked them over to the hotel, hoping we could pay them to watch our bags for the day. "When you have stayed with us, you are family," they told us, and stored our bags for free. We loved Venice, it really is magical. But the Hotel Canal Grande and it's staff really made the city stand out for us. We'll be back, and can heartily reccomend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Caruli
Reviews.Content: This was the most beautiful, romantic hotel we have stayed in, but the best part was the warm, professional staff who made us feel welcome throughout our visit. Our room was decorated beautifully, immaculately clean, with a spacious bathroom and a view over the Grande Canal. It was so comfortable that I didn't want to leave the hotel. The breakfast was beautifully served with a variety of fruit, cereal, yogurt, pastries or a cooked breakfast to order (extra). We enjoyed the recommendations for neighborhood restaurants and felt we were able to enjoy the true Venice away from the crowds. If you arrive by train, it is just a short walk to the hotel, however there are a few steps getting over the bridge. Don't be afraid to get lost, just follow the signs to Alla Ferrovia (The train station) and you'll always find your way to the hotel from there.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: thankyouandgoodnight
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel. Clean bathrooms, comfortable beds, recently refurbished but above all very good service. It is of course at the "wrong" end of the Grand Canal (opposite and just down from the railway station) but a pleasant location in a quiet square. It dies have a annex up the street with duplex suites etc and here the shower rooms are very tight and the utilities prone to disruption.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect gem”
Reviews.Author: Patti W
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped in the door of this beautiful boutique hotel right on the grand canal in Venice, we were welcomed and felt at home. Jovana and the rest of the staff could not do enough for us. We were immediately engulfed in the charm of this beautiful, unique city that this hotel represented perfectly. The place is beautiful with old world charm. Our room had a window facing the canal and was beautifully decorated. There was a lovely breakfast set up every morning. Any thing we needed was immediately attended to, including excellent restaurant recommendations, airport arrangements, etc. We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: foodfanUk
Reviews.Content: We arrived here as a result of a misbooking at the sister hotel the Antiche Figure and the service could not have been better. They apologised for the misbooking and gave us coffee while we registered and had our bags taken up to the rooms. Later on the first day the boiler which was accessed from our room had a problem which took a great deal of time to fix - they apologised and offered to book (and pay for) dinner in compensation. The test of great service is when things go wrong how they cope and the staff at the Canal Grande were brilliant. The rooms were of a very good standard and the breakfast buffet very good - coffee was heavenly. The hotel is in a quiet location but near to the rail and bus stations and close to a vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Delighful stay at the Canal Grande”
Reviews.Author: appletreeKent
Reviews.Content: We echo all the positive reviews written about this hotel. We had previously stayed at the sister hotel the Antiche Figure but it was unavailable for our visit. We only stayed one night here and arrived quite late but I had emailed them. We heard the dreaded words 'as you are our last guests to arrive....' and I thought we would be in a broom cupboard! But no we had been upgraded to the Santa Lucia suite in the annex. It was delightful and we so wished we were staying longer. It was a cool night and we did need the blanket but the room and bathroom were great. Breakfast, especially the coffee was good and more than enough for us before we set out walking. By staying away from St Marks square you get to see so much of the city by walking to it. If you stay in the heart of the city I doubt you would have any reason to walk away from it and you would miss so many wonderful sights and shops. It really is so easy to get to the hotel from the Piazza Roma and I had printed off the directions from the hotel site and they were perfect. All the staff were so helpful and I really cannot imagine staying anywhere else than these 2 sister hotels. Both guys at the desk in the evening and in the morning went out of their way to make our stay so good. We would definatley choose here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near train station”
Reviews.Author: MissMagPie
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had a suite on the main canal which worked out wonderfully traveling with our 16 year old daughter. It was 2 large rooms and a large bathroom. The staff were very helpful and the hotel is very charming. The breakfast area is quite small and there are only 2 tables on the outdoor deck. Breakfast was only adequate, quite limited by other hotel standards. One thing to be aware of is the main canal is like a busy highway. Facing it is beautiful but the boats are running all night so if you have a main canal room bring your earplugs. It was pretty wonderful looking out my window waiving goodbye to my husband as he caught the water taxi to the airport at 4:30 am. I would go back again for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is not a cheap town”
Reviews.Author: RyrieParis
Reviews.Content: Italy being in the Euro and no longer able to devalue seems to mean that hotels in central Venice are very expensive - not even value for money when compared to Paris or London. Sevice & decor were impeccable but we were in a newly opened annex where the narrow room was claustrophobic - (windows looked into a small alley,6 feet wide) and overheated.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masteralessio1
Reviews.Content: WOW we loved this Hotel !!!! Very clean and beautiful room. we were a family with two young children staff were very pleasant and helpful!!! Our parents had a double room on same floor they too really enjoyed this hotel ! Service was excellent and had beautiful views over canal grande!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allison O
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is lovely, the staff are very helpful and friendly. The room we had was abit on the small side but the terrace made up for it. The only negative is that it has no restaurant just a breakfast room. The location is good, about 40 mins walk to St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge but plenty to see and do on the way.
