We paid 110 euros for a water taxi from the airport which was a great experience but there is a bus (Bus 5) that leaves every 30 mins to The Piazza Roma which is only 6 euros per person and it's a 10 min stroll if that from the hotel. one other bit of advice don't take travellers cheques we got charged 15% commission when we changed some, also be aware of city tax which is now been charged at 4 euros per person per night which has to be paid cash on departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon/Anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeff L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from October 8 - 10, 2011 and we could not have asked for a better hotel. First, the hotel is well located just steps away from the train station Santa Lucia. We determined that Venice is not a place you want to lug your luggage around the city. And we were correct. This hotel you can see from the train station, and it's just a short walk over the bridge and around the corner. Venice is like a labyrinth, and we could not fathom trying to find some of the hotels we saw. Take our advice, stick with a very well located hotel like the Hotel Canal Grande. While this hotel is not located near St. Marks square, the convenience, in our mind, more than makes up for hassle in transporting luggage (keep in mind everything is either by walking or by water bus/taxi). Second, the hotel was renovated just 2 years ago and is immaculate. The rooms were very comfy cozy and romantic. Updated bathrooms!!! Third, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We could not recommend this hotel more, just because of the staff. They were warm and seemed generally to care about our stay. Our stay came with breakfast, and there was more than enough to eat. All kinds of pastries, cured meats and cheeses, and fruit, along with choice of beverages (2 kinds of orange juice, cappucino, etc...). The hotel coordinated a trip to the Murano glass factory (free), which was very interesting, but was kind of like a big sales pitch....you spend more time walking through the showroom rather than watching the people make glass items. But still well worth going. We walked everywhere. We did not take the water bus/taxi (except for going to and from Murano). From the hotel it takes about 30 minutes to get to St. Marks square, but we were told that it would take about 1 hour on the water bus because it stops everywhere. We did not mind the walking because we got to look at all the shops and get some excercise. The hotel staff also made some good recommendations for dinner - where the locals go, not the tourists. We highly recommend this hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Want for nothing more”
Reviews.Author: dingotraveller
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous little find this place is. The front desk staff were exceptional, nothing was a problem from arranging a water taxi to recommending tours to giving directions. The boutique hotel doesnt have room numbers rather names for each room. My room was downstairs and even though it didnt have a view it was very comfortable with a small but more than adequate bathroom. A continental breakfast provides a substantial start to the day with views over the Grand Canal in the downstairs breakfast buffet area. Free wifi throughout the hotel is another draw card especially considering other larger chains expected you to pay for it when they charge like a wounded buffalo for every other thing. The place is a good 15-20 minute walk from the Rialto bridge and 25-30 minute walk to San Marcos but it's such an adventure exploring the tiny alley ways with their shops and restaurants. Well worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every way”
Reviews.Author: tippd
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to staying at this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews and of course visiting Venice. We were not disappointed. The service is impeccable, the location amazing and the hotel charming. We stayed in the Casanova room which is an attic room overlooking the Grand Canal. My parents stayed in the Doge room also looking over the Grand Canal. Both rooms were unique, each with their own charm. Whilst the rooms are not huge, they are certainly adequate size wise and are spotlessly clean. Breakfast was delicious, with lots of choice. For a small fee, hearty hot breakfast (eggs, bacon etc) is available. The staff are amazing, all more than willing to assist with any request. Special mention must go to Giovanna who was simply delightful. If I was to note any negative it would be a bit of peeling paint in our bathroom, however this certainly didn't spoil our experience and I wouldn't be surprised if this is attended to as part of the hotels regular maintenance as the property is extremely well looked after. If you are looking for something special in Venice, look no further. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: steof1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the start of the year with my fiancÃ©e. It was a little bit hard to find the hotel, with all the little side streets and laneways we passed by it the first time around. It is a walk able distance from the where the trains and buses stop. Or if you want to get a waterbus it is the second stop on the red line 2. (Stops on right side of Canal) The staff are very welcoming, we were the last arrivals of the day and were greeted by my last name, a lovely little attention to detail. The staff were always on hand to help with any queries we had, such as how to use the waterbus, the best way to San Marco etc. The common areas are well decorated with some lovely touches, a lot of marble around the hotel. Breakfast is served downstairs and is a nothing different than any other breakfast other hotels provide, one good thing is that the breakfast room looks out on the canal, it can be really nice to sit there and eat your breakfast while watching people go about their morning schedule. The bedrooms are amazing. We stayed in a suite and I must say it was one of the finer rooms Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. Lovely decorated day room with the TV in the mirror, then leads into a lovely room with a huge 4 poster bed. His and Her sinks also really add to the room. It is a little bit away from the other sights (san marco) but you can get the water bus , or if you get your bearings it isnâ€™t all that long of a walk and there are some magical little side streets you can get lost in. If I ever visit Venice again without question I will stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: Hope51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canal Grande for 3 nights recently. Our driver dropped us off at the Piazzale Roma from where we were able to walk to the hotel. However, although it was relatively close, it was still difficult negotiating bridges with steps carrying heavy bags. I would recommend a short water taxi ride to the landing attached to the hotel. The room we had booked was on the first floor and faced the canal. It was beautifully decorated in traditional Venetian style. We had large windows that opened to the view and we felt very much part of the hustle and bustle of this fascinating waterway. Even our bathroom had french doors that opened out to a view of the small piazza on which the hotel is situated and thence to the Grand Canal. We loved having breakfast and evening drinks on the small deck over the canal. The reception, lounge and breakfast room areas were excellent as were the staff. This hotel is some way from Piazza San Marco but that, for us, was an attraction. We enjoyed exploring the back streets and lanes and seeing the less touristy side of Venice as we made our way across the city to the main "attractions". We splashed out on a water taxi to take us directly from the hotel to the airport on our departure. Booked efficiently by the reception staff it made our departure from Venice another exciting experience. This is a most charming, small but luxurious hotel which I can highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 4travelmore
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Arrived by train. Although the hotel is within sight of the train station, the 80 stairs on the bridge and the labarinth of streets makes it difficult to get to, especially if you are hauling suitcases. A fellow with a water porter shirt on took us there for quite a bit of money, but right to the door and he hauled the luggage. However, we know now that we should have purchased our waterbus pass at that time and taken the bus to the first stop, which is to the left of the hotel...an easy walk from there. That is how we returned to the train station. You could also take a water taxi, but that is REALLY expensive (40 euros). The hotel was a delight. Staff was friendly and helpful. Be sure to follow their advice on local restaurants. We did, and each was wonderful and reasonable priced. The hotel provided a free water taxi to Marino Island and this was one of the hightlights of the time in Venice. The hotel has a small balcony, just perfect to enjoy a bellini or glass of wine at the end of a busy day while watching the traffic on the canal. Our room was clean and comfortable. Nice big bathroom and large shower. Although this hotel is in a district some tourist books consider too far from the main squares, we would stay here again. If you enjoy walking, exploring back streets and taking local water buses, you will also enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff willing to go that extra mile”
Reviews.Author: pupgnolc
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Venice exhausted from an overnight train from Paris. Not feeling 100% I made it from the train station to about 2 blocks from the hotel and needed to sit down so my luggage became my sofa! My travel partner went to the hotel to see if help could be found. Soon, a smiling and very helpful gentleman came around the corner. Lifted my bags with no problem and made sure we were made comfortable as soon as we arrived. Hot coffee, lovely view and some delicious breakfast made the beginning of our stay just a preview of all good things to come. Beautiful, clean and spacious rooms with a view directly on the Grand Canal. The fees to do our laundry were more than reasonable and what a wonderful job! Highly recommend this hotel and the staff is simply exceptional!!

Reviews.Title: “Choose a Junior Suite or more”
Reviews.Author: Grrltrip
Reviews.Content: A quick two night visit to a city we needed a lot longer in. We booked a regular double room which was located separately to the hotel, in a block behind it. It was secured by the need to be buzzed in after pressing the front door bell, which was answered quickly each time. We were offered a Junior Suite on arrival for an extra 35 Euros but thought it would not matter to have the smaller room as we planned to be out most of the time. The staff were very friendly and it was a pleasure to see them each day. Breakfast was great. Cereals, fruits, various coffee choices and cooked options on request, juices, cold meats, cheeses, lots of different breads, yoghurts. I was one happy traveller. A petite terrace on the water meant it was the quick and the dead for a view. A crazy, American tourist decided to join us the one morning we got a table outside, which was hilarious â€“ what she considered appropriate obviously lay in a very special area not familiar to most other people. The location was also very convenient as we took the bus from the International Airport for about 4 Euros each, to the Piazzale Roma bus terminal and it was easy to find (a few bridges along the way â€“ duh, it is Venice) and took about 10 minutes on foot with the luggage in tow. The train station Santa Lucia is even closer. Went to a few restaurants directly across the canal and also a little further down from the hotel. All were great, fresh food and plenty of it. I only wish we had chosen to go to the Junior Suite. It was in the actual hotel building by the canal, it was bigger (the regular room we chose, which was the cheapest of all the rooms, was extremely petite and the bathroom super tiny) and we would not have had to get buzzed in. We sleep light and the room we had (I think it was called the San Marco but I canâ€™t be certain) was the first room at the top of the stairs. We heard the buzzer for the front door clearly and people climbing the stairs and wandering the corridor were very audible. I wish I had stayed longer in Venice â€“ you need at least 4 or 5 days just to stop getting lost in the maze. Great little shops all over, happy people and food that satisfied my pasta, wine and pizza wishes over and over. I would certainly stay in this hotel again, great location, lovely staff, delicious breakfast â€“ I just wish we had chosen the junior suite. Thereâ€™s always next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: CheshirePanda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in March and we had a fantastic time here. Hotel Canal Grande is located just opposite the train station and within walking distance to all tourist attractions. The staff were very helpful and friendly and gave us good recommendations of places to eat and visit. The room was nice and cosy and spotlessly clean. Will recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: julieNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on previous trip advisor recommendations. We were not disappointed. The hotel was clean, the staff very helpful, and it was very convenient to making our cruise ship connection. We enjoyed sitting on the porch at breakfast time and watching the water traffic go by.

Reviews.Title: “The prefect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pietro N
Reviews.Content: Venice is one of the Worlds most beautiful cities in the World and obviously to make your stay an amazing one you need to choose the appropriate hotel that will make your stay a memorable one. well look no further...Hotel Canal Grande is for me after my experience the hotel to booked. I live in Beverly Hills and use to luxury and high standard properties and when I travel abroad I like to stay in small, romantic and local flavor properties....as soon as we arrived we were warmly greeted by Gianni and Giovanna that are a referring contact for you with that true authentic hospitality spirt to serve to make a difference for you. The interior of the hotels is really elegant and the rooms are beautifully furnished, bed comfortable and bathroom top notch . It is an intimate romantic hotel with that sense of family....here you will be taken care off. They serve a good breakfast and the location is great just 20 minutes from St Marks Square. You will be presently surprised See you next time in Venice Hotel Canal Grande Ciao Pietro

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, great service, & very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Spinner36
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The service there was perfect, and the people were very friendly & helpful. I would have given this an excellent rating if the room was only bigger. The one we were given didn't have a desk & had only room for our bags (standard room...still pricey). Although, we were asked if this room was o.k. Of course we didn't complain since the staff was so nice. The rain showerheads were great! It does have modern ammenities. I'd stay again, but pay for a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel on the Grande Canal with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: alfagirlNewcastle
Reviews.Content: The balcony at night was very romantic. The room was beautiful and to a high standard, though quite tiny. We drove so we parked in a nearby town Mastre and took that train to Venice. The hotel is 5 min walk from the train station. the train was only about Â£5 euro return for both of us and the parking was Â£20 for 24 hours. Beware of the cost of the gondeliers. if you go on the boat to the glass factory at Murano, they will try and make you buy the glass. The glass is fabulous but seemed more expensive than it was in the shops! Also we paid 18 euros for a small bottle of coke and sprite and 6 euros each for the band at a cafe on St Marks Square!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dedfar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in September. The service was excellent and we ended up with a room looking over the grand canal, which was very nice and surprisingly quiet. The room was on the small size, but very quaint and nice. The bed was on the hard side for me, which would be my only real complaint. The hotel didn't seem very busy until our last day so we had no problem eating breakfast and having a nightcap out at one of the two tables on the dock. We took a private taxi (110 Euro) from the airport to the hotel which I highly recommend if you can. I am sure the shared taxi (~32 Euro) is good as well. It is a really nice way to approach Venice and get to where you want to go with the least hassle. Our favorite thing about this hotel is the location. You are away from St. Mark's square and the other touristy places, which we really liked. There are some great neighborhoods to explore around the hotel and the crowds are a lot less than the east side of town, where you can easily get to when you want to. You might not like this location if you have issues getting lost, or don't like to walk. You can take the public boat places, but it is much easier to just go out walking. Getting lost in Venice is inevitable. If you let it stress you out you will be miserable. If you have fun with it, it is a great way to explore the city. I would recommend this hotel and gladly stay here next time I am in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Dream”
Reviews.Author: KILester
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our last three nights of our three week Italian honeymoon at this hotel, we have stayed in Venice twice before at the sister hotel of Antiche Figure just opposite which we loved but this time we thought we would try the new hotel. Well, we loved it, we had a superior room which was very grand in style, padded wall paper, grand furniture - a fab mirror that when you point the remote control it turns into a television! Only downside was that we didnt really have a view and the room was small in size, bit difficult with our huge cases. Breakfast was of a good standard of which you can eat on the balcony looking onto the Grand canal. Staff were friendly and helpful too. We enjoyed a glass of red each night after dinner in the hotel bar where you can go on the internet, read, play chess or just look out onto the lake. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Hoopersville Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the train station. Very bright, clean Â and well appointed room with great view of the grand canal from our small window. We had the Casanova suite that was located in the attic area of the 17th century building. Â It's worth getting up early to grab a table on the balcony for breakfast. Staff were all very friendly and attentive. Despite it's history and tasteful furnishings it had a real upbeat modern feel.Â

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: viewobsessed
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of 3 nights in this wonderfully located hotel. The staff, decor and atmosphere were brilliant, as was the deck on the Canal at sunset. Don't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - a real haven”
Reviews.Author: AEBE
Reviews.Content: We got our travel company to swtich us to this hotel after we saw the great reviews on TA. No regrets - this place is a gem. We arrived by train, so the close proximity to the station was a real plus. We worried we might be too far from the 'action' but not at all, it is nicely located in a quieter area of Santa Croce, but all the sights are within walking distance. The hotel has a little deck to the canal side and we had breakfast, pre-dinner and post dinner drinks taking in the comings and goings of Grand Canal life - perfect! Very friendly staff - quality of service and rooms very high indeed. Nothing too much trouble. I would recommend this place to anyone going to Venice - you do get what you pay for at this place and it is well worth paying for!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and calm hotel in a very bustling city”
Reviews.Author: Abby82_10
Reviews.Content: Location: Easy walking distance from the Santa Lucia train station. Also pretty close to Piazzale Roma (main bus terminal). When you cross Ponte Scalzi you can already see the hotel to your left. The hotel is a little further away from Piazza San Marco but that is actually nice as that area can get extremely busy with all the cruise ship day trippers. So itâ€™s nice to come back to the quieter part of the city. When exploring the city, following the â€œalla ferroviaâ€� (to the train station) signs helps you get back into the hotelâ€™s neighbourhood. The hotel is located on a small â€œcampoâ€� right on the canal. At night, you should grab a bottle of wine, sit by the canal and watch the boats go by. This is definitely one of my favourite Venice memories. Room: We arrived a little later in the evening due to a rail strike but were greeted and shown to our room immediately. In addition to the main building that you see on the hotel website and some of the tripadvisor reviews, the hotel owns a second building a little further away from the canal (maybe 3 or 4 houses down) with additional rooms. Our room was the San Giorgio room on the ground floor with pretty much no view (they call it view of a traditional â€œcalleâ€� which is essentially a narrow walkway so you have a view of the opposite building wall). When I booked the room, I assumed that all rooms were located in the main building and had some sort of a view so that was a bit of a surprise. Note that if you want a room with a view, you have to book a Gran Canal Prestige Room. We booked a Prestige Double Room through Expedia and this was the only choice so if you want a room with a view you may have to book it with the hotel directly. Our room was still very nice though â€“ nicely decorated and a good size. Food: The breakfast area is fairly small so it gets a bit crowded during the â€œpeakâ€� breakfast time around 8:30. Wait staff were attentive and they always checked if we wanted another cappuccino or anything else. The breakfast buffet is average for a hotel in this class. A hot breakfast (scrambled eggs etc.) can be ordered for an extra charge of 4 Euros. On two nights we asked the reception staff for their restaurant recommendations and both nights we were pleasantly surprised. They gave us detailed directions and made reservations for us. In terms of getting to the airport, the hotel staff was again very helpful in providing their recommendations. A water taxi will cost approx. 110 Euros for a 20-minute ride and you will have to take a shuttle to get from the boat dock to the terminal. On the other hand, if you got a 1 or 2-day vaporetto ticket, you can take the boat to the bus terminal at Piazzale Roma (only 2 stops from the hotel) and take the bus directly to the airport (drive is less than half an hour and the bus drops you off directly at the terminal for 5 Euros a person). Overall, we had a pleasant stay at Hotel Canal Grande!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: AleNBR
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in Canal Grande. A gem in Venice, near Piazzale Roma where i parked my car, near a vaporetto stop, great staff, great breakfast and great room " Accademia". If you are looking for a hotel to stay in Venice, dont think about it...Stay in Canal Grande. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BarbicanLondon
Reviews.Content: Just about to check out from this awesome little hotel and take the train to Florence. Hotel was recommended by Railbookers as being close to the railways station, which it is, but being on the better side of the canal, which it is! The hotel staff are excellent very friendly and welcoming and also gave some good restaurant tips. 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: oinkerColorado
Reviews.Content: Great staff and customer service, beautiful rooms and awesome location. Don't hesitate to stay there it's awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to train station”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia M
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice hotel that isn't too much of a pain to get to from the train station, this is the one to go to. The hotel rooms are beautiful and the view of the canal is perfect. It was a comfortable stay and within walking distance to all the attractions (tho it is a bit of a trek). Highly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY GOSH amazing”
Reviews.Author: Veronica226
Reviews.Content: Spring for the room overlooking the canal- you can't get a better accommodation. Breakfast is lovely in the morning and included. AVOID the free Murano tour. It's a total sales pitch for overpriced Murano glass(cheaper in the states!!) and they don't drop you back at the hotel- but wherever they feel like in Venice and you need to hike back. Not the hotels fault - optional tour they offer. Only place to stay- it's like being in a romantic poem.

Reviews.Title: “The gem in what was a very tough journey!”
Reviews.Author: Retrofix
Reviews.Content: We were delayed for 10 hours on Tues due to the italian air strikes, and ended up not being able to get our connecting train to Rome. We were directed to this hotel from its sister hotel Antiche Figure. We were nervous about how much a last minute room in Venice would cost but they offered us a room for far less than the going rate. We got to the hotel, and couldn't beleive our luck! beautiful canal location, but intimate, smiling happy receptionist Gianni who asked us to view 2 rooms and pick our favourite! we stayed in the Doge room which had a beautiful 4 poster bed and looked onto the canal. We ended up having a lovely evening and a fantastic nights sleep which we well needed after the nightmare of the previous day! Great breakfast also included in the rate. would definitely choose to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: dp_visser
Reviews.Content: With the luck of the gods I was able to secure a room in this wonderful hotel. No, it was not cheap, but you got what you paid for! The hotel is absolutely charming. The small, cozy front desk area was very welcoming with its sitting area right in front and the staff was absolutely marvelous with us. Everything was explained about the hotel and area and they gave us some wonderful tips on where to eat and where to go (and what to avoid). The room was just beautiful. It had a lovely Venetian touch with the period-style furniture, furnishings and one of the best treats: GOOD air conditioning in the room! The bathroom was large and modern with classic hints as well. There is even a small lift in the building, which was appreciated by many. The Breakfast nook was lovely, with some tables on the small balcony on the water's edge. This is where we enjoyed our breakfast (when it didn't rain!) and the staff were charming with the good coffees and soft drinks for those that wanted something else. Food selection was also very nice. Not a vast spread, but still enough to appeal to all. I had secretly hoped for a room on the canal side, but as we were so lucky to get a room, I was still happy with our room on the side of the small square in front of the hotel. We still had a nice view of the canal and looked out on to the square which was always quiet and relaxing. Location. Whilst many prefer to stay closer to the Piazza San Marco, we were actually thrilled with this hotel's location. It is not far from the main train station, bus station and parking lots near the causeway. Getting to the centre was a short boat ride away. The water taxis stopped not too far from the hotel, but it seemed a bit far as you had to walk in and out of small side streets. The neighborhood had some small bakeries and restaurants where we enjoyed our meals. It's also a very photogenic part of Venice where you can wander for hours and admire the streets, homes and see the real way of life. As part of our package stay we had a complimentary visit to the Murano islands to see the art of glass blowing. Very, very interesting and afterwards you see what all is made and sold, where they do try and sell you anything and everything. We just admired the beautiful glassworks and then returned to the city by way of the water taxi, which we thoroughly enjoyed. To reach the hotel, your best bet is to take the water taxi from the airport to the hotel, where they dock in front of the hotel. It is not cheap as there is a flat rate of EUR 100, but it is quite the experience. Also if you are returning a rental car, return it to the airport as the walk from the car rental return to the hotel is an intricate and tiring one if you have a lot of luggage! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here...it was the highlight of our stay in Venice and would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Venice. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “A touch of elegance in Venice at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: cruizin42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently on a visit to Venice as part of a driving holiday in Europe. We parked our car at the Tronchetto which was well signposted and the instructions on the hotel's website as to getting to the hotel via the vaporetto were very good. We haven't given an hotel a top star rating before but believe that our expections were exceeded with this establishment. The quality of the room was excellent - the service from the staff was fabulous. Nothing was too much trouble and we were always met with a smile and were made to feel welcome. Breakfast each morning was quite good. Don't be put off with the fact that it is a little way from the main square - in tourist season this is a bonus! We purchased the 72 hr vaparetto card which gave us unlimited travel. It even took us out to the islands. My lasting memory of the hotel was returning after dinner and sitting out on the balcony on the canal, live music being played at the hotel opposite, a drink in our hand and the quiet lap of the water around us. Just bliss!! Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A safe choice”
Reviews.Author: iTravelG
Reviews.Content: As its name suggests, the hotel is located by the Grand canal. Its a 3-5min walk from the trainstation, and a 10min walk from the bus terminal, which means it's easily reach both train and airport. The room was beautifully decorated, with old style antique interior, combined with high tech facilities. Beautiful bathroom as well.Â  The hotel doesn't have a restaurant serving dinner, but there is breakfast with a small selection of pastries etc. There are several good restaurants within a few minutes walk, so this is really not a problem.Â  Be aware that queensize bed in Italy usually means 2 twin beds standing next to eachother. We had to ask the handyman to tape the beds together to avoid falling in between the beds, as this was unusual for us. But of course, couples can also sleep in seperate beds.Â  All in all, great hotel within walking distance from most places in central Venice. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Better Than Hotel Canal Grande”
Reviews.Author: PlanetGemini
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in Venice at the Hotel Canal Grande with our two teenage daughters. The location was perfect, convenient and our room was gorgeous. The staff was very helpful and gracious. If and when we ever return to Venice, we would definitely return to the Hotel Canal Grande. Thanks for a great visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jazzjazzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter at the end of August. The hotel is immaculate. The staff are pleasant and helpful and do everything they can to make one's stay as enjoyable as possible. We thought our room was very nice but just a little bit small, so they moved us to another one in an adjoining building the next day. There is a lovely small terrace overlooking the grand canal where we sat and watched Venice go by. We'd go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “I would really like to return to this fabulous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dalaroe
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. We tried two different rooms during our stay -- we had a problem with a malfunctioning air-condition but the management solved it without problems and any hesitation. Sitting on the balcony over Canal Grande sipping on a Bellini is so magnificent -- don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, excellent hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: evans57
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and stayed in the Canaletto suite overlooking the canal. A wonderful room (x2 - adjoining) with fantastic views - our little boy spent lots of happy moments boat spotting from the windows. Excellent breakfasts and a delightful terrace overlooking the canal just perfect for an early evening glass of prosecco! Would definitely recommend and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Small,quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDCHK
Reviews.Content: All hotels in Venice are expensive but I believe this offers a decent value. I stayed for three nights in the first week of Aug in the 1-bedroom suite overlooking the grnade canal for eur 450/night inclusive of tax, breakfast and wifi. It is one stop from the boat station although still a bit of a walk. There is no restaurant but breakfast is served in the few tables in the lobby which also serves as their cocktail bar in the early evening. I get the sense that they are under-manned. The staff for the breakfast also does the luggage service. I suppose with only a few rooms and with most guests out during the day not a lot are needed. In any case we were greeted with a warm welcome upon checkin. There is a convenience store just a few streets behind the hotel for water and soda. Pizzerias and restaurants are in every corner throughout the city. Try to avoid the ones closer to st marco's square as they tend to be more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is superb, but avoid the free Murano tickets”
Reviews.Author: penguindies
Reviews.Content: Everything is of superb quality in this hotel and you can really see the thoughts they put into each detail - from the light switch to where the sockets are placed. We went for the highest room (Casa Nova) in the hotel which has a sky window that opens up to see the sky at night, it was very romantic. Breakfast was truly a gem - the croissants are made fresh and they tasted super delicious. There are only two tables that are out on the balcony so people have to wait for the outdoor tables. They offer free water taxi rides to the glass factory on Murano island, but it was a complete waste of time. Transport organized by the hotel to the island was perfect, but the hotel didn't arrange our transportation back and we were stuff with like 10 other people in small boat which made us completely soaked on our way back. The boat did not stop back at our hotel but just dropped us off, all soaked, at St. Mark's Square. It was the worst boat ride. Avoid the hotel's free ticket to Murano at all, you can better spend your time in Venice doing something else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Excellent, Fabulous, Marvellous!”
Reviews.Author: Maralyn1956
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say only thank you for our perfect stay in your wonderful hotel. Our full thanks go to the wonderful staff at hotel, they were so very attentive and caring, nothing was too much trouble. Thank you especially to the wonderful smiley lady on reception ( I'm sorry, I can't spell your name) you work so hard to make everyone's stay so special, you remembered all of your guests by name and nothing was too much trouble. I asked her one day what time she finished her shift, her reply was, "2 hours ago but I love my job so much I never want to leave" and this shows, her attention to detail is just outstanding, she ensured that my friend and I felt like Princesses. Thank you so much, hope to see you again soon. Maralyn Beswick-Brown

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: valerita
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel.... 5 min walk from train Station and right on canal! Great value.Lovely breakfast.Staff were very accommodating.Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was still there”
Reviews.Author: emm511
Reviews.Content: Venice was our last stop of our two week honeymoon in Italy. We originally booked at the sister hotel Hotel Antiche Figure, upon arrival we were given a free upgrade. They gave us a great room with a balcony (which hardly exist in venice)! They brought over our suitcases and gave us a great recommendation for lunch until our room was ready. The location was excellent. Breakfast selection was very good, it was nice eating on the outdoor deck overlooking the canal. Staff were so accommodating. This was a great way to end our trip. Would stay here again anytime! Please visit Mauro's glass shop while you are in Venice- pls see my other review for him, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dohme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first four days of our honeymoon in Venice and absolutely loved it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was small but had everything we needed. The hotel terrace overlooking the grande canal is spectacular. We enjoyed a few evening drinks sitting here watching the boats and gondolas going past. You can also enjoy breakfast here too. Even though the hotel is situated in Santa Croce, San Marco is only a 20minute walk away and the walk is very enjoyable as there is lots to see and do along the way. We much preferred this location than being closer to San Marco as it wasn't as crowded or cramped. Would definitely go back to this hotel if in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Experience...”
Reviews.Author: mbe62
Reviews.Content: There isn't much I can add to all the glowing reviews except that it's all true! I never write reviews & this place inspired me to write one. It was fabulous!! Perfect location, wonderful staff, tasteful rooms - everything was just the way I hoped it would be. They do things right here, you will not be disappointed. Venice was the highlight of our Italy trip and HCG was the perfect choice for a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem!”
Reviews.Author: 1812Pete
Reviews.Content: Venice is fantastic, and this hotel is truly one of the best I have ever stayed in. In general Venice is very expensive and a lot of the hotels look a bit shabby and run down. The Hotel Canal Grande is perfect in every way. It's away from the hordes of tourists but is perfectly places for "getting lost in Venice" as well as jumping on the Vaporetto whenever you want. The staff are incredibly friendly and seem like they are genuinely pleased to see you and help you. The rooms are beautiful. Well kept, large and luxurious. We stayed in a canal side suite and were blown away by the quality and the view. We will be back and I would put this hotel as one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: bethinhoboken
Reviews.Content: I really can't add much more to whats already been said in the other rave reviews. I wanted the full Venice experience : a hotel room with multiple windows facing the Grand Canal, opulent, well done (and not tacky) interiors, great location and service and I got it all at The Hotel Canal Grande. Definitely would return & recommend to all! Especially loved our 2 room suite- one room for the parents another for the kids, perfect and the price was

Reviews.Title: “Charm of old Venice in a modern hotel, with an excellent situation”
Reviews.Author: Filipoco
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located close to Piazzale Roma (for those arriving from the airport or cruise port) and the railway station of Santa Lucia, this magnificent hotel combines the charm of old Venice and ancient history with modern technology. The rooms are beautifully decorated in the style of palaces in Venice, and are very well equipped, with TVs built into mirrors. I stayed in a junior suite (Santa Lucia) overlooking the city and canal view (laterally). The suite has two floors and a small terrace. It is an ideal hotel to easily get to all points of Venice, with an excellent service (they made me upgrade to a junior suite and were very helpful), good breakfast and easier to take a water taxi for any site. It is definitely a hotel to return whenever you want to spend a few days in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShawnCornell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is little gem located on a quiet piazza looking over the Grand Canal, just over the Scalzi Bridge from the train station and many restaurants and shops. It is easily walkable from the station, if you can manage your luggage over two bridges, if not, a quick ride on the water bus, or even water taxi will bring you there in a moment. The hotel is beautifully kept with a breakfast room, bar and reception on the main level. There is also a tiny balcony on the canal where you can take breakfast or evening drinks - though it does fill up quickly. The staff and service was friendly and not overly stuffy and all staff spoke multiple languages. The piazza outside is a tranquil place to enjoy the afternoon sun and life on the canal. It is clean and not busy like many other places in the city. We reserved a canal view room which did not disappoint. With five tall windows looking over the square and the canal it was filled with light and transported us to another time and place. Whenever we were in the room we flung open the windows to let the sun stream in and enjoy the activity on the canal and piazza. The room was decorated in the over-the-top Venetian style with a marble bathroom complete with window, bidet and rain shower head. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but small”
Reviews.Author: kath84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful hotel. The rooms are quite small but luxurious. They are decorated in classic venetian decor. The hotel staff were very kind and friendly. The breakfast every morning was delicious but the restaurant only serves breakfast so you must eat outside the hotel. It is very close the the main train station. All in all a very pleasant experience. If I had to return to venice, I would probably stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST BOUTIQUE HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: ernrich
Reviews.Content: We are veteran travelers and have stayed at many boutique hotels world wide. This was the best ever. The staff, particularly Giovanna, are proactive, service oriented and gracious. Our room on the top floor had a view of the Grand Canal and was impeccable. The small deck.dock on the main floor was perfect to have a cocktail and watch the sun set over the canal. The staff recommended a small trattoria (Vecio Pozzo) a few blocks away and was by far the best food in Venice and moderate prices. We ate there all four nights that we were in Venice. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who prefers a B & B experience over a convention type hotel. PERFECTO! Grazie tonto Giovanna. ~Rich

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Paddington1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canal Grande after a cruise and catching the train from Rome. It is very close to the station but a tricky walk over stairs if you have heavy luggage. The staff gave us very easy directions and we found it no worries. First night they put us in the new section, spotlessly clean and traditionally decorated in venetian style with the tv in the mirror. However it is not right on the canal but a couple of doors down. After a request they did everything they could to upgrade us for a small charge and move us to the blue room which has a canal view. The room has a four poster bed luxurious curtains and space to move. It has windows that open on to the canal and has double glazing so you don't hear a thing at night. A beautifully decorated room. The hotel is close to some very nice restaurants and the staff are full of helpful hints. We had breakfast (delicious and plentiful) and drinks at night to watch the sunset on the little deck. A fabulous place to watch the venetians go about their daily business. The hotel is very close to several public ferry stops and we booked a private boat to take us to the airport, a little pricey (A$100) but we saw another side of Venice and it surely beats dragging suitcases to buses etc. Overall we highly recommend this hotel for its location, staff and cleanliness. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: saint2761
Reviews.Content: dont need to write too much just a fantastic hotel....staff fantastic, location fantastic,rooms amazing......for a special treat book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Georgiakk
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Canale Grande! We booked the Suite di Dogi which was just breathtaking. The staff were lovely and extremely helpful. The included breakfast was continental however a hot breakfast was available for a small charge. The location was wonderful, we loved relaxing in the room with some of the windows open and listening to the sounds of the canal yet the double glazing meant with them shut the room was very quiet. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ShellyBNyc
Reviews.Content: Agree with all the positive reviews here. Great rooms for family, easy walk from the train station. Giovanna at the front desk helped us with a personal tour guide, reservations, confirming tickets to opera. Loved Venice and this is the location to stay. The first impression upon arriving were wrong (not so great greeting by a man with a bit of attitude) but the next morning we were warmly greeted at breakfast and had the benefit of Giovanna's expertise. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: rdwinelvr
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I didn't leave a review sooner - My husband and I absolutely loved this hotel. It was our first trip to Italy and we picked this hotel based on it's proximity to the train station and the pictures on the website. We were thrilled with the room! We had an amazing view of the Grand Canal and the bed was super comfortable. The staff were all terrifically friendly and helpful at every turn. Yes it's not just around the corner from the main sights of the city, but everything is a pretty short walk or vaporetto ride away. The best part - it's an incredible value. It was certainly the best priced hotel we found in its class on the Grand Canal. I would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: MEFDEF
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and we could not have chosen a better hotel. The facilities are excellent and the staff are very helpful. You simply will not find a better hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Five-star luxury at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: macksters
Reviews.Content: They say it's a four star hotel, but it can easily beat down any 5-star hotel in the region. Its proximity to the train station is nice, in five minutes you're in a train car or a vaporetto. However it's a bit far away from Piazza San Marco and Dorsoduro so buying vaporetto tickets for the entire length of stay would be wise. The hotel is well managed and very clean. We have had all our breakfasts outside on the platform just above the canal, the scene was unbelievable. The staff was friendly yet very careful and made no mistakes. The room decoration is just breathtaking, you must see it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Trip & hotel of a lifetime: I loved it and will return!”
Reviews.Author: snyrting
Reviews.Content: I love it when Tripadvisor reviews point me in the right direction. Venice was one of the stops on my honeymoon and the staff, amenities, and location of Hotel Canal Grande does not disappoint! From the check-in, Gianni welcomed us with a detailed map, suggested walking paths, and a little joke: "call this number and we can come get you. free! if you call after 10pm, we will think you are drunk and we will come get you...for a charge." Here are other highlights: - free wifi - free bottle of prosecco on the house - free hotel breakfast (which you can eat on the terrace, watching the boats go by) - modern amenities which complement seamlessly with the rococco interiors - excellent service (when we couldn't find the local laundromat, they sent an employee of a *sister* hotel to check that it was open and then escort us there-- fabulous!)

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: sam186466
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many of the large chain hotels and been faced with bored looking hotel receptionists, it was a joy to be greeted by the friendly faces at this hotel. From the moment we checked in the staff were helpful and friendly, going out of their way to satisfy our requests. The bedroom was spotlessly clean. The bathroom was quite outstanding if a little small with an amazing shower and fresh towels each day. We were able to breakfast on the terrace most mornings which was an absolutely incredible experience, watching the boats going up and down the canal. The staff serving the food at breakfast were happy to cook whatever requested. We wouldnt hesitate to stay at the hotel again and highly recommend it. The next time we are going to book a room with the canal view.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a prince & princess....”
Reviews.Author: smalltoad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a renovated palace and from the moment we stepped in the front door we were made to feel like royalty. Although we had arrived early morning and our room was not ready, we were presented with a map and given a detailed explanation of how to negotiate Venice and get the best out of it. We were then escorted to the little patio right on the Grande Canal for coffee and nibbles. Our room, Dogaressa (they use names instead of numbers) was on the top floor of the building, with windows on 2 sides and directly overlooking the Grande Canale. We enjoyed watching the comings and goings on the water during the day. We were pleasantly surprised how dead quiet it was at night, the comfortable bed allowing us to have 4 wonderful nights sleep. The only little negative was on one evening, when asking at reception for a restaurant recommendation, we were extremely disappointed with the quality of the food and service. This was more than made up for with another recommendation we received when looking for a place to celebrate a birthday. We were in Venice as part of a trip to celebrate our 20th anniversary so wanted something special. Having done a fair amount of travel - for business and pleasure - we are fairly hard to please, but our experience at this hotel was wonderful and we'd certainly recommend it and would stay again if we were to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Torfner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for an anniversary break. The hotel was excellent - spotless room, great location, and friendly, helpful staff. On arrival we had coffee on the balcony overlooking the Grand Canal - perfect! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, services and location”
Reviews.Author: hookyBucks_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of months ago and had a lovely stay. The hotel is located to the North of the island close to the railway station but don't worry as you can't see it. We had an excellent corner room with views over the Grand Canal and the water bus stops nearby. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the breakfast is more than adequate. We will certainly stay here again when we return. If you can stretch to it ask the hotel to arrange a water taxi from the airport as it gives a great way to approach Venice. Buy a season ticket for the water bus on internet and in advance; its a great way to get around and the ticket includes the bus back to the airport. Also try walking from the hotel to the Rialto, St. Mark's Square and all other points. Venice is not so expensive away from St. Mark's and the hotel will give you some excellent recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “An enchanting room in a magical location.”
Reviews.Author: TurfTycoon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had 2 nights at Hotel Canal Grande before joining a Mediterranean Cruise, and we loved it! When we were shown to our room we just looked at each other, speechless â€“ it was stunning. Having spent many hours planning our holiday and making all the bookings this was a very satisfying moment. This was our first visit to Venice and the city (and this hotel) took our breath away. It wonâ€™t be our last visit. We were in the room (101) named after Rosalba Carriera (a female Venetian portrait painter), which had a partial Canal view through one of several windows that opened up on to the adjacent Campo. The location is fantastic â€“ close to the train station (although you would never know it was there), and a 5 minute stroll to either of two Vaporetto stops. The room was luxuriously furnished, with a nice sized bathroom featuring a big bath (which had a canal view!). The bed was very comfortable and the room was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was a modest affair â€“ not one of their strong points, but if you were lucky you could get a table on the small landing looking out directly on to the Grand Canal. We enjoyed gin & tonics out there one afternoon. There was one free Internet point adjacent to reception which wasnâ€™t too busy. We got a good restaurant recommendation from the front desk and overall the service was very good, especially from Gianni â€“ we would happily have stayed here for quite a bit longer! The hotel is a fair hike from the tourist hot spots like the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco but Iâ€™m counting that as a positive, as it can get crazy in Venice. Thatâ€™s not to say that it isnâ€™t close to a plethora of shops and restaurants, just that you wonâ€™t be over-run in the endless stampede of tour groups. Make sure to visit the nearby gelato shop Alaska â€“ it is legendary. One word of caution â€“ although the hotel is only about 500m from the train station, the Scalzi Bridge is not to be tackled with heavy luggage. My personal trainer will be impressed that I manhandled two bulging 20kg suitcases up and down the 48 steps (I counted them later) but it was a foolhardy exercise. The better option if you have heavy luggage is to pay for a water taxi â€“ damn the expense!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! Tutto perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: pebe
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Hotel Canal Grande. We stayed three nights a year ago, and five nights this time. Everything was just as perfect now as it was the last time. The hotel is situated right on Canal Grande, and to sit on the little terrace with a glass of wine and watch the life on the canal is a perfect and relaxing way to spend an hour or two. The wonderful staff did everything they could to make us feel welcome and at home, and they definitely succeeded in doing so. The hotel itself is a real gem, beautifully decorated and furnished, and everything was spotlessly clean. The breakfast was lovely, and it was served in a beautiful breakfast room. The location is perfect. Close to the vaporetto, the train station and Piazzale Roma. Even so it's a very quiet area. There is also free wifi. This time it was top season because of the opening of the biennale so it was more expensive now than when we stayed here last year. Nevertheless, this is where we wanted to stay. In our Trip Advisor review from July 13. 2010 "Best place to stay in Venice", we ended with the words: We will be back. And now we were. I'm sure we will be back for a third time, too. There are so much to see and experience in Venice and we feel privileged and very lucky to be able to come here and stay in this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: chad25
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal as you dont want to be travelling far through town with your suitcases. Just a walk from the train station, over the bridge - takes 5-10 minutes. Decoration and furnishing of the rooms was impressive. We were there for one night and were put in the top room facing the canal. Seems that this is the smallest room in the hotel but since we were only there for one night it didnt matter too much. Breakfast was a bit limited (dont agree with all the raving posts here) but it's a small hotel so can't be too picky. Staff were great on the whole but we encountered one rather loud and rude woman who scoffed at us when we came down for breakfast at 10am. It runs till 10.30 so I dont know what her problem was - this made us feel pretty uneasy. For that I drop this hotel to a 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Could Try Harder”
Reviews.Author: PeterMirfield
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canal Grande has just won a Trip Advisor award for 2011 which is very impressive and judging by the reviews you would expect it to be first class, which it is in most areas but not all. One of the problems I find with reading reviews on here is that it can boost your expectations of a hotel and you can be a little disappointed when you get there. To be fair it can also work the other way, but in this instance it was the former. We arrived around 12 noon after our early morning flight from Leeds Bradford airport, unfortunately our room was not ready, which was fine as check in time was not until 2pm. We left our luggage and took our small piece of hand luggage and set off to find some lunch. Nearly three hours later when we returned the room we had been designated wasnâ€™t ready but as by this time we were tired of carrying our small hand baggage decided to take a room offered on the ground floor. The room was quite small but contained a very large bed and all the usual furniture, but it was also very dark. There was a bathroom off to one side containing a shower, washbasin and toilet. Now if there is one thing I donâ€™t like in a hotel is being given a disabled bathroom when aged 58. I am sure the time will come when I may well need the use of one, but until that time arrives I would rather have a conventional bathroom. It may be a small point but it bugs me! I am assuming that as this room was on the ground floor and had a disabled bathroom it was their disabled room, but I defy anyone to get a wheelchair around the bed and therefore I can only assume that its there to meet the minimal legal requirements. However knowing there were no other rooms ready, or so we believed, we accepted the smaller room. I have to say though that the bed was extremely comfortable and there was no noise at all. The windows looked out onto a narrow street but no one ever seemed to pass. The hotel is I think relatively new and everything was finished to a very high standard, Breakfast is a buffet affair which is fine but in a four star hotel I would expect fresh fruit salad for breakfast not tinned, the same goes for the orange and grapefruit juice. There is a selection of breads and croissants, cold meats and cheese, however donâ€™t use the toaster if you want to leave the hotel before 11am. It takes that long to brown toast and its rock hard when itâ€™s done it. On a couple of occasions we returned to the hotel early evening to have a drink on the small terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. In a four star hotel I expect lemon or lime in my G&T and some nibbles, especially when paying over Â£18 for the privilege, but there was neither. The hotel location is brilliant, just close enough to the train and bus station and on the quiet side of the Grand Canal. The little square that it is situated in is lovely made all the better by the gentleman who plays the violin in an evening. The small terrace is delightful and in the 4 days that we stayed there we were always able to get a seat even though it only has two tables with two chairs each. Overall this is a good 3.5 star hotel. The staff are friendly and canâ€™t do enough for you but it is just missing that bit of extra polish that would make it a good 4 star hotel. It's the fine detail in the service that's missing. Would I stay there again? Yes I would. I think our disappointment comes from having emailed the hotel a couple of times before we arrived to say that we were in Venice to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary and asking if there was anything they could do to make it extra special and being promised that they would. That promise never materialised and that, coupled with the very good reviews on Trip Advisor probably left us feeling a little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: McKerien
Reviews.Content: We had booked into their sister Hotel Antiche Figure, however due to a double booking we were offered a move to this newer hotel just 800 yards further along the Grand Canal. The staff were very helpful and explained the advantages of this move as we would get a balcony as well as a canal view which we paid extra for. The room was compact as is everything in Venice so very in keeping with the destination, but it was palatial for the price band of the hotel. The thing that made this hotel the best was not the facilities though it was the staff. They were helpful and understood our needs almost before we asked. They helped pick every restaurant for our 3 night stay from a quick local meal after a long flight day one, to an excellent restaurant, with well priced food that melted on your tongue, for our 20 year wedding anniversary celebration. The continental breakfast was excellent with a good choice and fabulous coffee options rather than a pot! They offered excellent advice on when and where to take a Gondola ride so we got the best quality ride. The rooms were clean and the maid service was of a high standard also. Anyone wanting an excellent stay in Venice this is a great choice. A small tip is that this hotel is situated nearer the bus and train station, so get the number 5 bus form the airport rather than the water bus as that was very slow and arrived at the wrong end of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: Newlywed08DC
Reviews.Content: As many of us do, my wife and I stayed in this hotel last month after reading the positive reviews here - and we were not disappointed! Outstanding breakfast, staff service (esp. the breakfast staff!), check-in/out process, not to mention an extremely convenient location near the train station and a vaporetto (i.e. water bus) stop. We stayed in the Santa Lucia room which, though not on the canal, was spectacular in its own right. As others have mentioned, an early breakfast on the outside deck is a must and truly rejuvenating. The wifi was difficult to access via Android phones, but fine via laptops. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: awful_in_aqua86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner and we loved it. The room was comfortable and the decor was very Venitian. We were in the cheaper-priced room so I can imagine the more expensive ones must be gorgeous. Breakfast was included in the price and was very good. The hotel was a 2 minute walk from the main train station in Venice. To get to the touristy places like Rialto bridge and San Marco square took about half an hour on foot, and in the other direction were the less-touristy streets that we really loved. Staff were very friendly and helpful, we had a great restaurant recommendation! I would absolutely stay here again, it was a highlight in my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Average Accomodations at Luxury Price”
Reviews.Author: sp-24x7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2011, 5 nights at $525 each for canal view. Room on the top floor had unusable table and chairs (extremely low ceiling), and sharp step up into the bathroom - dangerous at night if you forget it is there. We were very tired when we arrived and didn't really think aout these things until after we were unpacked. Amenities reminded us of a Holiday Inn Express - plastic drinking cups in the room, powered juice (TANG) on the beakfast buffet - OK for half the price, but not at luxury rates. Staff was very polite but recommended a lousy restaurant - we didn't ask again. Area is quiet and convenient to train station. Loved Vencie but we won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “TripAdvisor Hotel of the Year winner 2011 - Well deserved!”
Reviews.Author: glyjanna
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel for 4 nights from 29/5/11. I booked the rooms via Hotel.com and got what I felt to be a very reasonable rate, especially for a hotel in the centre of Venice and one which was regularly receiving very positive feedback on this site. Having booked the hotel I e-mailed the hotel reception a couple of weeks before we were due to arrive to tell them our trip was to celebrate our silver anniversary and to ask them to have flowers and champagne in the room for our arrival. I received a quick and friendly response from the hotel detailing prices etc. I explained that we would be arriving at the hotel from the airport by water taxi and they offered to make the necessary arrangements. On arrival at the airport we simply presented ourselves to the Venezia Water Taxi desk in the main building and we were taken direct to our taxi. We were met at the hotel's water landing by the porter then straight to the reception desk where we were offered the option of upgrading to a room with a private terrace overlooking the Grand Canal for â‚¬30 per night. We were shown both rooms before deciding, and happily took up the offer of the upgrade - that's not to say the original room was in anyway inferior. The weather for the next few days was superb and we made good use of the terrace every evening. As far as we could make out the room we took up was the only one in the hotel with a terrace, indeed the only one with a terrace in the area! The room itself was compact but had a very comfortable queen-sized bed and was beautifully decorated. Although the hotel is situated on the canal itself, the noise from the passing traffic is not intrusive and it was great to watch the world go by while enjoying a glass or two of wine after a full day's sight-seeing. The hotel is located 10 minutes walk from the main railway station and only a couple of hundred yards beyond that is the main bus station. They are both conveniently located but one can't see trains or buses from the hotel and neither in anyway detract from the wonderful location. The staff at the hotel were exceptionally friendly and helpful and we have no hesitation in recommending it to others. If visiting the hotel, one tip we would give is to use the Vaparetto stop near to the hotel rather than cross the 2 bridges to the main Vaparetto stop(s) outside of the railway station. Neither bridge is overly challenging, but after hours of walking round Venice it is so much easier to walk 50 Metres on the flat rather than 400 metres over 2 bridges!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geomil983
Reviews.Content: Let us begin by expresssing our gratitude to Gianni, at the front desk. He immediately made us feel at home and part of the family. He bent over backwards to ensure that our stay would be memorable, and he succeeded. Our accommodations were excellent. We were shown two rooms to choose from and opted for the room in the main building. The location of the hotel is extremely convenient from the train station (you can easily walk but you must carry your luggage over the bridge). It is on the Grand Canal, but on the quieter section (which is much more desireable). The breakfast was plentiful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mamaxs2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on the Grand Canal. Location to shops, restaurants, and gondola ride was perfect. Our room was very large, 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The bed was a beautiful canopy bed, which our 3 year old daughter loved. The staff was hugely helpful with restaurant choices, places to go etc.,. the breakfast buffet was great too. The rooms are on the smaller side, but very clean and well done, with beautiful decor. We traveled thru 9 countires and this was one of our favorite hotels. You do have to park in a garage away from the canals (obviously no cars!), but it wasn't too bad and we were walking in 90 degree heat with luggage and a 3 and 5 year old. You do leave your keys on the dash in the car in the lot, which seemed strange for us as Americans, but all was well as this is the norm. We even left a ton of luggage in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: walkman6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Canal Grande for two nights at the end of our ten-day trip in Italy. The staff, particularly Johnny, Giovanna, and Natasha were so warm and gracious that we immediately felt right at home. The location is just a 5-10 minute walk from the train station and right on the Grande Canal. Our room, "Academia" was nicely furnished with a nice sized bath. The breakfast was fine and if you time it right you might get one of the two tables on the deck right on the canal. Very peaceful. The Vaporetto stop was very convenient (at the train station) or you were a 20-30 min walk to St. Marks. Johnny suggested that the best way to see Venice was to walk and just get lost in the city. We were very successful at the getting lost part. It was fun just to just follow your nose and you eventually find everything. I would highly recommend Canal Grande to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “hotel canal grande is the best hotel in venice italy”
Reviews.Author: tantoco
Reviews.Content: Giovamme of the Hotel Grand Canal Venice was so amazing, most helpful, friendliest, most courteous staff of this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Location, and Weather at Grande Canal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuaneT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day trip with 4 nights at the Grande Canal Hotel. After a very uncomfortable overnight red-eye flight from Charlotte/Philadelphia, we were surprised at how easy it was to travel to the hotel from Marco Polo Airport. We decided to travel via the local bus to Main Venice Bus terminal and see/listen to the locals as they boarded at various points as well as enjoy the scenery on the way in from the mainland over the lagoon bridge to Venice proper. From the bus depot, we walked about 12 to 15 minutes winding over two foot bridges along the canal (we started window shopping within 1 minute after getting off the bus) and through a short alley way past a gondola stop and there was the hotel entrance in an open quiet courtyard (Venice is not ADA friendly...so bring good walking shoes). We arrived around 10:30 AM and were greeted by the friendliest reception staff. We requested the largest most quiet room possible (we were really tired). They allowed us to view several rooms first and we decided to stay in the adjacent apartment (about 50 feet further in from the courtyard). The room (picture attached) impressed us the most but did not have a canal view except for a mini-space between adjacent apartment buildings...which also meant it was very quiet). The room was wonderfully appointed with elegant drapes, window treatments, the largest bathroom in the complex of our room type, but you would need to walk up 2 flights of stairs (they carried our bags so that was not a real issue). We had our own separate private entrance, which we found a nice touch as we ended up constantly going in and out all day There were no other rooms/guests on the 3rd level so it was like having a private apartment/floor all to ourselves. There is a church about 50 feet away, so you will hear churchbells at 7:30 AM in the morning but I think that is the case anywhere in Venice. The nights were always quiet...not even noise from any other hotel guests of local Venetians. I mentioned the staff at the recption were wonderful, but I also found all the staff were always friendly, responsive, and attentive including the concierge, breakfast buffet servers/cooks, maid, and groundskeepers. Indeed, we found almost all the Venetians we met were really helpful and friendly...most spoke English as well. Free Wifi comes and breakfast buffet was included in our reservation. The Hotel is strategically placed on the Grand Canal so you can jump on the any of the water transports (water bus, gandola) to see the whole city. There were tons of places to eat, we enjoyed a self service BREK where they cooked your food on the spot in front of you and the adjacent pizza joint where they also cooked the pizza right in front of you!!! We enjoyed watching and conversing with the food cooks every day were were there. We did find it very easy and scenic to take the water transport everywhere, but we made it a point to walk back as much as possible through the various alley around San Marco Square and Rialto Bridge through the Strada Nuovo back to our hotel. We had great weather (warm but not hot with cool mornings/evenings) except for one day with rain which we used to visit the inside of the civic Museums and churches. The hotel staff arranged for a water taxi to take us directly from the hotel to the Marco Polo airport. While the water taxi cost 100 euro for boatride, the crisp clear day made the trip a great way to conclude our last hour in Venice winding through the canals and over the lagoon where the snow-capped mountains provided another memorable view. We had a great trip and the hotel's staff, location, colorful decorations, breakfast buffet really added to the splendor of Venice. If you're going to Venice, this is the hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Perfect Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: charlottemary
Reviews.Content: We were five friends traveling and we all agreed this hotel was wonderful. The rooms offered everything you would want in a hotel. They were comfortable and charming! The service was wonderful. John at the front desk was so helpful. Loved the location. It was at a stop on the water taxi, and was close enough to the train station that you could walk to with your luggage but not so close that you felt the crowds by the station area. We would recommend this hotel to friends and would stay at it again! (My room even had a terrace) Outstanding hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Classic and personal Italian elegance right on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Steven123
Reviews.Content: This is indeed an excellent hotel and it starts even before you arrive. If you arrive via Piazzale Roma (where bus transfers from the airports arrive), it is only a 10 minute walk on the bank of the Grand Canal to the hotel. Very convenient. The check in is great. Front desk is manned by Giovanna, a wonderful woman who is always helpful, most knowledgeable, and always ready with a smile. She has excellent English with the most charming Italian inflection! The hotel has a wonderful location. We were paying Euro 290 per night for a double (not a low rate if you ask me) but luckily for us, Giovanna upgraded up to a double room which also included a beautiful outdoor terrace with a view of the Grand Canal. The size of the terrace was 50% the size of the room! The room was spotlessly clean, elegantly decorated, but quite small compared to other hotel rooms we'd pay a similar price for in other cities, and the bathroom, although also spotless and brand new in terms of design and fixtures, was also narrow and small (i.e. only one person could be in it at a time). So, now you realize how expensive Venice is and what you have to pay! By the way, eating in Venice is likely 50% more expensive than in the rest of Italy. So, choose your restaurant's wisely and spend a little more to get something truly memorable. The hotel is located just opposite, by a bridge, to the Vaporetto water bus service, where for Euro 6.50 per person, you can travel anywhere on the Grand Canal and beyond. It takes 40 minutes or so to San Marco on the "local" water bus with all the stops. But do it since every minute on the Grand Canal is breathtaking. The breakfast was very nice and of good quality. Nice cold cuts, fresh croissants, choices of yougurts, hard boiled eggs, and more! They have friendly serving people there including a nice Russian lady as well who speaks great Italian also. I would certainly recommend this hotel. A wonderful place. Even more wonderful if you can get a lower price for your room! I gave 4 stars on value given the price we paid for the rather smallish room, although with the upgrade including the terrace, we felt the price was more or less reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel to stay in while in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Whitby_Canuck
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed should you choose this hotel. My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights over the Easter weekend and it was everything that we had hoped for. We were booked in the Antonio Canova room, which I think is the ONLY hotel room in all of Venice with its own terrace (2nd floor). It had a great view of the canal, was lavishly decorated, and a welcome retreat after a long day schleping the streets of Venice. The staff were most accommodating and gracious. Breakfast consisted of good, strong coffee, yogurt, boiled eggs, cold meats/cheeses, cereals, fruit, croissants/breads, juices. They even made coffee for me to take up to the room before the breakfast station opened. They have a computer to use free of charge. The hotel recommended a nearby restaurant for a late evening dinner (Ostaria al Vecio Pozzo) which we visited more than once. They had great anti-pasti, pasta, pizza, and wine for a reasonable price. We visited San Marco Square (very busy), Murano Glass Factory (interesting, but not a must-see place), and toured the old Jewish Ghetto (very quiet compared to the rest of Venice). We did the water taxi ride from San Marco back to the hotel (90 Euro) but it's a great way to see the city. The gelato in Venice is OUT OF THIS WORLD. We had it for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Because it was Easter weekend, Venice was extremely busy and we were sick of the tourists by day 4. It reminded us somewhat of Niagara Falls on a long weekend with a different water feature. It is, however, unlike any other city in the world. No matter how detailed your map is, you will get lost, but that's part of the fun. We had an early (6:50 am) flight out of Marco Polo Airport when we left. A word to the wise, the Number 5 bus is the most cost efficient way to get to the airport from Venice. It cost 3 Euro per person versus 120 Euro for an off-hour water taxi. We did a trial run out to the airport by bus the day before we left just to see what we would be in for. The bus station is less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel and you cross 3 small bridges (not the Scalzi bridge) on the south side of the canal. The Marco Polo Airport is a whole other story. On our trip, we hit 7 airports (including Russian airports) and the only one we had any trouble with was Marco Polo. Wrong boarding passes leaving Venice and then a 3-hour strike on our return visit which laid us over for another day. At least we got out before the Pope and 300,000 fans arrived. But don't miss the HOTEL CANAL GRANDE...definitely worth staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing service, location, and a clean beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: DeannaLeah
