Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we stayed in on our 3 week adventure across Italy. Upon checking in, my friend and I were asked if we'd like to upgrade to a bigger room for no charge, because apparently a 'double' room on Otel.com means a honeymoon-type suite with only a double bed. Our room wasn't in the main part of the hotel, but actually in the next building, which I was a little apprehensive about, but it turns out to be the most beautiful hotel room I've ever seen in Italy. We still had canal views if we poked our heads out the window a bit and we looked out over a nice little courtyard. The breakfast each morning was really quite good and the staff are always eager to make a specialty coffee for you, although they also provide self-serve coffee with the breakfast which was really good too. In the evenings before dinner we often drank wine on the small hotel terrace which overhangs the grand canal and would sit and watch the sunset and the passing boats. It was truly beautiful. The location was fabulous; a short walk to the train station and the main parking area of Venice (where you arrive by bus or taxi from the mainland). It's not the most touristy area of Venice, which is a bonus in my opinion, but lots of great restaurants in the area for better prices than you'll find in San Marco. The hotel offers a free boat ride to Murano if you want to go see the glass making factory, which was kind of interesting to see, but the prices are insanely ridiculous.! You can find WAY cheaper Murano blown glass anywhere in Venice. If you don't have a lot of time, I wouldn't waste it going to Murano. I would definitely stay at Hotel Canal Grande again and would recommend it to anyone. I got a superb deal on Otel.com too.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Amandi34
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Canal Grande is exactly as it is described and shown on their website! Which is a good thing! We arrived late evening and were shown to our room. The rooms are spacious and our room looked out to the Grand Canal which was fantastic! The hotel is just over the bridge from the train station. The rooms are very nice. My only complaint is that for me the sheets seemed itchy, but that could just be me. We stayed here for 3 nights; 1 evening we enjoyed wine and some salami we bought right no the deck over the canal, it was awesome! The staff is pretty helpful. We only made it down to breakfast once, but wish we had made down everyday, as it was great! Plenty of food to choose from! I loved Venice, definitely once of my favorite places!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely new hotel near the train station”
Reviews.Author: atwc
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Antiche Figure (3*), but on arrival were offered a free upgrade to their sister hotel, the Hotel Canal Grande (4*). The hotel is on a quiet square located on the Grand Canal within walking distance of the train station. This is a convenient location, close to a vaporetto station that can save an expensive water taxi rides to/from your hotel. Some rooms have a canal view, but ours fronted on a quiet square. The room was very well equipped and comfortable - and quite luxurious - especially the bathroom. The breakfasts were of very high quality, and the staff was very helpful. Wireless internet was provided free of charge. We're glad we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the Best Location in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: angieyca
Reviews.Content: We're so pleased that we moved our travel date in order to get into their Elegant Suite for a few days. Hotel Canal Grande has a great location which is closed to the water shuttle, train station and bus station. We've seen many tourists have to drag their bags for long distance in order to get to their hotel but we're lucky it only took us 10 mins pleasant walk from the bus station to the hotel. We even managed to take a day trip to Milan by taking the train just a cross the bridge from the hotel. Even though the hotel is closed to everything, it has a private location so it is not crowded or noisy around it. The hotel is petite but nicely decorated. The Elegant Suite is spacious and well equipped. Staffs are friendly and helpful. The trip to Murano included with our room is good too. Breakfast is plenty and food is in good quality. The only thing we would complain about is the quietness of the room. We don't mind hearing the traffic on the Grand Canal but the rooms are probably not so well sound proofed. Every morning, we could hear people upstairs walking around the room, talking or flushing the toilet. Sometimes it happened quite early in the morning so that surely affected our sleep quality. So maybe if you book a room at the top floor, it will help. We love Venice and think April is the best time for visit. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to any friends and families who are planning to go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: VillaDS
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and welcoming on arrival. Recommended and booked a table at nice trattoria nearby as arrived early evening. Stayed in rooms next to main hotel. Both immaculate and quality furnishings. Mirror doubled as a tv which impressed the kids. San Marco room's bathroom was on the small side but the Accademia room was slightly larger and had a spacious bathroom and a better view. Breakfast was more than adequate with good choice of typical continental offerings. All staff were friendly and efficient. Hotel is excellently located for train and bus station. Good restaurants nearby and famed Alaska ice cream shop. Free wi-fi also available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Venice - would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: JBizzle76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 12 day trip to Italy, of which 3 nights were spend in Venice. We started are trip in Venice, so the Hotel Canal Grande was our introduction to Italy. We were not disappointed! The hotel is EXCELLENT - very well maintained with great rooms. It certainly has a "Venetian" feel to it which is what we wanted. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary, so the staff upgraded our room for the first night. This was especially nice since the airline lost our bags. The hotel is situated perfectly just across the canal from the train station - this is on the opposite end from St. Marks square, so it was nice at night to be able to retreat from the super touristy areas. There are plenty of little restaurants and bars within a few minutes walk, and the ferrovia station (public transit) is also just across the canal. Giovanni at the front desk was especially helpful and friendly. We would definitely return to this hotel the next time we visit Venice! Thanks Hotel Canal Grande for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Memories are made of this....”
Reviews.Author: SteveandMelanie47
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked into sister hotel the Antiche Figure, just a few yards up the grand canal. We were given the choice of our original room overlooking the canal (which was perfectly nice), or one in this hotel, which is newly refurbished. The room was again overlooking the canal but had a beautiful four poster bed and a brand new bathroom. There was no footpath in between the hotel and the canal either, which seemed to cut down on noise. We chose the Canal Grande, but I'm sure we would have had an equally good holiday with our original choice. The Canal Grande is first class. The staff are all very obliging and professional, we could not fault one of them. The hotel is spotlessly clean. It is very convenient for arriving and departing Venice. The walk to St Marks is fine, once you have got your bearings but getting lost in Venice is part of the enjoyment. We recommend 100% visiting the top of the Campanile in St Marks Square. The view is fantastic. The breakfast is typical continental fare, perfectly fine. The deck over the canal is a little piece of heaven. Sitting with a drink, watching the world go by is something that will be our memory, more than any other, of the wonderful way we celebrated our 25 years of marriage. Cannot imagine how anyone could be disappointed in this little gem!

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: twopointfourchildren
Reviews.Content: My mum, sister and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, we chose it because of the comments on trip advisor and were not disappointed. The rooms were beautiful, comfortable and clean we had one room in the hotel and 2 rooms were in another building but this was not a problem. The breakfasts were good and lots of choice.The location could not have been better-we took a 5 euro bus from Marco Polo airport to the Piazzale Roma then crossed 2 bridges during a ten minute walk to the hotel, we were travelling light so did not find this too difficult. We purchased a 72 hour vaporetto pass for 33 euro and were pleased with how easy and convenient they were to use to get to all the places of interest- we certainly had our money worth, everything else was expensive...! Venice was wonderful and the Hotel Grande made it a very special visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect welcome to Venice”
Reviews.Author: SpiderPrincess
Reviews.Content: Venice was our initial stop on our first trip to Italy, so we didn't really know what to expect; however, taking the water taxi and seeing our hotel on the way was a welcome sight. After a very short walk from the taxi stop to the hotel, we were VERY warmly greeted by the impeccable hotel staff. They offered us coffee & snacks immediately, showed us to our room, and offered to help with anything we needed while in lovely Venice. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the location was great for walking and getting lost in this mysteriously wonderful city. We also enjoyed a few hours sitting right outside the hotel looking over the canal. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you want.”
Reviews.Author: 2011KJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what you're looking for in Venice. Conveniently located, clean rooms, friendly staff and nice decor. I have to say though, the best part (and highlight of our entire European vacation) was spent on the front deck of this hotel. After a long day wandering through Venice, we would sit on the three table dock sipping a birra watching the world go by while the last of the days sun went down. We sat out here every morning for breakfast and in the afternoon and were surprised that we never had to wait, we were alone most of the time. I would return to this hotel solely on that experience. La dolce vida!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!!”
Reviews.Author: sbgtv
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading at least 100 positive reviews. Each review said the hotel and its location were amazing. Let me tell you, IT IS AMAZING!!!! Look no further for a beautiful, elegant, romantic, clean and absolutely gorgeous hotel!! And the location is just as fabulous---just a 5 min walk along the Grand Canal from Piazza Roma and you're there! The hotel is situated on the Grand Canal which is simply breathtaking!!! I rely heavily on TripAdvisor when I search for hotels---of all the sensibly priced hotels I've ever booked, the Hotel Canal Grande was by far most impressive I've ever chosen. The incredible staff is just as wonderful as the hotel itself. They were always so kind and helpful---bringing us coffee up to our room on a silver platter with china teacups. Everyone there goes out of their way to make your stay memorable. The buffet breakfast was simple but delicious---you look out over the Canal which is simply magnificent!! I would recommend this hotel to you not just because of the reasonable price, but because it couldn't be more centrally located, and it is simply a gorgeous hotel in every sense of the word. You will NOT be disappointed!!! I was even surprised at the spacious size of our enchanting venetian twin room---and so quiet!!! Who knew that a hotel right on the Grand Canal could be so charming and still so quiet!! I truly cannot say enough fabulous things about this hotel. I loved loved loved the Hotel Canal Grand and so will you!!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Hype-It's as Great as the Reviews Say”
Reviews.Author: kchartsf
Reviews.Content: We spent one night pre-cruise and one night post-cruise in Venice at the Hotel Canal Grande. It was absolutely wonderful. Both of the rooms we stayed in were lovely. The breakfast is fabulous and the staff ALL go out of their way to help in any way possible. They arranged for us to share a water taxi to the port with another couple going on the same cruise. They also arranged a water taxi to the airport for us. They gave us great suggestions for dinners & directions everywhere we wanted to go. I asked for tea one afternoon and they set it up outside on the balcony overlooking the grand canal. A lovely end to an afternoon. It's worth a trip to Venice to stay here. It is fantastic!!! Free wifi was a terrific bonus as well. We really enjoyed staying in Santa Croce away from the hustle and bustle of the piazza san marco

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cafas
Reviews.Content: After arriving from a long train ride from Nice, France - we arrived at our first destination in Italy. Venice. The hotel is Easy to find (kind of) from the train Station. However after discovering Venice, nothing is easy to find with the winding streets and confusing laneways and bridges. It is very close to the train station, the welcome was very warm - friendly and the customer service was impeccable!!! We were offered a choice of 2 rooms - which we inspected and Gianni kindly advised that the woman is to choose (Jokingly) :) However I took his recommendation of the Casanova room which is in the attic and looks out over the Grand Canal. The rooms were spotless, beautiful / spacious and the bathrooms are incredible. The Shower heads are like a giant ufo :) The location is perfect. If you get lost u will find a small bar where you can have any drink you like for under 1 Euro (fontdamenta Dei Tolentini is the street its one - the bar is called - BARCAERT DA LELE) It is easy to walk everywhere - and it is close to 2 main ferry stops. We would highly recommend this hotel to any of our friends or family. Location/ Service / The breakfast and the Room are more than comfortable for the price. !!!

Reviews.Title: “Carlo ruined our experience, but otherwise, stay here”
Reviews.Author: paypar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights arriving via train. First let me say the location cannot be beat. You simply cross the bridge and make a few turns and you're at the hotel - no taxi or long trek required. We did plan light though. It is on the opposite side of the train station so it is nice and quiet. It is also a short walk to the Piazzale Roma where you can catch a bus to the airport for Euro 3. Carlo who greeted us, asked us to wait for a bit and told us the breakfast was still open (this was around 10:30am) while he got our room ready. When he got us for check in he then informed us he would charge us Euro 10 instead of 15 for breakfast. My husband thought the breakfast should have been included to which Carlo replied that is tomorrow. We were really upset about this and stewed about it the entire day. He also sent us to a very expensive place for lunch, and suggested very expensive activities like the opera. When we asked about transportation to the airport, he recommended all the expensive means, like water taxi, instead of the public bus, which he brushed off by saying 'I take the bus all the time so I don't want to take the bus' We kind of just felt he was getting kick backs and it left a very bad taste in our mouths. Almost ruined our trip. He also told us he would 'upgrade' us to a canal facing room but that we'd have to change into another room the next day. This room, #301 Giacomo Cassanova was basically the attic, and while nice, had low ceilings, and the view wasn't much to write home about - a tiny window. The room we moved into next 204, Carlo Goldoni, while not canal facing we liked better because we had an actual ceiling!! The rooms are very nicely decorated and clean. Now, having said all that, the rest of our trip we never saw him again, and the front desk did not charge us the 10 euros for breakfast (even tho' carlo had written it on our passport photocopies!) AND they were all MUCH nicer and more helpful than Carlo. Sadly we were too afraid to tell the management about this bad employee lest we be charged the Euro 10 and god knows what else.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews were correct”
Reviews.Author: dmuga34
Reviews.Content: Traveled in March 2011. Arrived to receive free upgrade to mini suite - 2 floors and roof top deck. Surprisingly quiet location at night. Location - across the canal (there is a bridge at that location) from the trian station and water bus stops = convenient to everything. Nice, quiet piazza in front of hotel, plenty of restaurants/shops that are slightly less touristy than in san marco. Can walk through san marco through streets of venice, or take the vaporetto Service - incredibly nice, great dinner recommendations, free capuccinos, delicious breakfast, free internet available

Reviews.Title: “The superb customer service made this hotel special”
Reviews.Author: PassportUK
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late, at approx 11:30pm and were welcomed by the receptionists. We were quickly checked into our room, the luggage was taken for us, and the receptionist followed us to show us how everything worked in the room. She said she would give us a map and explain things in the morning after we had got some sleep. We had a great night sleep, the bed was so comfortable. We did not have a canal view room but we had a room on the side which was very quiet as the hotel is on a private sqaure so there is no through traffic. There are a couple of benches outside in the courtyard and its a great place to sit and watch the canal boats and gondolas go by. The room was quite small but had everything we needed and was beautifully furnished. The TV is built into the mirror so the feel of the room is not ruined by a TV. In the room there was also a desk area, and a wardrobe, with a free safe inside. We were given a free Wi-Fi code on arrival for 2 hours internet use, which was more than enough. The bathroom had a superb rain shower with body jets and was so good I did not want to get out. Free toilettries are provided. The room was clean and serviced daily. Beakfast is continental, and was served 6.30-10am each day. There are a selction of juices, cereals, breads/cakes/toast/pastries, fruit, meats, cheeses and yogurts. The waitresses will get you fresh tea or coffee inc latte, cappuccino, expresso etc. The breakfast staff were very attentive. The reception staff gave us a map and explained where everything was, I found them very helpful, and their English is perfect. Check out is at 12noon and or flight was not until 10:40pm but the hotel were more than happy to look after our bags for us until later in the day. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff here and they always seemed genuinely interested in how you were, and if they could be of any assistance. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- NON HOTEL INFO Getting to Venice: We flew to Venices' Treviso Airport from London Stansted and a shuttle bus was waiting for our flight. For 9Euros return per person you can catch the shuttle bus. It takes approx an hour (about the same time it takes to get from the Marco Polo airport to Venice by boat). The bus arrives at the main bus terminal (Piazzale Roma) and the hotel is a short 10 min walk from there. The driver will give you a return timetable and the return journey was just as well organised and quick. Travelling around Venice: We purchased a 36 hour unlimited waterbus ticket for 23Euros each. Gondalas and water taxis can be VERY expensive and this is a great way to get around. You can go everywhere on the water buses and we went all around Venice, and even ventured out to Murano island (famous for its glass), Burano island (famous for its couloured houses, and our favourite place in Venice), and Lido (Venices seaside island). Also do not forget to travel by foot, they say the best way to see Venice is on foot and get lost!! Eating in Venice: The closer you are to either the water or a famous landmark such as San Marco Square the more expensive food and drink is, and the worse food gets as they cater for tourists and not Italians! As an example a litre of beer is approx 23Euros in San Marco square compared to 10Euros in a side street with no canal view. Also the more you go out of Venice, or onto an island the more Italian food gets and the better it gets. I found the pasta dish I had by the Grande Canal was dry and bland, yet when we ate in a small Italian cafe in Lido it was fresh, and full of flavour.

Reviews.Title: “Fab 50th in luxurious surroundings......”
Reviews.Author: lastminutebobyork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate my 50th Birthday and had a fantastic time. Travelled into Treviso Airport and travelled into venice by coach for 9 euros return. The coach/bus station is located about 5 mins walk from the hotel and very easy to find. Venice is a wonderful place and can honestly say never been anywhere quite like it. The hotel is wonderful and the staff very welcoming and informative on local restaurants and places to visit, rooms very luxourious and clean, breakfast is good with the added bonus of overlooking the grand canal and watching the world go by. Would I stay here again, yes without hesitation...

Reviews.Title: “A hotel at the top of its game”
Reviews.Author: mmeckes
Reviews.Content: As with some other reviewers, I was also booked into a sister hotel, and was upgraded to the Hotel Canal Grande. I have stayed in a number of hotels this year, on business and pleasure, and this hotel put them all to shame. The welcome warm but not at all overbearing, and all of the staff seems genuinely pleased to have you as their guest, and wanted you to experience the best of their unique city. The staff seemed to have a sixth sense about when you wanted assistance, and I only had to glance up at any time day or night, to have my drink refilled, or my question about Venice expertly answered. The room was lovely and spotlessly clean. The location is tucked around a corner from the tourist crowds, but perfectly located for exploring the city. If I had my way all British hoteliers should be forced to spend a week at this hotel to understand the meaning of hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm and elegance”
Reviews.Author: DukeB
Reviews.Content: Stay here was a real pleasure. We can't give this hotel high enough marks. The staff went to great lengths to help us. We were originally supposed to stay at another sister hotel of this one. We were offered an upgrade at this hotel. The Hotel Canal Grande sent over a staff member in the pouring rain with umbrellas to escort us over. They then went back to the other hotel (in the rain) and transferred our luggage over. Since it was early in the morning and our room was being cleaned they let us wait in the bar area with a free beverage. The hotel radiated an old world charm; dark highly polished woodwork, brass railings and fixtures that gleamed in the light, and glass that shined. The woman at the counter was very helpful in pointing us in the right directions to attractions and restaurants and she even helped us save 50 Euros by finding another couple we could share the water taxi with to the cruise ship.We can't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Crasie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right on the grand canal. It was not far walking distance from the train or bus stops. We took the bus from the airport and were happy to see we didnt have far to walk with our suitcases. They upgraded us to a suite next door that was 2 levels with a deck. Breakfast was a nice spread of breads and juices. We were only there one night. Wear sneakers in Venice, you will do alot of walking and there are alot of steps and bridges!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean very friendly - couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: 3fromtheUK
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend wedding anniversary trip and picked hotel based on Internet reviews. Was warmly welcomed and given map fro Venice and great advice on getting round. Staff could not be more helpful and were given a FOC upgrade for first night to an available Canal view room. Nice breakfast and free of charge wireless Internet too . Can heartly recommend. G+A

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with fantasic rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Trayci1505
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. We went to Venice to celebrate my 40th birthday and the hotel exceeded all my expectations. Venice is totally beautiful and this hotel mirrors that. On arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite. This had a lounge area, with a tv in the mirror! Not one but two bathrooms and my favourite, a huge four poster bed! the room was spotlessly clean as was all of the hotel. The staff were very welcoming and talked us through a map of the area, pointing out any areas of interest. It is situated very close to the water bus, train and bus station. We used a water taxi to arrive at the hotel, a great experience, however we traveled back to the airport by bus. It only took 20 minutes in total. Breakfast in the hotel is typical, cereal, fruit, toast, croissants etc. I would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely fantastic place to stay in a unique city.”
Reviews.Author: BranstonPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canal Grande after being upgraded from our original hotel, the Hotel Antiche Figure... . The hotel staff showed us a room in each of the hotels upon our arrival and allowed us to choose which one we wanted to stay in (there was no extra cost and no pressure whatsoever to choose one or the other). We were certainly glad about our choice of room at the Hotel Canal Grande as it had a private terrace and view of the Grand Canal. The room was beautifully furnished and was spotlessly clean.We didn't find the extremely discreetly located television until our last day when random pointing and pressing of the romote revealed it's hidden location! During our 3 night stay the hotel staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful. Just ask them and they will help you with getting around, what sights to see and most importantly to us where to eat out. The hotel also provided us with a detailed map. The hotel is conveniently located near the bus and train station which meant carrying luggage to the hotel was not an inconvenience. I very much look forward to returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: vickijade
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say...... I just wanted to firstly state, that whenever I go away anywhere.....I do all my research on Trip Advisor. Looking at best hotels,places to eat etc etc. So after visiting Venice I decided I would write a detailed report of what I saw over the few days I was visiting. Hotel Canal Grande was exactly as I imagined it would be! Quaint and Beautiful. On Arrival we were greeted with a very warm welcome from the hotel staff. We simply had to give them our name and show our passports to them. Checking in took all of 5 minutes. Once checked in, we were given a map and a 'talk' on Venice. Where to go and places to see. But one thing I remember the reception staff saying is....'the best way to see Venice, is to get lost in Venice' and they were most defiantly right. So after checking in and receiving our map we were shown to our room by Lorenzo. Our room was not located in the hotel itself, which at first we were a little unsure of. But just a long from the main building itself was out room. It was almost like a mini apartment block. I think all in all it had 4 rooms in it. You access the building by pressing a buzzer and the hotel staff let you in (Very safe and secure!) The rooms are accessed by using a card which you swipe in front of your door. When we opened the door I was amazed...it was beautiful! The room was small but extremely amazing! The walls are not wallpapered....they are lined with gorgeous Italian fabric. Which match the bedding and curtains. All the lighting in the rooms are made with Murano glass and look truly wonderful. The tv in our room was hidden inside the mirror which I found amazing. The bathroom was a decent size with a lovely shower. Its hard to explain but the shower itself had so many different things, almost like a spa. The room also had temperature control dials which you could change to suit yourself. Our room had a view of the square, which we found very pleasant. No noise from the canal! The only noise (so to speak) we heard during our stay was the church bells which start at around 7am. But your in Venice, its to be expected! And after a while you get used to it and it almost acts as an alarm clock :-) Breakfast at the hotel was very nice. It starts at 7am and finishes at 10:30am. There is a wide choice of croissants, mini cakes, yoghurt,ham,cheese,fruit etc and also you can order eggs and bacon but at extra charge of 4Euro. There is also cereal,toast and a selection of fruit juices. There is no seating plan, you just turn up and choose where you would like to sit. Once you sit down the waitress (Who is lovely!) takes your order for tea,coffee,late, American coffee etc. There is a wide choice to choose from and you can drink as much as you like! There is no rush, which is what I liked. It is very relaxed! The hotel Canal Grande is in a very good location also! It is a few minutes walk from the train station and is very close to the Vaporetto stop. Although I thought I should state, if you are arriving at the hotel via the station etc there are two bridges to cross. One of them being very big and may prove a little difficult with a suitcase. We decided to use the water taxi's to and from the airport. Which is a little expensive but so worth the money! It worked out at 100 Euro for 4 people each way. But that took you direct from the Airport to the hotel. No need to worry about lugging suitcases around and squeezing onto a Vaporetto at rush hour time. It was a perfect way to start our holiday! It took 15minutes to reach our hotel from the airport and once we reached the main part of the canal we were invited by the taxi driver to stand at the front of the boat with him. It was extremely romantic and a wonderful way to get our first glimpse of Venice itself. I would highly recommend using the water taxi for airport transfers! To find the water Taxi service, you firstly need to book in. Which can be done when you go through arrivals. There is a Taxi booking desk there and that is where you pay. Once you have paid it is a 5 minute walk to the water taxi (That is also where the public transport is) You simply go to the dock number you have been allocated and wait for your boat. Do make sure you get the name of the hotel right! Because many of the hotels on the canal sound the same. So it would be Hotel Canal Grande! Im 99% sure there is one called Grande canal. The hotel also has a bar which is stocked with almost every type of spirit and drink you can think of. My partner and I like to drink beer so we drank the local brand which was called 'venitian Blonde'. It tasted a little like san miguel. We did try the 'red' version which to be honest we found was disgusting but everyone's taste is different! They also give you small bar snacks with your drinks. Which normally consist of crisps or peanuts, but they always went down well. I also noticed that if you had afternoon tea they gave you a selection on mini biscuits. Which I found very sweet of them to do. They are always so willing to help you and are always very pleasant. Eating out was always fun! Trying to find nice places and experience the real Venice. And we used two of the hotels recommendations. The first wasn't very nice and we were slightly disappointed, as we were told it was the best pizza in Venice. Turns out it wasn't! The second recommendation was spot on!!! One of the best meals we've had in a long time! My partner had steak and I had a pizza, both of which were extremely tasty and very reasonably priced. It took a little bit of map reading to find but we got there in the end and it was worth the walking. Although it was only a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel itself. Im not exactly sure what the name is but its something like 'Muro' im sure if you ask the staff they could help you find it The hotel is a 5 minute walk away from all the shops and restaurants etc but you do have to do a little walking to find exactly what you want. There are so many different places to choose from and so much to see! From a woman's point of view........make sure you pack flat shoes to wear! My feet were killing me on the first day and I wore flat boots! Heels if you can do heels are ok but not very practical. I wore them one night and that was it. There is also a casino in Venice! Apparently its the oldest Casino in the world. Just be warned that men DO have to wear Jackets! But jeans are acceptable (Which I found odd) It has a separate bar and restaurant and is roughly a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Although Im pretty sure they offer a free water taxi, as I saw a few of them driving up and down the canal. Don't take my word on that though! The Murano Glass factory trip which is free from the hotel is....ok but nothing to write home about. They offer a free water taxi to the factory but be warned.......if you don't buy anything it is up to you to get yourself back! Which we had to do! We ended up catching a Vaporetto back to piazza san marco which took an hour! and was 6.50Euro each. Watching the glass blowing itself was very interesting but the demonstration lasted about 10minutes the rest of the time is to look around the shop! Which you are NOT allowed to take photos in, and is very expensive! Shopping!!!!!! We loved the shopping in Venice and regretted not taking another suitcase! There is so much to choose from and personally we like to wear 'different' clothes and you can defiantly find 'different' clothing in Venice. The shoes etc are amazing! But can be very pricey. We were lucky as there seemed to be sales on everywhere! All in all our trip was truly wonderful! A beautiful place to visit! The hotel we stayed in well...i would stay there again in a heart beat. It was clean, decorated to high standards, staff were friendly and spoke very good English, and the location was perfect! Free Wi Fi For those of you who cant be without the internet....the hotel offer it for free! You just have to ask at the reception and they will give you a code. Which normally gives you 2 hours free access although you can ask for more like my partner did! They also have a computer which you can use and is also free!!!! I/WE will most defiantly be staying at Hotel Canal Grande in the future and will recommend to all our family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant rooms with luxurious fabrics and murano glass.”
Reviews.Author: KAW62
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to everything and easy to find. Make sure to print out directions to the hotel for your arrival. The rooms were elegant and comfortable. Nice breakfast in the morning. The staff were pleasant and very helpful. Our last night there our neighbours were noisy and vulgar, the staff did try and control the situation and more than compensated us the next day. Despite this we wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Perth_magpie
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel, the staff are super, friendly,helpful. The rooms are excellent, clean and the breakfast good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff, and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kimandjohnny89
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a beautiful canal view, only a 5 minute walk from the train station. The room was large by European standards, was very clean and quiet. Staff was especially courteous and helpful. Continental breakfast was varied, and unlike some hotels that only give you a two hour window, breakfast was from 7-10:30. Would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional”
Reviews.Author: MAK786
Reviews.Content: just brilliant, can't spot one error. every need is looked after a bargain of a hotel and gr8 stuff.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful way to celebrate the holidays!”
Reviews.Author: maestrette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Canal Grande for three nights in December, and we loved it! We arrived in Venice at 9:00 am on Christmas morning. A quick bus ride and a short walk in the pouring rain, and we were at the hotel by 10:00 am. Thankfully we were allowed to check in immediately and change into dry clothes. Our room was beautiful and everything still seemed very new. The bathroom was an excellent size - not always the case in Italian hotels. Our only complaint was trying to regulate the temperature. Most of the time it was too hot in our room, but that was easily solved by cracking a window. Breakfast selection was more than adequate. Everyone we dealt with on staff was very professional and always courteous. The location can't be beat. We would definitely stay here again if we travel to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is Wonderful City...Hotel Canal Grande Fits Right In!”
Reviews.Author: BeijingDB
Reviews.Content: We rode trains during our (2) week Italian holiday (Rome/Venice/Florence/Pisa). It was a very pleasant surprise when we arrived in Venice and could see the Hotel Grande Canal from the train station steps. However between the train station and the hotel was a very high bridge with lots of steps...there was a second smaller bridge a bit later. The bridges made it a bit difficult to transport our luggage but we made it eventually. My wife picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor ratings and we weren't disappointed. We had a family suite overlooking the Grande Canal. The suite had (2) rooms with the master having a normal queen size bed and the Sitting room with a sleeper sofa queen. The sleeper sofa was acceptable but I would have preferred a normal queen. Both rooms were tastefully decorated with Murana glass sconces and flat screen TVs (although we didn't watch much TV). The only downside to having a Canal facing room is the diesel engined boat traffic that passed by at all hours. Suffering from jet lag, the noise from the boats was a bit annoying (not the hotel's fault though, the windows were insulated). The Continental breakfast was good and if you wished, you could special order eggs (for extra 4 euro). The WiFi connection was excellent, very, very fast. It is about a 30 minute walk to San Marcus Piazza (where the Doge palace is located). We spent three days in Venice and fell in love with the city...it really is a special place. The Hotel Canal Grande fits right in with the ambience of Venice, it is a cozy, intimate, and comfortable place to stay. We will be returning to Venice at some point in the future and will again make the Hotel Canal Grande our "home away from home". I should add the best pizza we had in all of Italy is a little restaurant about (5) minutes from the hotel...I forget the Italian name but in English it translates to "Antique Well". We ate at a lot of very average "tourist" restaurants during our holiday but the pizza at this place was truly outstanding...my favorite was the parma ham/artichoke pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Great little luxury pad.”
Reviews.Author: YumScrubble
Reviews.Content: I so love ripping a place to shreds that I am not going to enjoy writing this review at all... the Canal Grande was just perfect. It started with a great deal (330â‚¬ for three nights for two adults and a baby), and it just went up from there. Perfect location on the canal, close to the railway station. Lovely room, walls tastefully strung in lemon Venitian fabric; rococo furniture; Murano chandeliers and wall sconces everywhere; free wifi; free baby cot, perfect bathroom with power and rain shower and lovely stonework (we found out later the owner made his pile with marble quarries, so it figures). Staff extraordinariyly friendly, especially the lady doing the breakfast service. Lovely, varied breakfast; water-taxi stops right outside reception, etc. There was only one slight downside: the bathroom had trouble heating up. Yes, the rooms are small, as some reviewers have noted, and you have to walk there across a few bridges with your luggage if you want to save the water-taxi fare, but hey - this is Venice. It's tiny. Land is scarce and really expensive. And while it's sinking gently back into the sea, it depends on a maze of canals instead of roads to move goods and people around. Taking these constraints into account, the people who did the Grande have hit the bulls'-eye.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel we will go back to”
Reviews.Author: lincolnex
Reviews.Content: Watch the boats go by on the Grand canal as you have breakfast after a great night's sleep in this bijou hotel!! Clean, well decorated and themed, charming and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruth1250
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Canal Grande. Great view of the canal from our very comfortable room. The staff were very helpful and friendly, especially Alessandro and Ramon. The location was very convenient, right across from the Piazzale Roma and train station. Definitely a keeper. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: awilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Canal Grande in October and enjoyed our stay. The room was small but it looked out directly onto the Grande Canal which was why I booked it. The staff was helpful and spoke English very well. The breakfast buffet was very good and I thought had a lot of variety. This may not be the most luxurious hotel in Venice but I found it to be a really good value and very pretty and comfortable (make sure you notice the chandeliers, they are Murano glass and beautiful). We also like the area. It is near the train station and might get a little busy in the very peak season but the area had a lot of shopping to offer and fun little places to stop and sit and have a glass of wine and watch the people. It is also very convenient to the water bus which we used. Buy and pass and explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ibizaloverLeicester
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for a quick getaway with the wife for her birthday based on the reviews here , and it was a great decision. This is a wonderful little hotel with such helpful staff and lovely rooms! Joanne on reception was amazingly helpful , she gave us approximatley 10mins talk on venice that was so useful as we had never visited before. In fact everyone at the hotel was friendly and couldn't do more to help.

Reviews.Title: “Made a cool, rainy vacation in Venice wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: frn4
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel, I had read reviews on trip advisor, highly recommending it. I can confirm this was hotel is a perfect place to stay in Venice. We were warmly welcomed upon arrival, and served a belini before heading out for dinner. Breakfast offered a variety of breads, cheeses, fresh fruits and as much made to order espresso or latte you could drink. The first morning it was raining, and many walkways flooded. Giovanna provided 3 in our group rain boots to get through the day. She also gave great recommendations for dinner. If we would ever return to Venice, we will stay at the Hotel Canal Grande.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: matthews72
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very friendly - the friendliest we encountered on our weeklong trip to Italy and Switzerland. The hotel is off the beaten path, which was nice in the busy summer season as it was very quiet near the hotel. The water bus is a nice scenic ride to the main tourist attactions, such as St. Mark's. The only downside to the hotel's location was that the weather was unusually hot while we were there due to a heat wave from Sahara Africa, so it took a bit longer to get to the room to cool off. The hotel is a short walk to the train station. Room accomodations were very nice, although the bed could have been a bit more comfortable. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: daytripperyea
Reviews.Content: We could not have been more pleased with the friendly, helpful staff at the Hotel Canal Grande. The rooms were nicely decorated and the location was very convenient to the train station and the vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aloha75
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It was very quiet as it is a bit outside the usual tourist track. The room was very cosy and romantic with a very nice view on the Grand Canal. The staff of the hotel was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful rooms and Staff”
Reviews.Author: natepots
Reviews.Content: Great location, you can come in by Bus great rooms wonderful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCHerrington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Canal Grande several days prior to embarking on a cruise to the Greek Isles from Venice. The pictures on the hotel's website are exactly what the rooms look like. Everything is very clean and immaculately decorated. Some of the rooms are very small for two people. We realized very quickly that we needed a larger room, and the hotel staff upgraded us to a larger room right away with a very reasonable upcharge. Breakfast was included in our package, and the foods and juices were excellent. We were disappointed in the coffee but in all fairness, I think we just don't like Italian coffee. The location of the hotel is great. It's between the main Piazza le Roma (where the buses, taxis and cars from the mainland arrive), which is also a vapporetta stop and the 2nd vapporetta stop. I recommend spending some time studying the vapporetta maps and Venice maps to orient oneself.

Reviews.Title: “Small, intimate and elegant!”
Reviews.Author: meandbutchie
Reviews.Content: The Canal Grande is a small but very elegant hotel. We were given a choice of two upgraded rooms overlooking the Grande Canal (as we reserved) and both were beautifully appointed. We picked the smaller of the two rooms, but it had a fantastic private terrace! Has to be seen to be believed! Due to an early flight our schedule didn't allow us time to enjoy the morning breakfast, but other guests told us how great it was. The staff were helpful and very friendly and the check-in/check-out procedure was quick and efficient. The front desk (concierge) arranged an early morning (4:30 am) water taxi and shuttle service from the hotel to the airport and offered us a complimentary boxed breakfast in lieu of the sit down one. Unfortunately, in our early morning daze we forgot to pick it up......... but it was a very nice thought anyway. This is a beautiful hotel, well decorated in true Venetian style and we would highly recommend it. Perhaps a little pricey, but so are all of the better Venice hotels. This one is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel 10/10”
Reviews.Author: MK18_10
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the sister hotel, Antiche Figure as planned. Conceirge asked if we would like our original room or a room in the Hotel Canal Grande. We were shown both rooms in the hotels and decided on the Hotel Canal Grande room. The room was on the ground floor of the hotel and excellent. Great decor, good sized room and v. clean. We asked the manager if we could have another room off the ground floor for the next two nights and were given the Casanova room on the top floor. The room was bigger with excellent decor and a canal view. The breakfast is good (a full continental breakfast) and v. friendly staff. Location is away from St. Mark's Sq. but to it's advantage. The hotel is near the train station but with absolutely no noise in a lovely part of town. The best part about the location is that you get to walk to St. Mark's (about 20 mins) and sound out the best restaurants, bars, and shops. We will return when next in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Canal Grande made our Honeymoon the BEST EVER!”
Reviews.Author: djstormshadow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying here for our honeymoon. This hotel is a must! The staff were just wonderful, the rooms are simply amazing, and the service was outstanding! The view onto the grand canal is great, and they have a patio sitting right on the water. It seemed that all passers by were envious! Just loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mlwFortLee_Nj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 16 day trip through Italy, the hi-lite of which was our 3 days at the Canal Grande in Venice. We (and our friends in another room) were treated royally throughout our stay. The rooms, though not very large, were beautifully furnished, with all the latest electronics, incl. free internet, excellent TVs, and very fine bathrooms. A lovely breakfast, included in the rate, was beautifully presented in either of 2 roms on the main floor. The location is excellent...a 4 min. walk to the Rive di Basio vaporetto stop, which is just 1 stop from the RR station. Another advantage, not mentioned in the hotel's website, but of great significance is that the hotel's location and the vaporetto stop are unaffected by 'Aqua Alta', which can be a problem at other locations. But, most of all, the entire hotel staff were unbelievably helpful and pleasant. We all agreed that the Canal Grande was the best hotel experience of our trip, and, I really feel this was the best hotel experience I have ever had....and I've been travelling through Europe for 55 years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerseyt23
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, my husband and I booked three nights at Canal Grande Holel. We were not disappointed. The hotel staff was most friendly and went out of their way to please us. We did change our first room, as it was rather small, and we were immediately shown a larger room which was more to our liking. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in Venice. We were here prior to a transatlantic cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: kristad314
Reviews.Content: After researching lots of hotels, we came across Hotel Canal Grande and it looked perfect. We arrived and were greeted by the front desk. The hotel is located right on the canal across from the train station. The location is great, it's not right in the middle of all the crowds so it is quieter. After visiting some of the areas in Venice, I was glad we chose to stay in a location that wasn't in the midst of the crowds. We were shown to the Rialto room, which is located off the courtyard behind the main building. The room was beautiful! A long hallway led to a lovely bedroom decorated with gold decor and wood floors. The room was very clean and VERY comfortable. The bathroom was also lovely - sparkling and new. The shower was awesome. The room was so comfortable and quiet; it was hard to leave it. For breakfast you can sit outside ride on the canal, watching the boats pass by, it was a great way to start the day. The breakfast was good, they offered croissants, little rolls, cookies, little pastries, yogurt, meats and cheeses. Thy even would make you an egg (costs extra). The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful; they made the stay even more enjoyable. Just as originally thought, Hotel Canal Grande was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further than this hotel, you will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: flysandy
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to have it all. Excellent location, friendly staff and the rooms were fitted out to a very high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for multiple travel couples”
Reviews.Author: AwlBidnz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two other couples. It was perfect. We basically rented the floor (3 rooms) & have a very nice living room shared between us. Advice was top notch on food recommendations and the staff went out of their way to get whatever we needed or desired. Close to the train station and away from tourist. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive average quality small hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelMonkey
Reviews.Content: Not sure why all the raves. It's just a simple small hotel, nothing boutique about it. Yes, it's quaint and by the grand canal, but there is nothing special about it, especially for the price paid. Our room had no views at all, not the canal or the courtyard, just an alley. The breakfast area has only three tables on the canal, so very little chance of using them. Breakfast was just OK. This hotel has so much potential and that's a real shame to waste such a good location. Some tables and chairs in the huge courtyard at the front door would be a great start as it has a wonderful view of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico! Little Gem of Venice”
Reviews.Author: LuckyAli
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness for Trip Advisor! I booked this hotel purely based on the reviews I read & was not disappointed. Stayed here 2 nights/3 days Mid October & the weather was sunny & warm. The hotel is conveniently located near to the bus station, opposite the train station & a vaporetta stop. You have to go down a couple of alleyways & over a small bridge my boyfriend & I never had a map, but we found the hotel no trouble. A top tip is to look at the door numbers (the hotel is number 932). We were booked into the San Giorgio room, a ground floor room, which is not in the main building but a few doors along. The room was decorated to a very high standard & the wallpaper is made of fabric which was an interesting touch! The bathroom was a decent size too & the shower had hot running water with two showerheads (1 above & 1 detachable). We were offered an upgrade with a view of the Grand Canal for 70 Euros, but didn't take it as the room we had was lovely. I would say the only downside is that you could hear footsteps (lady's boots we presumed) in the room above due to the wooden floors. Breakfast was fine - toast, cereal, mini crusty rolls, selection of meats, cake, yoghurts & fresh fruit was offered each morning. Venice is a charming little place, full of character with it's canals, bridges, alleyways & buildings which look like they are falling apart. You can't really get lost as there's directions to the main tourist spots & it's a very safe and clean place. It is expensive, we ate at the restaurant opposite the hotel & paid 13 Euros for a bowl of spaghetti bolognaise which was a child's size portion, which left me hungry. You can find more reasonable places, especially away from the Grand Canal. It's worth mentioning that most restaurants add a cover charge to bills, usually up to 2.50 Euros per person for table cloth & bread. They also include a 12% service charge. Enjoy Venice. It's worth noting that a gondella ride costs 80 Euros during the day & 100 Euros at night.

Reviews.Title: “For a small, boutique hotel - this is perfect”
Reviews.Author: RBSheridan
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves the highest praise - for Gianni on the front desk and the other friendly and efficient staff, for the well-appointed Dogaressa suite, and for the excellent breakfasts. The double glazing works a treat. After a hard day's sightseeing, there's nothing better than to sit on the waterside balcony with a drink while the vaporetto passengers wonder who's lucky enough to stay in such luxurious accommodation. Oh, and did I mention it's just a 5 minute walk to Santa Lucia railway station and 10 minutes to Piazalla Roma

Reviews.Title: “High expectations were no disappointed - truly beautiful”
Reviews.Author: CraigH3
Reviews.Content: unfortunately we only had one night in this beautiful hotel. We chose it only due to the Trip Advisor recommendations and really had high hopes upon arrival (it would get 6 out of 5 if it was located on the other side of the canal so you wouldn't need to lug suitcases over the large bridge over the Grand Canal or the smaller bridge that also needs to be traversed - that said it was very close to the train station as promised). Was also a little tricky working out directions as I do not recall seeing any signs, it was only prior reseach on Google Maps that ensured we headed in the right direction. All experiences with staff where first class from check in to departure and everything in between. The room (Carnivale) was stunning, although not Canal frontage or overly large, with beautiful decor, fittings and appointments and it really gave off a truly Venitian ambiance. Whilst the price could be considered as high there was no hint of not getting value relative to the cost. A stunning hotel and one of the best we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to take in Venice and celebrate anniverssary”
Reviews.Author: acidrain
Reviews.Content: We originally booked at the Hotel Antiche Figure, sister hotel of the Hotel Canal Grande. Since we arrived early they offered to upgrade us to this hotel free of charge. We were hesitant at first but upon seeing the hotel and room we gladly accepted. We had a beautifully appointed room with windows opening up right onto the canal. My wife adored the four poster bed. It was comfortable and inviting. The bathroom was very nice with a marble vanity and heated towel rack. The floors were hardwood; a very nice touch. The staff was extremely friendly. It is obvious they are very proud of their rating on Trip Advisor and it shows in their hospitality. Perhaps the greatest feature of this hotel that distinguishes it from other nearby hotels is the small dock area adjoining the breakfast room. They have it roped off and have placed three tables out there, right on the waterfront, for guests to enjoy.We found this to be a perfect way to both and start and end our day of exploring Venice. We would wake up and go sit right on the water and enjoy a cup of coffee and watch the canal come alive. We saw very few hotels that offered this. the breakfast was very adequate: boiled eggs, salami, ham, cheeses, cereal, pastries, croissants, fruit, etc. And did I mention that you could sit right on the water on little dock/terrace and enjoy your meal?! We also like that this hotel was a little tucked away from the main path of tourist foot traffic. This meant it was quiet and relaxing. The location is perfect too. A five minute walk and you are at either the train station or a main vaporetto (water bus) stop. I have thought long and hard to see if I could find one small thing, anything to criticize this hotel for and I can not. In a word, it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacquimac44
Reviews.Content: My brand new husband and I honeymooned in the Canal Grande for 5 nights at the end of August. From arrival late at night to our departure, the friendly and efficient staff accommodated every one of our needs and requests, reception staff exceeding our expectations for the most part. The location of the hotel is ideal with us being able to find our way back (pretty challenging in Venice) by simply following the signs to Ferrovia train station. My husband had requested a water taxi airport pick up for us via the hotel and this went very smoothly, albeit a little too fast for me to begin with. It was a surreal experience to arrive at the Grand canal in the dark with the palazzi all lit up from within. On arrival the night staff were fantastic and there was champagne, beautiful flowers and a lovely bowl of fruit in our room. We were lucky enough to have been given the room with the private terrace overlooking the square and canal. We spent a few lazy hours there in the sun and at night watching life on the canal. The only drawback was the size of the immaculately decorated room (although this was offset by the spacious terrace) and the lack of a bath, which we really missed so I've rated this as 4 out of 5. The public areas are perfectly adequate, although a larger deck outside to accommodate all those guests who want to breakfast on the canal would be a good addition. There was always a queue for the 3 outside tables. Accomodation costs in Venice are expensive so while the price of this hotel is high, it's fairly competitive with other 4 star hotels. Venice itself is spectacular and lives up to its reputation. All in all I would go back in a heartbeat, both to the city and to the Hotel Canal Grande.

Reviews.Title: “Just the perfect hotel for a romantic trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: grob12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great. We stayed for 3 days in one of the rooms overlooking the Gran Canal. The service is also really good, with personel always looking for your comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: indietravler
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located in Venice not far from the train station. The hotel is right on the Grand Canal. There is a small terrace overlooking the canal. The rooms were spotless and beautifully decorated in a quiet location. We were greeted each morning with a wonderful "buongiorno" and each evening with a lovely "buonosera. Breakfast was included with our room rate. The front desk staff, especially Giovanna, were extremely helpful. Giovanna helped us with train travel, restaurant recommendations and directions. In fact, upon our arrival, we got a little lost in the maze of Venice streets and canals. We called the hotel to ask for directions and were told to stay where we were while a staff member came to find us! What a warm and welcoming way to be introduced to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “It's true..”
Reviews.Author: asoyland
Reviews.Content: ..what the other reviewers say. Just book & enjoy, if you can. The only negative experiences from our 2 nights in the Doge room was a somewhat unpleasant and unhelpful interaction with the night clerk, and a another situation in which some other employee spent ages finding information on the vaporetti schedule that in the end were just plain wrong. Still 4/5 for service, as the rest of the staff were marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: TravelTurtle66
Reviews.Content: A great boutique hotel! The best hotel we stayed at in Italy. Itâ€™s only a year old and has already gained quite a reputation. Location is right on the water on the Grande Canal. A tiny three table deck overhands the canal giving you the best view for drinking wine in the evening or eating breakfast. You can sit for hours and watch the boats go by practically at water level. Everyone wants these tables in the morning! Inside dining is pleasant but not as exceptional. (Of course the deck is one of the greatest spots on Earth). Staff is super friendly. Room was small but nicely appointed. Location is wonderfully quiet despite being in the heart over everything. Train station is just across the bridge but a million miles way as far as noise and crowds. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel overlooking Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: debbarker
Reviews.Content: Transportation in Venice can be quite expensive especially to and from the airport. We wanted to be within walking distance to both the train and bus station and this is perfect! While it is a bit of a walk from the main attractions, it is in a beautiful part of this small city. Our room overlooked the canal and was simply beautiful. It was so nice to open the many windows and hear the boats motoring along the canal. The front desk staff was super helpful and friendly. Our room was not ready when we arrived, but they promptly dispatched housekeeping to work on it and gave us complimentary cappucinos while we waited on their terrace overlooking the canal. Simply breathtaking. The only downside was the noise from the room next door. They apparently had young, playful children who were wide awake at 1am playing and making noise. While none of the noise on the canal came in through the windows while closed, the noise from the next door room sounded like they were in the room with us. We started to notify the front desk but decided that we are all on vacation and no sense getting feathers ruffled. Anyway, it's an expensive place to stay, but everything in Venice is $$$! If you want a romantic, beautiful hotel, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “This must be one of the best little hotels in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RobertEYorks
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed small and personal hotel. I hesitate to write about this little gem as I don't want too many people to get to know how good it is! The location is ideal, right on the Grand Canal. Although only a stone's throw from the railway station it is in an extremely quiet and tranquil location. The staff are wonderful and can't do enough for you, suggesting places to visit and restaurants to eat at. The rooms are immaculate and everything within them exudes quality. Breakfast overlooking the hustle and bustle of the Grand Canal is magical. Don't hesitate to stay - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Top staff”
Reviews.Author: Malta_explorer
Reviews.Content: We've just got from a 3 night stay at the Canal Grande. We stayed in the Carlo Goldoni room which was nicely decorated. Upon check in we was informed that they was just finishing of sorting a problem with the water - 10 minutes later the room was ready. Each morning we ate the breakfast that was provided and found this to be of good quality. All the staff at the hotel were extremely helpful, but the breakfast girls stood out slightly more because even though they were always busy, they still seemed to remain polite and attentive. The location of the hotel is perfect as it was quite, but not too far from the action. Also the free room internet was a big bonus. But it was the staff that made our stay really good. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireMichael
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little boutique hotel with a family run feeling ( you matter) .Staff were very friendly and helpful. Immaculate and newly renovated. Well situated for the train, bus station and vaporetto stop. In a less touristy area than around St Marks Square ( a definite bonus) but with plenty of restaurants and shops in close proximity and still only 20 mins or so away by vaporetto from St Marks. It also has its own water taxi jetty which doubles up as a great place to have breakfast and watch the daily activities of the Grande Canal taking place. We had a room in the square, not in the main bulding, with little natural light, but that did not seem to matter. If you could get a room overlooking the canal.....WOW. Would have no hesitation in recommending this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet and great value.”
Reviews.Author: Papimorenito501
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a day trip to Venice and spend an overnight before returning to Rome. The hotel is small and boutique like, with very personal and friendly service. It is literally a 5 min walk across from the St Lucia train station, and as many prior reviews have noted, you can see it to the left from the bridge as you walk out of the station and across the bridge. We didn't spend extra for the canal view, but had a partial canal view from the second floor none the less. The room are very clean, was quiet and was nicely appointed. In the morning we ate breakfast on their deck over the canal. There are two water bus stations very near by if you choose to venture out walking to the other side of town and don't feel like making the trek back on foot. Venice's "major" sites - St Marks and Rialto bridge are about a 15 min walk from the hotel with many interesting shops and places to eat along the way The hotel is in a very convenient spot if you have a bit of luggage (and even if you don't) . I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: akaram238
Reviews.Content: We can easily recommend this place to anyone. Our room was spotless (my wife approved of the bathroom), the staff were friendly and incredibly helpful, and the hotel is in a great location - convenient to the train station (and the Plaza Roma) and quieter than San Marco Square, but not too far from the really neat stuff. And it's only 5 minute's walk to the vaporetto (water "bus") stop, which takes you right to Rialto and San Marco. And the hotel gets the little things right too - a good breakfast, a charming deck on the Grand Canal (what a great place to sip your morning coffee and have breakfast!), free wifi (so you can upload photos and make your friends and family jealous in real-time), and a quiet square that the front door opens onto. We plan to return to Venice and, when we do, we will stay at the Canal Grande again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly blissful - best location, couldnt be better!”
Reviews.Author: bobs65
Reviews.Content: We arrived courtesy of a competition to Hotel Canal Grande on Friday night and were staggered by its opulence, grandeur and yets its ability to retain the friendly, hospitable vibe that emanated from its staff and atmosphere. Giovanna was a godsend, gave us tips on best places to eat, sightsee and do what other tourists wouldnt get to chance to do. She does the hotel proud. Its location is ideal set on the Grand Canal and two mins from train station and five mins from P de Roma but set just slightly away so it was silent of a night..perfect! The room we had was the Vivaldi and it was like a mini suite with day bed and lounge area with its own bathroom whilst the main bedroom had a ornate four poster bed and a king and queen bathroom. However the PiÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance was the Sat TV set into a heavy venetian gold mirror....fab! If you get chance, go. Its amazing!!! and Giovanna, we'll be back Hannah & Simone

Reviews.Title: “Don't look elsewhere, stay in this Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: English_Traveller02
Reviews.Content: Selected theHotel Canal Grande based on Nr2 review on Trip Advisor and the realistic rates. I concur with the lastest reviews. Alessandro was the receptionist on duty each evening of our stay and also on arrival. His knowledge of the history of Venice and its geological construction was really informative. A lessandro speaks at least 3 languages including English very well. Yes the rooms are small, but so is virtually all hotels in Venice. This is our third visit to Venice and this is best hotel we stayed in. The largest rooms are at the front and they also have a full sized bath tub and shower.. It is a good 40 minute brisk walk to San Marco and 20 minutes to Rialto. The water bus at the P Roma and the Station is 5 minutes walk. We used the water taxi from Marco Polo Airpot, arranged by Alessandro via email. Quick trip but expensive (â‚¬110). Venice is expensive anyway especially in the "toutis traps". We did not go to Murano, as offered by Alessandro, as we have been twice before. Verdict, we will stay here on our next trip to Venice. Breakfast good and typical European style. No restaurant for evening meals but plenty of nearby restaurants that can be recommended by the Staff I wrote this in the hotel and writing this on the free WiFi connection in our room (in the rain, can't blame the hotel for the thunder storms!!) One upgrade I could suggest is to extend the decking each direction to the windows nearest the corner of the hotel. we had a 8pm flight out of marco Polo airport so after checking out at 11am (check out time 12 noon), we left our luggage and had a walk (and ice cream) at the Rialto, then return to the cool of the Canal Grande for a couple of hours in the small lounge. Tea and biscuits were offered and gratefully accepted. Nice parting touch by Giovani and epiomised the caring and professional nature of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do not look any further”
Reviews.Author: bounciebird
Reviews.Content: This hotel, by far, is a wonderful place to stay. The staff is unparalleled and Giovana and Peter at the front desk are there to make you feel like family. From the moment we walked through the door, the staff did everything to assure that we had a memorable experience. Our room was beautiful, the breakfasts and evening drinks on the small patio right on the canal were unforgettable, and we felt truly sad when we had to leave. The location was perfect and it was nice not to be in the middle of the hectic pace of San Marco Square. The water taxi is a two minute walk and you can get anywhere in Venice from there. The stay at this hotel was one of the high points of our trip and we have recommended it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden luxury in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Hydroteam
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor, and all of the positive reviews are accurate. Like others we chose to upgrade to a Junior Suite for an extra payment. On arrival we were given the choice of 2 rooms or the suite. One of the rooms, in a separate building was very small, but beautifully decorated. We followed the directions given by the hotel - catching a (Blue) bus from the airport, 3 euros per person, and then walked from the Piazza De Rome. The walk went over 2 bridges, but took less than 10 minutes. This route was easy to follow. All of the staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful, and when asked at checkout what improvements they could make, we really couldn't think of anything to suggest... the terrace is very small, and it would be nice if it was larger so more than 3 tables could enjoy breakfast / drinks by the Canal. There was free internet access but after two hours you have to get another code. This was our only niggle. The location is convenient for Vaporetto (water buses) and for walking to all the main sights in Venice. We would certainly use this hotel again and recommend it to anyone traveling to Venice. One recommendation for an evening activity is Opera at Musica a Palazzo (www.musicapalazzo.com).

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: rico_mad
Reviews.Content: Carlo, the Concierge, was a true professional and a hard-working gentleman who has been at this hotel for years. His resteraunt suggestions were wonderful and he made every effort to make our stay comfortable. Don't expect large rooms. Our family of five had to book two rooms, and they were very small rooms. Clean and charming. But not enough room to place your luggage. We managed and all worked out well. If it was not for Carlo, who helped us settle in, it may have been a very different experience. The location is OK. Not far from the train station. But it is not difficult to travel from place to place. leave yourself time because boat travel is slow. They offer a free excursion to the island of Murano. Breakfast was simple but nice. Inside or outside on their small deck overlooking the Grand Canal. We left the hotel early in the morning to go to the airport and Carlo had prepared breakfast packages-to-go for us. He also offerred us a traditional Venetian drink every afternoon. Carlo upgraded our first room, which was very small, to the largest room in the hotel with no extra charge. Even this room was not large but it was better. And the gesture meant more to us than anything. He really cares about his guests. Thanks Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “MAGICAL”
Reviews.Author: Dandousha
Reviews.Content: Just back to a trip to Rome and Venice. Stayed in Venice for 3 nights. We booked hotel Antiche Figure based on the great reviews we found here. Upon arrival, the staff informed us that as a promotion for their new 4 star hotel they can give us a room in Hotel Canal Grand just a couple of blocks away. AMAZING hotel. Great service. Perfect location just across the train station and all the main waterbus stations. The room is charming. Very clean and well spaced for a hotel in Venice. THE MOST amazing bed ever. We slept like babies. Large spotless bathroom. The staff was lovely and very helpful. Beautiful breakfast especially when you have it in the little terrace directly on the grand canal. One of the best experiences we had in all of Europe and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon gem”
Reviews.Author: sensiblek
Reviews.Content: Lovely little gem in the center of Venice. Travelled here as part of our honeymoon and it was the perfect place for us. The hotel has friendly staff, clean rooms and lovely suroundings, placed right next to the Grand Canal. Placed slightly outside the main tourist areas, it has a lovely and calm athmosphere, but is close enough to reach all parts of town on foot.

Reviews.Title: “luxury on the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: miss_celie
Reviews.Content: went there for my honeymoon had what was termed as an apartment just off the canal which meant our view was not of the canal but no mind. room was small but opulent. great stocked mini bar essential for our arrival after midnight when ryanair lost our luggage and we got lost trying to walk to the hotel - the mini prosecco went down a treat. great bed bathroom etc but piece de resistence was the tv in the rococco mirror breakfast served later than advertised which was good great selection and sitting out on the little dock was an essential day or night it cost a lot but worth it

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction beyond expectation .. best stay in entire trip.”
Reviews.Author: Sayeed2010
Reviews.Content: Travelled this summer with small children,stayed in grand suite.My wife is very picky and choosy when comes to selecting hotels, but this time she had not a single complaint rather praising all through. Rooms are heavenly comfortable, clean and tidy,location is unbeatable, but best of all is the service. the staff are so welcoming and helpful which made our stay an unforgetable one.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, beautiful and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: FernandinaScribe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canal Grande truly rolls out the red carpet for its guests. We arrived for our 6-day stay several hours before the official check-in time, but the staff wasn't rattled at all. They got us right into our room, and what a room it was! We were on the corner of the hotel in a room overlooking the canal and the campo (square) next to the hotel. When our feet were tired from exploring, we simply kicked off our shoes and watched the excitement on the Grand Canal from the comfort of our air conditioned room. The bathroom was well-equipped, including hair dryer, toiletries, even a retractable clothesline. Our room had a closet with two full-length mirrors for its doors. Breakfast is served in a lovely room with views of the canal, but they also have tables right on their deck on the Grand Canal. I thought the food was very good... mostly pastries, but there's also yogurt, cereals, meats and cheeses... and of course any kind of coffee or hot chocolate. There is also a small bar, and the hotel staff will fix you a drink at any hour. The location also is fabulous, because it is in the midst of aquiet residential area, yet a stone's throw from the Ferrovia vaporetto stop and the train station.
