That means, no matter where you are in Venice, you can always find your way back to the hotel by following the signs pointing to those landmarks. I must say, all the warnings I'd heard about Venetians disliking tourists proved true in many places, even when we were giving them business, but this is not true at Hotel Canal Grande. Everyone here, from the folks at the desk to the folks cleaning the rooms, made a point of making us feel welcome, and it came across as 100 percent genuine. We loved our stay in Venice, and it was largely due to the fantastic performance of the Hotel Canal Grande team.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: SS_Aussie
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed with the hotel twice, recently, for a total of 5 nights. We had the most wonderful stay. Service: fantastic - staff were always useful and friendly with excellent recommendations Rooms: good size, great views, excellent fittings etc Cleanliness: wonderful Food: breakfast was fine - nothing over the top, a standard 'continental'

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: peace_bc
Reviews.Content: We had booked 3 nights in another hotel, the Hotel Antiche Figure, but when we arrived, the hotel manager said that they had opened a Four Star Hotel and we could be upgraded to stay there if we wished. We were hesitant because we the Hotel Antiche Figure had a wonderful reputation, however we were assured that the same staff worked at both hotel and that the hotel only opened 14 days prior so they were offering upgrades. We decided to take it and were taken to the Hotel Canal Grande and we were not disappointed. It was amazing! We were in the middle of a 3 month holiday around Europe, and I can truthfully say, that this was the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The staff were amazing, they were so helpful and generous and gave us lots of information on where to eat and what to see etc. We didn't have breakfast included in our room, but we purchased breakfast both mornings and it was well worth it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The location is wonderful, the views are spectacular, and as a young couple travelling around, we were made to feel like we were to most important visitors they had.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely boutique hotel, convenient to train station”
Reviews.Author: rellah
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four (me, husband, kids 9 & 12) doing the grand tour of Europe and decided on the Hotel Canal Grande based on TripAdvisor reviews and proximity to the train station. It was ultimately the perfect choice. From the train station, walk over the bridge to your left, down the street, take 1st left, over little bridge and it's at the end of little square facing the Grand Canal. Five minute walk from train station, not a seedy area at all. With each of us dragging our own suitcase, it was very manageable compared to all the folks trying to find transportation to the other side of the island during a sudden transportation workers strike. Fifteen minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and thirty to St. Marks Square. Felt longer at the end of the day, but still quite manageable. We stayed in a quiet, opulent (yet very small) family room. All the walls were covered in gold silk material, as was the main bed. An additional cot was brought in to the entry room as a second bed for the two kids (first was a converted sofa, not a foldout). No place for luggage, so we literally climbed over bags and people to round the corner to our bed/bath. Kids did have a small bath of their own with shower, which was great. Main bath was spacious, had two sinks & full tub. Nice breakfast buffet each morning. Small patio on Grand Canale if you can snag a seat. Very helpful staff directed us to laundry facility, made change for us, called for reservations, etc.. They provided private water taxi to free Murano glass factory tour. Nice ride (they let the kids take turns driving) and not high pressure at all. Very positive experience and would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, very comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: b85chevy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. It is on the grand canal, and has a courtyard on one side. It is very new inside, plush rooms, great A/C, comfy beds. Breakfast is good, staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: D_Nicole85
Reviews.Content: I went to Venice with my mother and we were originally booked to stay at Hotel Antiche Figure (which was extremely easy to find off the ATVO bus from Marco Polo Airport). We were told the room wasn't ready but that there was a room at their 4 star sister hotel, Hotel Canal Grande. A lovely porter Carlo took our luggage on the short trip to the hotel where we ended up staying. The room was absolutely gorgeous and a lot larger than I expected! I doubt you could find a better room at a better price. Our room was also located outside of the hotel (a few doors down), so it felt as if we had our own apartment in Venice to enjoy as we wished. Everyone at the hotel was extremely nice and helpful, gave us tips on what to see and where to go and made our stay pleasant and comfortable. The hotel was in a great location - 30 minute walk to the main attractions, 15 minutes by boat. The city was absolutely amazingly beautiful, and it was wonderful to have a room/hotel/staff that encompassed the charm and grace of Venezia! If I ever go to Venice again, no question in where I'll stay! There is also free wireless in the rooms, and if you didn't bring your laptop (why would you want to??), there is a laptop in the lobby for which they offer free usage.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Venice?”
Reviews.Author: pebe
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in the beginning of July and could not have chosen a better place to stay in Venice. Even if the hotel is situated right on the Canal Grande, the surroundings are very quiet. The staff immediately made us feel welcome and at home, and they were always there to help and answer our questions during our stay. The hotel has quite recently been restored and really turned out to be an 18th century gem, and both rooms and furniture were kept in the correct style for that period. All very stylish! A small terrace facing Canal Grande was a fantastic place to sit and watch the life on the canal. Sitting there waving back to all the people passing by in gondolas, taxi-boats and â€œvaporettosâ€� almost made us feel like celebrities. If you were lucky enough to have one of the three tables, you could also sit out there enjoying a very nice breakfast with more than enough to choose from. Getting back in the evenings after long and exhausting walks in Venice, the bar was a perfect place to sit and enjoy a beer or a glass of wine. We did not miss anything at this hotel, and the atmosphere was truly unique. If you fancy a pizza, try the pizzeria Allâ€™Anfora just around the corner. We had the biggest pizzas we have ever eaten. They were huge and very good! If you arrive in Venice at Piazzale Roma, the easiest way to reach the hotel is probably to take the vaporetto line no. 1 for two stops and get off at Riva di Biasio. Then after a two minutesâ€™ walk with no bridges to cross, you reach the hotel. This is definitely the place to stay in Venice, and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: IKH20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Canal Grande hotel for 4 days in June 2010. We were overwhelmed by the friendly and helpful Giovanna on the front desk, who assisted us in many ways. The room we stayed in was newly refurbished and was quiet and of a high standard. The location of the hotel was good, close to the railway and bus station and also one of the ferry stops. The breakfast served at the hotel was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “All that we expected it to be!!”
Reviews.Author: joyceBethesda_Md
Reviews.Content: Coming off a glorious cruise on the Crystal's Symphony, we couldn't have asked for a better ending to our trip. This was a trip I planned for myself, adult children, their spouses, and teenage children to celebrate my 80th birthday. The hotel was reasonable (by Venetian standards!) and looked charming in all the on-line ads. It was everything they said it was and more. The people on the front desk were delightful and most helpful in offering restaurant suggestions and ideas for interesting nearby attractions. The rooms were beautifully decorated and they even offered free internet connection, which made my grandson very happy!! Overall, a hotel to match the magical city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the movies.”
Reviews.Author: gfarmer668
Reviews.Content: The hotel was tooo cute. Rooms were comfy and decorated to a tee. We had a verandah looking out over the canal. Awesome. TV was hidden in the mirror; but who watches tv in Venice? Nice walk through pedestrian alleys to main square and Riolto Bridge. Water buses were too fun. The restaurant across the hotel was very nice too even if it was touristy. There seems to be more Americans in Venice than Italians; but it is an absolute must see city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Venice's best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Primaxia
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic one night stay at the Hotel Canal Grande. Having just arrived on the Orient Express, we were hoping for something which continued the levels of service and luxury we had experience on the train, and we were not disappointed! Our room overlooked the Grand Canal, and the four poster bed and ornate furnishings were terrific. The hotel is actually in a quiet square next to the Grand Canal, very peaceful and away from the crowds, but only a 5 minute walk to the railway station and 10 minutes from Piazzale Roma. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and recommended a couple of nearby restaurants to us. The Trattoria Povoledo opposite the hotel over the Grand Canal has a fantastic location and good value food. A real find is the nearby Pizzeria All'Anfora which serves superb pizzas and salads and has a great al fresco courtyard at the back of the restaurant â€“ and itâ€™s great value for money too. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Completely lived up to expectations and reviews”
Reviews.Author: MeqonTraveler
Reviews.Content: This newer boutique hotel is situated across from the train station but only a 10 minute vaperetto ride to Rialto. The previous reviews were very accurate. We had two rooms on the first (not ground) floor, a double and suite with sitting room. The bathrooms were spotless and in perfect order. The beds were extremely comfortable and the a/c works very well. The staff is extremely welcoming and helpful. The breakfast is just right. It's like having your own manor hose on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Perfection”
Reviews.Author: flynny_linny
Reviews.Content: There is a reason you will not read a bad review for this hotel. Quite simply, it is perfect! The staff are as friendly and helpful as it is possible to be, the location is spot on. Before our arrival, I explained to Giovanni that it was my Fiance's birthday, and I wanted a little surprise for her upon our arrival. Not only did she arrange a beautiful flower arrangement and Prosecco on ice, we were upgraded to a private suite - which was awesome! Book this hotel without hesitation, there is no better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “a jewel in Venice's crown”
Reviews.Author: nanajackie
Reviews.Content: Again, like many other travellers, we were originally booked in at the 3*sister hotel. On arrival we were offered the chance of an upgrade to this 4* gem. As we trundled across the cobblestones, not having any idea what the new place was like, I had a moments disquiet having spent many hours on Trip Advisor selecting a hotel. I need not have worried. Staying at the Hotel Canal Grande is a wonderful experience. From the moment you enter, the staff cannot do enough for you. Rooms are beautiful with every convenience to hand. Loved the television lurking behind a mirror. Breakfast is a typical buffet - an unhurried affair. Bellinis on the tiny terrace are a must. We watched enviously as a young couple from the hotel scrambled into a waiting gondola only to be handed champagne in an ice bucket from the bar!! The hotel is on the opposite side of the Grand Canal to the railway station in a quieter area. There is a small supermarket and chemist around the corner and a range of restaurants within easy reach. We arrived in style by water taxi but walked the 10/15 minutes to the Piazzale Roma to take the bus back to the airport. Thank you Hotel Canal Grande for a wonderful stay. I expect to see you No 1 in Trip Advisor before too long.

Reviews.Title: “THE RIGHT CHOICE,LOVED IT.”
Reviews.Author: Kwancha
Reviews.Content: Just loved this hotel.Staff is amazing,new hotel very elegantly done up in traditional venetian style.decent breakfast,Again very prompt and helpful staff..all of them at breakfast and at the reception.They give good advices on shows and restaurants..The Murano factory is a rip off..please buy behind the street of the train station..good prices.Location of the hotel is opposite the train station,very easy to get around on foot and water taxi. few stops to san marco square.[around 15 mins].fabulous hotel...but in Venice pay that extra for a room with a view of the grand canal...We had one and were very pleased with our decision...you can see all of the city go by just outside your window...Venice has become my favorite city in the world,and the 'Hotel canal grande',is surely one of the reasons why!.............Thank you guys.

Reviews.Title: “Canal Grande made my 1st trip to Venice unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: HelenSEEngland
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, staff, location and accomodation. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, you were made to feel totally comfortable and relaxed. This was my first trip to Venice and coupled with this amazing city, this hotel made my holiday. I would highly recommend the 'Canal Grande' to anyone seeking a top quality hotel for their visit to Venice. My room was beautifully presented with great care taken on the 'details'. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location and Easy to Get To”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegobirdlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Grand Canal very close to the railroad station. Just take a water taxi and they will deliver you and your luggage directly to the hotel's private dock. Then, get a water bus ticket for the days you will be there. These are hop on, hop off buses that operate all day and night. The views from the water bus change with the time of day. Night time is magical! And, the hotel was superb. Excellent service, excellent breakfast buffet, large size and quality of rooms and bathrooms, use of English, ease in finding and proximity to everything were all beyond our expectations. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamb637
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Canal Grande recently and were very pleased!! The hotel staff was wonderful, breakfast service was the best of our vacation. Wonderful charming neighborhood behind the hotel with great dining options. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly is a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Jmecaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 10-13th June 2010 and what a great place! The location is superb and although it is slightly away from the main tourist trap its a brilliant location as by walking to see the sights you find lots of other litte treats on the way. I loved the location, loved the hotel and loved Venice. The 4 of us (2 couples) had an amazing time and the hotel staff couldnt have been more helpfull whcih was great. I would 100% recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: thelows2
Reviews.Content: A fun, girly few days away was more than perfect with our surprise up-grade to Canal Grande. Two of us had never visited Venice and I, having stayed in many top quality hotels in Europe when accompanying my husband on business trips, was very pleasantly surprised. This 4 * hotel offered so much more than any 5* hotel that I have visited. Staff from management through to room cleaning staff were so friendly and helpful. The high quality rooms ( I recommend room 406-so quiet, no need to use the ear-plugs which were also provided!!) and the hotel setting made our 3 day visit more than perfect. We were made to feel so welcome and special. Having returned home last night I could not wait to tell all about our gem of a find, it was like being given a Business-Class upgrade on B.A. I can't wait to return with my husband and let him enjoy the same experience. ADVICE TO ALL FUTURE VISITORS: A Bellini cocktail on the terrace Good rain-proof walking shoes Pack a mac even in June!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sinohe
Reviews.Content: We loved this small hotel. We had our breakfast or afternoon coffee next to the grand canal and watching boats and gondolas passing by...aahh it was so relaxing... For some unknown reason we had to change our room for the second night, and I didn't like that part. Nevertheless, they kindly upgraded our room to the junior suit which compensated for the inconvenience and moved our stuff themselves. That was a nice treat... The staff were very courteous and welcoming. Oh, and the room design is totally unique and enhanced our experience in Venice. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I could have imagined”
Reviews.Author: OxfordshireChicker
Reviews.Content: My partner took me to Venice as a surprise for my birthday. We spent four nights in this hotel which he found on the internet. This place is a real find - clean, tidy and classy but not a bit pompous. We were made to feel very welcome and our room (Casenova) at the top of the building was lovely, we just took time to watch the comings and goings on the canal - wonderful. I know the hotel has only been open 8 months but I hope it retains its character as we would love to re visit - especially as we are now getting married following the romantic proposal in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “EXQUISITE, ROYAL TREATMENT...!!!”
Reviews.Author: BRDIAZ11
Reviews.Content: The best service in all of the hotels we stayed at. Rooms are very quaint and extremely clean. The staff is one of the most (if not the most) friendly and caring staff we have encountered.We had breakfast( BEST capuccinos) every morning in their little dock overlooking the Grand Canal. Romantic and mesmerizing Venice comes alive first through the windows of this small but fascinating hotel, Every member of the staff makes you feel like royalty....

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: BaileyBear18
Reviews.Content: I went to Venice with my family on vacation, and I had an amazing time at Hotel Canal Grande! It was my favorite hotel out of all the hotels I stayed in in Europe. I loved the interiors of the room, which gave a very pretty, elegant feel. However, my parents were a little disappointed because they got a suite, and their bedroom and bathroom were smaller than the ones in the regular room. It was fairly noiseless at night, so I had a good night's rest. Another thing I loved about this hotel was the free WiFi in the bedroom. It was absolutely delightful! Other more expensive hotels still charge for WiFi! The staff were incredibly friendly and made us feel very welcome. The manager, female with brown, curly hair, was especially hospitable and helpful. The only downside I could think about this hotel is that the breakfast wasn't superb. It just consisted of some bread and some cereal. It was good enough though. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Venice. I had such an unforgettably wonderful experience in this hotel. Maybe someday I'd be able to return! :)

Reviews.Title: “What an upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: GreatSouthernLand5
Reviews.Content: Did not have high expectations of Venice hotels generally but was upgraded to this absolute gem on arrival to the Hotel Antiche Figure. Reception staff and Lorenzo were extremely friendly and the breakfast ladies were fabulous! Our room was small but opulent and we loved the TV mirror! Great location right on the Grand Canal and just across the canal from the railway station. Breakfast was included and had a great selection with real Italian coffee! Free water taxi to Murano is recommended. Would highly recommend this new hotel as a welcoming retreat that is easy to find in the Venice maze!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed.”
Reviews.Author: gizm0sm0m
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are outstanding and are truly its strength. We were warmly greeted when we arrived and rather than just handing us a map, the person at the front desk took 10 minutes out of her time to explain to us all of the things to see and do. The service knocked our socks off. The quality of the room itself was excellent. It was very clean, the bed was comfortable and though very small, both the room and the bathroom were more than adequate. The only complaint I have about this hotel is the noise level. We were not in the main building, but had a room in one of the separate buildings. The front door has to be buzzed open by the front desk people and each time they did it it would wake us up. Even though people walking through were trying to be quiet it was nearly impossible to get through the building without creating a racket on the marble floors. The echo in the halls was incredible. I think a nice padded runner on the stairs and some padded carpets in the hall would take care of that problem nicely. Other than that, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Mikey0308
Reviews.Content: We booked our room online with their "sister hotel" - Antiche Figure. When we arrived, we were told that we had been given an upgrade to a better room in a newly renovated hotel not far away. I was originally a bit sceptical but agreed to look at the room. The room was fantastic! We had plenty of space, great views, free wireless internet and hearty breakfasts each morning. However, the best feature of this hotel is the staff. The concierge (Gianni, I think), was very friendly and very helpful. The hotel is enough to make your stay in Venice memorable but it's the staff who made our trip special. When we needed to get ourselves to the port to embark on our cruise, Gianni arranged for us to share a water-taxi (normally very expensive) with another couple from the Anitche Figure. Even after we had checked out, they stored our luggage while we went out and then arranged for a glass of wine while we waited for the taxi. The hotel is a very short walk to the train station, the vaporetto stop and Piazzale Roma. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: dlun
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Venezia, and find numerous tourists really distress us. Hotel is therefore so important to give us some sanity and peace. So spending more money on a good hotel is worth it. Hotel Canal Grande is great. We originally booked to the sister hotel : Hotel Antiche Figure. We have been upgrade to this one, which is really great. Internet is free which is good for me. Breakfast is nice. Room is very quiet. One additional good feature : very close to train and bus station. So you don't need to drag you luggage along the narrow streets of Venice. Room is a bit small, but this is Europe afterall.

Reviews.Title: “The best place we've stayed so far”
Reviews.Author: The_Fatts
Reviews.Content: There isn't anything to fault about the Hotel Canal Grande. From the moment we arrived till the day we checked out, the stay were always friendly, helpful and very attentive. They offered suggestions with places to go, eat, how to travel around, and even assisted us with making reservations for dinner. The rooms were absolutely stunning and immaculately cleaned. Very hard to find a speck of dust or dirt anywhere. We spent the first 2 nights in a small room on the top floor. The room was very nice but we wanted to splurge a little and asked if we could upgrade on our last 2 nights. The receptionist was very helpful and gave us a good rate for the upgrade. When we moved to our new room, we just had to pack our stuff and all the luggage was moved for us while we were out. The upgraded room was extremely lavish and we definitely felt spoilt. After leaving this hotel, nothing else quite compares to the level of service and quality offered here. Definitely would book here if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: natty33
Reviews.Content: Outstanding, friendly service! Before I even arrived at the hotel, someone who worked with the hotel company helped escort me to my hotel. The entire staff was wonderful! I was upgraded to a suite when I checked in. The room was BEAUTIFUL and truly amazing! It was clean, beautifully decorated, and spacious. The location was very convenient. It was close to the train station, so I didn't have to lug my luggage too far over the countless bridges. I have stayed in some very high end hotels, and this was the NICEST hotel I have stayed in! I wish I could give it higher rankings. I want to go back to Venice, just so I can stay there again. The breakfast was delicious, including the blood-orange-juice. I wish I was there now!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation with FRIENDLY professional service”
Reviews.Author: traveler60ny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively brand new and in excellent condition. What really makes a difference is the staff which is always friendly and helpful. The location is quite good in that it is an easy walk (with rolling luggage) from river taxis, buses, and trains. The walk to the Rialto, San Marco and Accadamea (sp?) locations is a nice 10-15 minutes. In those 15 minutes you pass through REAL venetian neighbohoods. One evening we got to sit in a piazza (with prosecco) and watch the families celebrate a boy's birthday. For us, visiting other people is more than the museums. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Don't look further and go there”
Reviews.Author: eh_tonnant_voyageur
Reviews.Content: Hotel Canal Grande is: 1. The kindest, warmest, most caring service, from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. Thank you Gianni, the â€œbreakfast girlsâ€�, and all the staff. Any possibility that you could do some consulting for some hotels I know in France? 2. A quiet location, away from the tourist hustle. Donâ€™t be afraid to be so far on the map from San Marco, it takes around 30â€™ either by Vaporetto or by foot to go there. 3. A (very) small but nicely decorated and spotless room. Very comfortable bed, hot shower both in American and European style. We had as well a small terrace (I think that there is only one room like that), which unfortunately we could not fully appreciate due to the rainy weather, however, it must be wonderful to seat and look at the boat traffic on Canal Grande during summer time. Note the TV hidden in a Venetian mirror, a smart decoration trick. 4. Santa Croce is a nice vicinity, with a couple of restaurants in the nearby which are way less of a rip off than what you would find, say, around the Rialto or San Marco. 5. THE PLACE TO GO.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: MishB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, the location is perfect, the staff friendly, the rooms luxurious and well appointed. We enjoyed it so much we didn't want to leave, I would certainly stay there again. I could post photos, but as it is exactly as it appears in the hotel's photos it seems pointless. The only thing missing to make it absolutely perfect is restaurant so there would be no need to leave the hotel at all!

Reviews.Title: “"One of the best experiences I've had"...retired international flight attendant.”
Reviews.Author: Normagal
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviews...the staff, Johnny, and all the others were so committed to giving us quality and value. They were all about making sure we were SATISFIED...We loved the location because we came in on the train. Walking to the hotel was a short distance from the Santa Lucia Station. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. Breakfast was very adequate!

Reviews.Title: “Better than 5*!!”
Reviews.Author: Nina N
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I spent the first two nights of our honeymoon at the Hotel Canal Grande and it really was fantastic. By far the friendliest welcome we have had from any hotel, ever! We had a junior suite overlooking a courtyard and the rooms were great; decorated in typical ventian style the place was spotless. Not so much as a suitcase scuffmark on the wall! We had a very romantic four-poster bed and the mattress was incredibly firm and comfy - I slept 12 hours straight on the first night and awoke totally refreshed and ready to explore Venice. Broadband was free which was great for us as we were keen to keep checking our facebook accounts for new wedding photos as our guests added them! The mini bar was well stocked and we were pleasantly surprised by the price when we left. It wasn't dirt cheap but not at all bad compared to some rip-off hotels. The hotel is very well situated to explore and close to the train station. Be sure to ask the receptionist about the free taxi service from outside the hotel to Murano to see glassblowers at work. A few years ago I stayed at the Europa and Regina in Venice which is 5* and extremely expensive, and I can safely say that the Hotel Canal Grande is FAR superior. We paid about Â£250 for two nights B&B at the Canal Grande which I thought was very reasonable considering the high standard of the hotel, the good location and the stunning rooms. We will never stay anwhere else in Venice again. You will not regret booking this hotel. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Staff - no need to look any further”
Reviews.Author: gogens
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, you do a lot of research about where to stay. I can say without hesitation that you don't need to look any further. I have stayed in many, many hotels around the world and I can say that the staff at both this hotel, and the Antiche Figure, outshine the others. At no time did I ever feel it was a result of them doing their job...it was more that they were genuine and passionate and 'got it' in terms of what the benefit of great customer service is. They should have a side business of consulting to the large luxury hotel chains! The other nice benefit is that they have modern and very clean rooms. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend these two hotels to any of my friends or family. Yes, the price is high but that is Venice and not specific to this hotel. And yes, it would be nice if it was closer to the 'main' attractions but half the fun of Venice is walking around and exploring. The only suggestion I would have for them is to try and get more english speaking tv channels to reflect the global travellors they have. This hotel is one of the few where I can honestly say that the official star rating for them is too small...5 star staff turn these into 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: mdirelandmd
Reviews.Content: A fantastic little hotel where the personal touch was more than just a sales pitch,the staff from arrival to leaving were fantastic helpful ,courteous ,unobtrusive..We had an amazing trip to Venice this hotel was in an excellent position for exploring the city ,what a haven to return to after a long day walking through this amazing place when you were greeted with a warm welcome on your return,this hotel made our Venice trip.We will stay here again on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Avisius
Reviews.Content: The other reviews have said it all really, a perfect hotel in a perfect location. The staff are helpful and the rooms immaculate. Watch out for the 100 euro water taxi, its easy to catch the bus and a vaparetto for a fraction of the price. If you are going to Venice ..stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and service...”
Reviews.Author: andrewII
Reviews.Content: If you wish to find an hotel close to the train station, where the room are well appointed and the staff is very nice and helpful... This is the place for you. I will be back there next time I'm in Venice. Thanks for the wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with my family!!!”
Reviews.Author: mike_eastcoast
Reviews.Content: My wife, two daughters and I stayed three nights in April 2010 after visiting Rome based on the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. I needed a hotel near the train station where we arrived and the bus terminal for our early morning departure. The reviews were very accurate. We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Canal Grande. Giovanna and the staff were very helpful and professional. The entire hotel was renovated especially the rooms which were beautifully decorated in the Venitian style. The two bathrooms were a big plus traveling with two kids. Breakfast with capucinno was great. This hotel was a nice change from our old and sparse hotel in Rome. Walking to the Rialto Bridge and San Marco was an easy 20 minute walk with signs clearly marking the way. We also bought a two water shuttle pass. The shuttle stop was two minutes away. If you want to enjoy Venice, I recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE WITH A TOP NOTCH STAFF”
Reviews.Author: LANCE558
Reviews.Content: Clean quiet & romantic hotel with a staff that was professional & available 24 hrs a day. Good breakfast with a cozy atmosphere to start your day.Beautiful views of the canal from canal side rooms and bench in courtyard . Train station across canal approx 5 - 10 min walk , bus station is only another 5 - min, with food available within the same area.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR US”
Reviews.Author: sammuella
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel in part due to the reviews on trip advisor and we were'nt disappointed. The hotel is small and friendly - perfect if you just want to explore venice and return to a lovely room but don't expect a wealth of amenities. It does have its own landing dock and provides free wifi - also a computer at recepton if you don't have one. We had a disaster getting to venice as the italian airports went on strike - so we arrived around ten hours late - and we ended up arriving at venice train station - boy were we glad that the hotel was a short walk over the bridge from there saving us from having to catch the ferries after an exhausting day. It also came in handy when we left as we could walk to the bus/land taxi terminal - saving a lot on a private water taxi. The direct bus was 3 euros each. We also caught the train to verona for the day anf the hotels location again helped. Some people would prefer a location closer to san marco etc, however we explored a lot more of the city from this base just getting to the main attractions - it also had a lot more of the "real" city - coffee bars, shop etc. The room itself is lovely - not huge but very romantic. The breakfast is also pretty good for a continental buffet! The only complaint - no room service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful remodeled hotel with spacious bathrooms, near the train station.”
Reviews.Author: pduell
Reviews.Content: We had initially made reservations with the Hotel Antiche Figure, directly across the canal from the train station. When we checked in they asked if we'd like to see their newest property, the Hotel Canal Grande. We were skeptical at first, but we walked over and were given a tour of a comparable room, for the same price, on the second floor. While we were offered a room with a canal view for an additional cost, the comparable room was lovely (though average-sized), the bathroom large, and the staff was very friendly and offered to bring our bags from the Antiche Figure...so we chose that room and stayed. The breakfast room downstairs overlooks the grand canal, and offers the traditional selection of pastries, meats, and boiled eggs (you can order cooked eggs for a separate fee) with a very attentive waitstaff. The only complaint we had was that the wireless internet in the room was spotty, and eventually went down. The staff knew about it and assured me they were working to get it operational asap, but it took about a day and a half. There is a computer that guests can use in the lobby, and I was offered the use of the front desk computer as well. A tip: although the hotel is "just down the canal" from bridge leading to the train station (which is a fine area, BTW, and not as dodgy as some people make it out to be), if you are walking, it's about a 10+ minute walk back inland, and then back to the canal, to get there. If you are carrying your own luggage, just be aware there are lots of stairs! Because our flight out of Venice was early in the AM, the front desk suggested we hire someone to help transport the bags to a car, then to the airport, for about 60 euros. The gentleman they called for us was on time, great, and brought our bags all the way to the check-in desk at the airport for us. Well worth the cost. Obviously there are water taxis for those with larger budgets!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location (if you can find it. Actually, it's not that hard!)”
Reviews.Author: StamfordRaffles
Reviews.Content: Owned by the people who own Hotel Antiche Figure, this is further down the Grand Canal and very near a vaporetto stop. It's slightly tricky to find the first time but within easy walking distance of the railway station and the bus station, which means, of course, you only have to follow the 'Ferrovia signs' to be heading towards your hotel. The room was smaller than I expected and decor very 'Venetian', but then rooms in Venice are notoriously small and the use of velvets and murano glass hard for hotels to resist. The service was very friendly, the staff speak English and will humour one's attempts at Italian. The guests were a mix of American, European and Japanese. Since it's not a big hotel that more or less meant one or two families of each! Will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with friendly, funny and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: zubora
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming hotel over Easter weekend and were immediately taken by the friendly and humorous staff. We had to wait a few minutes for the room to be ready (we arrived around noon) and were treated to a complimentary spritzer while we waited in the luxurous parlor. Our room was very clean and decorated in Venetian style which in my mind very much added to the whole feeling of being in romantic Venice. There were plenty of amenities as well - the breakfast was freshly made each morning and we caught the complimentary hotel boat from the canal right outside the hotel to Murano. If we go back to Venice, we'll definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: dukegirls
Reviews.Content: I had the daunting task of choosing a hotel in Venice. We had never been there and Trip Advisor listed over 700 hotels were available. We chose Canal Grande because of its 4 star rating and fantastic pricing. We were overjoyed when we arrived. The entire 15 suite hotel has been recently renovated. Our "Doge" suite overlooked the canal. The room was tastefully decorated with a draped four poster bed, hardwood floors, television located within the mirror, and beautiful damask wallpaper. The bathroom was totally modern and large. Outside our suite was a beautiful sitting area for the two suites to share. The service provided was unparalleled. Giovanna and the staff catered to our needs and made sure everything was perfect. The morning breakfast was a great way to start each day. The location is close to the train station, so you don't have to pack your luggage far. This hotel was a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Friendly staff, Quiet location, Close to Idyllic”
Reviews.Author: mccarthy140
Reviews.Content: What can I say except that our stay exceeded my expectations. I was a little worried when booking because this is a new hotel, open only since October 2009, but it obviously has an experienced owner and staff. Nicely decorated. Decent breakfast with fresh breads, meats and cheeses and eggs to order if desired. Rooms are clean and quiet, located next to a sizable Campo and church a lovely bell tower. This campo even hosted a accordion player one evening. It may seem like an out-of the way location, but it is so close to the bus and train station that it makes arriving and leaving Venice extremely easy. Conveniently located between two vaporetto stops, we didn't feel hindered from exploring any part of Venice and could easily walk to Rialto and San Marco if we chose to. The staff is extremely helpful, offering to meet us and help us with our bags when we arrived from the train station. Giving advice on dining out, directions, etc. Even arranging a trip to Murano island to visit a glass factory. Word of caution here: They take you to the Signoretti factory and the tour is fascinating, but the glass is very expensive. Make sure you get a certificate of authenticity if you buy something as this factory is not part of the Murano glass consortium. Nothing really negative to say except minor glitches with their automatic lighting system in the room and the wireless internet in the room isn't very fast and requires login upon every access (quite annoying!). Other than that I would definitely stay here again and will recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “VIP treatment”
Reviews.Author: damwim
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Antique Figure opposite the railway station Santa Lucia. When entering the hotel the manager greated us and asked if we would like an upgrade to a room in this hotel instead. After checking a couple of rooms at hotel Canal Grande the choice was very easy to make. We selected a room in the annex since it could be arranged into a twin bed room. The room could not be faulted. The room was brand new and finished to a high spec. The location also made the room very quiet at night. The staff was very friendly and made a great effort to make us feel as welcome as possible. We were offered to take a boat trip to Murano but we opted not to, since we have read what others have to say about their experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful canal views at the Hotel Canal Grande”
Reviews.Author: GirlandBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights and we loved it. The location we found to be perfect for us, an easy 5 mins walk from the train station and Vapparato stop. There were plenty of places to eat nearby and it's not too far from the main tourist sites of Venice. As soon as we arrived we decided to walk to St Mark's and had fun trying to get lost (it was more difficult than we had expected!). We treated ourselves to a canal view room and were so glad we did, it was well worth the extra charge. The staff were all excellent and breakfast very good. Fantastic decor in the rooms too and a great shower.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natashaa1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the great reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed at all. The Hotel in conveniently located on the grand canal, within easy walking distance of all the major sites and also has great transport links. The staff were extremely friendly and the service was brilliant. We stayed in a junior suit and had a bathroom with 2 sinks as well as a shower room. The room was beautifully decorated and we had a wonderful stay. I would definitely highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was amazing”
Reviews.Author: gabrielmiami
Reviews.Content: The service is outstanding, the rooms are clean and beautiful. The breakfast is great. The staff was very helpful with a lot of information and recommendations. I would definitely stay there again if I travel to Venice in the future and I will recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “More than a dream come true...”
Reviews.Author: OzlemIstanbulTurkey
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we visited Venice with my husband and it was also the Carnival time. The Hotel is amazing in every way! The location is perfect and the room we stayed at had a wonderful view of the Grand Canal. The Staff is very friendly and helpful. They help you with anything you ask for. There is nothing much to stay other than don't even think twice if you are planning to go Venice - stay at the Hotel Canal Grande...

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionnal”
Reviews.Author: disenador
Reviews.Content: Outstanding room with an amazing bed (lit Ã  baldaquin), beautiful old-school venetian interior design, great view on the canal, delicious breakfast, very friendly staff, very convenient neighbourhood (close to train station yet calm and in the heart of the old venice).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully special hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Canal Grande for three nights at the end of January and frankly it was one of the most pleasurable experiences we've had. The hotel is a small, comfortable and exceptionally clean place towards the northwest of Venice, about 10mins walk from Palazze Roma (where all the buses from the airport / mainland stop) or about 5mins walk from the train station. The staff at the hotel were unbelievably welcoming upon our arrival, and helped us get settled in very quickly and efficiently. As it was our first trip to Venice, we were given a helpful description of how to get around (including advice on the right tickets to buy for the waterbuses, which stops to take and what lines to catch), we were given a map of town where the manager helpfully pointed out the main things to see in town, and we were offered a tour of neighbouring Murano if we wanted. As I mentioned, the hotel was exceptionally clean!!!! We had booked a "special" room with canal view (the hotel is on the grand canal of course) and we were offered a choice of room and helpfully shown to each by the porter. Our room overlooked the canal bank, was wonderfully decorated, was warm and had a fantastic ensuite with a great shower. Everything you'd expect in the room was there, minibar, tv, internet, safe etc etc. Be warned: the hotel doesn't offer catering other than basic cheese sandwiches through room service or the bar, so please don't expect a sit down lunch dinner. There are plenty of restaurants within 10mins walking distance (including a fantastic local takeaway with the best pizza i've ever had). There is a breakfast on offer, mainly warmed breads / buns, spreads, cold meats and boiled eggs. Coffee is available (on the house) 24/7. We met three different night teams on each of the nights we were there, but each member of staff was exceptionally polite, welcoming and helpful. Finally, in terms of location, do not be put off by how far the hotel seems from the main tourist attractions - it really isn't! And the fact that the hotel is on the edge of town is a good thing as you're away from the noise and chaos at night time, but during the day Per Rialto is about 10mins by waterbus and San Marco is about 25mins. In addition, if you need to get back to Marco Polo airport, this hotel is walking distance from the bus stop so it saves a lot of hassle! Eventhough you may be looking to visit Venice to see the town rather than stay in a great hotel, do consider this hotel as a place to stay as they are truly fantastic. They made our trip just that extra bit special, and next time I visit Venice I will be going straight back here!

Reviews.Title: “Venice as it should be”
Reviews.Author: JamesNorri
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotel we've ever stayed at! Great location, great room, great view, great breakfast. Unbelievable value. The management and staff made us feel so welcome, without a doubt we would return again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Skates_traveller
Reviews.Content: The Canal Grande is an amazing hotel with the best staff I have ever encountered. I stayed here with my fiance in Janaury and we were treated better than we could have dreamt. Throughout our stay we were taken care of, especially when I was ill. The building is beautiful and situated right on the Grand Canal, just minutes from the railway station. The rooms are sumptuous, with tasteful, luxurious decor and glorious bathrooms. The price is also excellent. This is better than most 5 star hotels in Venice and I'll be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with the friendliest staff we have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Citybreakers_10
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel made our trip even more enjoyable and easy. From the instructions directing us from the bus terminal, to the restaruant suggestions, we found them very helpful; nothing was too much trouble. The room was great and kept very clean, breakfast was fresh and plentiful and, although not right on the Rialto bridge or by St. Mark's square, the location was very easy to navigate from and conveiniently placed. We both thoroghly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amusing pastiche of Venetian luxury”
Reviews.Author: alexkorf
Reviews.Content: Pretty good new hotel almost opposite the railway station and a short walk from Piazzale Roma parking lots. It really stands out among other sometimes dodgy lodgings in this not very glamorous part of Venice. Nevertheless, it's on the cosy little piazza right on the Grand Canal, with the obligatory gondolas bobbing near the front steps. Everything in the rooms and public areas is new, nice and clean. Personnel appears cheerful and well-trained, happy to provide little extras like late breakfast. In short, the hotel does everything a good hotel should do. However, you would never mistake it for a proper Venetian luxury hotel. It was made to look like one by someone who decided to put together in smallish rooms everything that's "Venetian". Murano glass lamps? Sure! Fake antique writing desk? Put it right here! Massive gilded mirror frames? Can't go wrong with it! Baldachin over a bed? Why not! The result is rather oriental in its fake opulence and is absolutely hilarious to look at. It's not really bad, but when staying more than a weekend the joke may wear a bit thin.

Reviews.Title: “A real dream”
Reviews.Author: Dawia
Reviews.Content: If you come to Venice for its charm and beauty, there is no better place to start your visit with. This hotel captures an unique atmosphere of golden age of Venice and also provides you with all modern cons you may require. Hotel`s website provides very clear directions of 10 min walk from the bus stop. The staff are very frendly, welcoming and provide guidence to make your stay in Venice a very special one. Rooms are beautifuly decorated, defenetly made me feel that I am living a dream. We have stayed in Vivaldi suite with 2 bathrooms :) Breakfast room has one of the most beautiful views for the canal, hotel itself is just by it in a quiet location. We got engaged in Venice and we `ll defenetly stay here again on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “La Serenissima: Hotel Canal Grande”
Reviews.Author: Redoctober312
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel steps from the Scalzi bridge and the train station, located in a quiet piazza. Gianni was a gracious and informative host. The breakfast was ample and the service polite and thoughtful. I stayed in the Goldoni room. A special Venetian dream. Spotless and perfectly appointed. I highly recommend this hotel and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Rooms, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: fashionphotog
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked our rooms at the Hotel Antiche Figure, however when we arrived at the hotel the manager told us that he had another hotel that they were attempting to fill with guests right down the street, it was another property that they owned that had recently opened up. .He told us that if we wanted to stay there instead of the Antiche Figure he would upgrade everyone's rooms. When we saw the property and the rooms, we just couldn't say no. The manager put us in four incredible rooms beautifully decorated in an antique Venetian style, yet with very modern facilities.. ie Wireless.. flat screen tv's hidden behind mirrors etc, plus the rooms had amazing views onto the canal, or the square... which was wonderfully quiet. This place is beautiful... I would highly reccomend staying here.. especially if you are American.. the service of the staff is completely up to par with American standards.. and on that matter they excel on sevice standards..
